;;;;;I've been using this phone for several weeks and it's holding up very good knowing it has such a small Snapdragon processor. Recently I updated to the Windows 10 Mobile Fall Creators Update, Build Version 1709; OS Build 10.0.15254.1. I'm using a  Samsung 128 GB sd card in it which makes the File Explorer load a little slow while strolling, but Groove Music along with the other media apps hold up suprisingly good! The screen feels a little sticky but has fairly good resolution. The camera resolution sucks along with it loading slow! But very nice phone otherwise!;;;;;Thanks for the reply! I never ran Windows Insider but thought I might with this phone, but now I guess I won't. You said you might get another phone?.........make sure you keep it Windows!!!:);;;;;Don't get to excited, if you are using the Windows Insider Program. My phone will only updates under Current branch. The fast or slow hasn't worked in four months. The overall phone is not bad, but I get the feeling that we will be buying another phone shortly.;;;;;I'm getting a  Alcatel Fierce XL in the next couple weeks for $40 off of ebay. Right now I have a Samsung Ativ S Neo (Windows Phone 8, updated to 8.1). The reason I'm getting this phone is because it is a Windows 10 Mobile. I would've liked to get a Microsoft Lumia 650 but the price was a little high. Anyway I was watching YouTube videos of the Fierce XL and it seemed everyone's biggest problem about Windows 10 Mobile is the app gap! Personally I don't think it's that bad with my 8.1, and my brother has a Microsoft Lumia 640 (Windows 10 Mobile) and he doesn't complain about it either!:) So if you're looking into buying a Windows Phone and the app gap is what 
you're worried about, go ahead and buy that Windows because 
you'll always be able to find an app somewhere in the Store 
that'll make up for the other app on iOS or Android!;;;;;quick reply,  which of the slots are for the simcard slot?;;;;;Next year when a 2 year old phone will be dropped from support from Microsoft ,you will stop being a Windows fan.;;;;;I had a Lumia 640 and switched to this phone. I am a Windows Phone Fan. However, after a period of 6 months, I am going back to my Lumia 640. Personally the phone and the Apps are made for Lumia aka Microsoft Products. In addition to this : I purchased my Lumia as a AT&T phone, XDA shows how to Flash the Rom to T mobile. Suddenly I had a phone that works as it should on T mobile, It is a long process but well worth it. So if your a windows phone fan : Get Lumia or Microsoft based phones.  The Apps DO NOT work correctly on other brands and limited. Even the Camera Apps both at 8 Mega pixel, the Lumia is Way above in quality and over all speed. I just wish I would have gotten a XL. However the 1520 for AT&T does not have LTE support for T mobile as the band is off and no wireless charging , NEW : you can turn on the T mobile Band for the Lumia 1520, Saving money to get me one!!! the super phone! No Phone to date has the specs of this phone!!! Check the Specs of the Lumia 1520, : Special info : there are 1520.1, 1520.2, 1520.3 versions. The .3 is for T Mobile. At&T Rom Version is 940 T mobile is 938. Have a Good Day Windows People!;;;;;Seems like a good and honest phone.;;;;;Dearest all.With this price tag and specifications,very good for children to know what Microsoft Windows 10 is!!!Why!!!?An average income person worldwide must sell their house to buy one of those Microsoft $3000+ tablets !!!So,Alcatel (of China now!) has done a good job!!A Windows smartphone under $ 80 much lesser selling someone,s house!!!So,tasting Windows is fun too,while android dominance is above 95%/ of all smartphone products!!!Amazing!No!!!?Omid12Omidvar,....;;;;;I kinda like this phone;;;;;I'm very happy with the Windows10 by T mobile along with Alcatel and I am so glad that they didn't do a big advertising campaign for the phone because that made it possible to send savings to the buyers Good Great Phone;;;;;I haven't found this set in stores in Europe yet, is it even available in Europe already? ;;;;;Where can I buy it in Europe;;;;;Does have FM Radio (Got mine through T-Mobile) Working well with 64 gb micro SD card Windows Groove music has no graphic eq or other preset sounds Does not have replaceable batter even thought the case separates for SIM card and SD insertion. Very happy with my new phone;;;;;release quickly it seems a great phone;;;;;Good phone, affordable, Windows 10;;;;;The Fierce XL comes in both variants, Android and now Windows 10. I don't think any Windows phone customers will pick up the Android by mistake.;;;;;and no android and ios game can match the age of empire castle siege on wp :P;;;;;$129.00 at Walmart.;;;;;Rightly said ;;;;;I wonder what the price will be;;;;;2GB Ram, better than lumia in mid-end. phone_reviews:
;;;;;ummm.. on my opinion this phone quite awesome .  actually I've bought this one a year ago and I used it for playing online gaming  it's good .. but, the thing is  I cant upgrade the Version of it.  THANK YOU for the service;;;;;Soooo....... umm........ Anybody gonna mention the fact the battery isn't removable or we just gonna ignore that fact....?  Yours Truly, The Observ@nt J@ck@$$;;;;;The only problem i have is the ram, 1gb, and the worst is it still has android 5.1;;;;;I have a lot of things to say about this phone. Let's start with arguably the most important part of a smartphone, the display: The display will never be considered by anyone as "crisp". 540x960 is a lackluster resolution, especially for a 6 inch screen. You can only play youtube videos in 480p at most. Alcatel should really have considered at least a 1280x720 resolution for a phone this big. Sound is also not in good condition. I'm not sure if only my phone has this problem or if all the models of this phone has it. Apparently the phone has 2 hidden sound modes, loud and soft. It switches between them at random moments. Theres nothing you can really do about it and can be really annoying if there are people nearby and you don't want them to know you have shit taste in music and watch chinese cartoons. This occurs with both speakers and earphones, just so you know. Build is also subpar at best. The weight is alright, not heavy at all. That also means that it feels cheap (not really a major concern to be honest). The texture of the touchscreen is bizarre. It's relatively rough for a phone. It feels like paper made for watercoloring when i put my finger on it. I needed to put a screen protector just to make it feel like glass (thankfully it comes with one... or at least mine did). I had a mindset for phones that bigger is better (to a point). And it seems like 6 inches is a little bit past my point. I have humongous hands, as in I have never met anyone who has bigger hands than mine. My hand fell a bit short in reaching the left side of the phone as it is wider than most phones. And if most of your pockets are small, this phone will bulge and stand out as if you have a rather large chocolate bar in your pants. But at least the display is big, if only it was better though. 
And now i have to talk about the ugh, camera. The autofocus in this thing is horrendous, it goes out of way to actually defocus the image. No one would ever believe that the photo you take with this phone is actually 1080p. I couldn't take a photo of my textbook 10 inches away from it for my classmate as the text blurred out and rendered unreadable. A 2 megapixel camera could produce way better photos in my opinion. The flash function is just plain broken. As the phone produces the flash, the photo was taken a few milliseconds late and the light from the flash would have already been gone. There are actually no difference in the image if flash was turned on or off.
 
The software is the only thing that's alright with this phone. Didn't expect much and what I got is alright, it did most of the tasks i did alright. But don't expect to play intensive games on this. There are some 3D games that run pretty good on this phone, but games like Injustice is just way out of its reach. The User Interface icons of this phone is ugly. They look like blurry candy. But at least you can download some themes from the playstore. The UI on the music player isn't to my fancy either so i downloaded a separate music player.
 
The connectivity of this phone is good though. I live in SE Asia, so it can vary if you live somewhere else.
 
I've had this phone for 7 months now. And it has survived a dozen drops and impacts. But unfortunately I think it has reached its limit. The bottom keys do not respond anymore and the phone is registering touches even when no one is touching it. the e, b, r letters on my keyboard doesn't work anymore (installing a different keyboard might fix it though).
 
Conclusion/TL;DR: 
Alcatel has made some great phones. But this is not even near that with all these cons and (hopefully just) broken hardware and no features, function, or specs that can make you choose this over alternatives at this price point or even cheaper. I suggest you take your money elsewhere and heavily consider a phone smaller (or slimmer) than this one as a phone this size can prove difficult and discomfortable.
 
Sorry if i made a "review" for an opinion section for a budget phone, but I really needed to express these thoughts and hopefully some people will find this helpful in making their decision.;;;;;This phone is cool, bat i have a problem always tearn off . This is night my phone in 3 hours tern on and send my a  mesige vith a this phrase  "ALCATEL onetouch smart move. I do not know what to do?;;;;;bad screen;;;;;I have this phone last December 8, 2016. This phone is awesome! Good camera and battery. I just ;;;;;this phone is great! ;;;;;I got this unit this October thinking its better than my previous Idol unit but somehow I am left disappointed. The audio is so weak I can hardly hear its ringtone and message alert even when I'm holding it! ;;;;;is it still working great :);;;;;Nice one big screen works smoothley;;;;;Am I supposed to love a 184 ppi display?;;;;;What is up with this naming?

phone_reviews:
;;;;;The phone is rubbish apps and games keep not responding all the time ;;;;;Or disable in Settings- Apps;;;;;SLOWER/ WORSE SPEC than the PIXI 3.   BEWARE of you buy from Car phone warehouse, that's the low memory version (Mike reports only 2GB internal) Terrible battery life, about a day after 3 months use (used to be 3 with background data disabled) And the hands free speaker is very distorted.  I'm not usually opinionated in reviews, but, really? Car phone warehouse should drop this;;;;;Just go into settings - more- ( 3 dots menu) doable background data.;;;;;Worst phone manufacturer ;;;;;I put an SD card in my phone of 32Gb and stav is right, it is running 8 x faster. But now I cant see anything on the screen because its running so quickly and I cant type fast enough.  I have had to throw it all away because the battery only lasted 3 minutes when it was running so fast and it got hot.;;;;;I found joy launcher to have a lot of issues it kept coming up joy launcher not working  so I downloaded google launcher & installed that & the phone runs a lot more smoother & NO stupid octopus appearing on the screen ;;;;;My advice is when you get the phone straight away download google launcher from the play store & install that ! As the phone comes with joy launcher which has issues it slows the phone down keeps coming up joy launcher not working ! After downloading google launcher the phone runs a lot smoother with NO issues !!! Its a basic little cheap phone which will do as a spare don't expect too much from it ;;;;;I bought this handset as I needed a cheap phone after a week of using it the screen went black & the phone was unresponsive & a box kept coming up saying joy launcher not working ! After removing rebooting the phone it kept happening so after doing a bit of research I was told to download google launcher from the play store which I did & I changed the launcer;;;;;I have never been a fan of anything google and this phone has confirmed my opinion on it. When the phone is not installing some app I neither selected or even want it is updating all the other apps it has installed against my will. No matter what settings you choose and set it will continue to do this anyway.  Most annoying it is so busy doing its own thing I do not think I will ever get chance to use it as a phone when I need to as it is locked in its own functions too much. What a waste of money they say its a smart phone but its not smart if you cannot make calls because the phone is too busy to let you into it.;;;;;I bought a Pixi after my flip phone that I had owned for about 6 years died. I was genuinely surprised at how cheap it was, only $100 CAD. It is a good device for calling, texting and web surfing. The only real complaints I have is that it has small storage, ram and a slowish processor, so games are not something this phone does well. It loads all webapps fine, it can play 480p video no problem and doesn't seem to care when the video is higher resolution, it just scales down. Honestly if you want a powerful, high tech phone this one is not for you, but if you want a cheap, functional smartphone I recommend it. 7/10;;;;;Got two, unfortunately :( The first got stuck in a loop loading Android and only a factory reset would get it working again, clearing all data on it and the sd card as it was formatted as internal memory. The second had to be replaced as the display became corrupted in the first five minutes of use. Worse was to follow with Alcatel updating the default launcher with "Joy Launcher - live wallpaper", which removes useful features of the factory launcher, and substitutes them for an extremely annoying smiling mutant Octopus spider thing that hangs from a thread  from the top of the home screen (no I'm not kidding), plus according to google play and several reviewers now contains advertising, but I removed it and disabled updates before seeing any ads myself because it was so infuriating. the new launcher seems to be aimed at, and possibly even written by two to five year old kids.;;;;;it has to be the biggest load of rubbish I have spent 5 visits to o2 i 2 days and the blurtooth still does not work Buy at your peril;;;;;It looks like there are two memory options. 4GB, giga byts, of storage with 512MB, mega byts, of working RAM, random access memory. Or 8GB, giga byts, of storage with 1GB, giga byts, of RAM. If you think of storage as a book case where your books are stored. The bigger the storage, the books you can keep. RAM is like the table where you read you boos at. The more RAM you have the more books you can have open on the table at the any one time. The processor speed is in GHz, giga herts (billions of times per second). This determines how quickly things can be done.;;;;;It doesn't claim to have 4GB of RAM. RAM stands for Random Access Memory which is basically the speed of the operating system. 512mb is pretty slow by todays standards. 4GB is the size of the internal storage (including Android and pre-installed apps). Unless it has the capability to use USB storage there won't be a lot of room to store new apps. The 4GB storage version has 512mb RAM The 8GB storage version has 1GB RAM;;;;;it has 4gb, just 2gb is used up by android. RIP;;;;;512Mb of RAM wow! Not many Apps can be installed with that so why try to make out it's got 4Mb?;;;;;Built-in storage is 2GB, not 4GB. Too little for all todays apps.;;;;;i buy it in indonesia the 8GB version, it works well. the only problem is the TFT screen is ugly in vertical angle 4/10;;;;;Buy a new one, they're cheap.;;;;;I've resently flashed my pixie to the original firmware. And now it is showing only 512 kb of ram instead of 1 gig like its suppose to, anyone has any idea why;;;;;Google voice would be my suggestion. I've seen others talk about APN settings being the root of this problem.;;;;;It developed charging problems after 4 months and stopped working in the  fifth month. Very bad expedience!!;;;;;Hi, everyone, I have the Alcatel 4034x too. But find. Two major problems. I can,t receive or send text messages. Keep getting message, messaging has stopped unexpectedly. ? Driving me mad. No idea why this us happening. Can anyone help. Please 😤;;;;;I've got the 2MB version which is, occasionally, irritating; the 4MB would've been better. But.... for 25 quid it's a useful piece of kit, and one which I'm not going to shed any tears over if I crash and b####r it up (as my previous phone!).;;;;;Got the one with 3mp camera, 512mb ram and 2gb memory. I love it for the most part, it' pretty fast and everything works like a charm, perfect phone for someone who doesn't need much. I have only one problem, not sure if it's faulty with my only or generally with this model. The 3g signal is very often dropping to no bars at all, even tho for the most part it is decent. It's not too much of a problem, because it still has enough signal for people to call me and if it doesn't have good enough signal for quality call, it switches to 2g which is always full. It's just bothering me, even tho it doesn't give me any problems...;;;;;as a sales person, never recommend this phone. everytime sold this phone people come back to returned or some issues;;;;;Both of it's cameras are pretty decent in normal light conditions, you can take a good picture or shoot a good video on a cloudy day. I love front flash. CONS: It only has 2 GB of internal storage, and its system apps waste about 1.6 GB. Just crazy. Of course, you can fix it a little by disabling some apps. And something really important: There are two apps (weirdly, they're system apps), Facebook App Manager and Facebook blah blah, I don't remember and you just CAN'T uninstall them. They're really suspicious, so just clear their data every once in a while and it'll be fine. And about the storage problem​, even if you disable apps, because of Android marshmallow, you can't move apps to your SD card. Other than that, it's really good and I definitely suggest you to buy it.;;;;;Don't get this. It's ok for a backup phone. Recommend getting cm13 on this, alcatels os is ugly the 8gb version might be ok, but 4gb is very bad, always running out of space, and i cant make the sd card work;;;;;Worst phone ever . not better than pixy 3 why no flash on camera and why are there some batteries not charging  waste of a $100.00  upgraded phone?  My ass;;;;;Oh no I have just been and bought it out of car phone werehouse , done it on a big bundle , but I think they have given me the wrong sim to put in , going back today for some help.  I bought the pixi one touch 3 5 inch I love it , its a bit slow , but just want a basic phone with a little front camera , not really a phone person ;;;;;If you are thinking of getting this phone, I would definitely recommend spending a bit more on the 8gb model, as even if you are not much of an app user or have an sd card your internal will soon fill up with texts and photos and videos on he 4gb model and it will get tiresome deleting these things, I know as I have the phone myself.;;;;;It might be a bit late to respond to your post but I have found a few phones that meet your criteria. The best one is probably the plum gator 6, but that doesn't have lte if you want it, and the design might not be to your taste. It does have a good main camera and battery though, which does make it better than the others, arguably. One with a sleeker design and lte connectivity is the micromax vdeo 1. It has a worse main camera than the aforementioned phone at 5mp, the other one having an 8mp main camera. It does have a better selfie camera though at 2mp, the other being 1.3. The last phone is the unnecto Quattro V, which is really the worst of both worlds, so I would recommend you choose one of the first 2. Anyway, I hope I was helpful, if a bit long-winded.;;;;;Nope, just the Swiss way to tell someone to use his brain.;;;;;Good manners! Is this a British Etiquette?;;;;;Smartass. Someone from the UK isn't going to fly to Romania just for a mobile.;;;;;Anyone plz tell me where can I found pixi 4 (4) model 4034E or 4034F having 5+2mp camera and 1 gb ram for using in India/bangladesh??;;;;;You realise that this is actually a feature of the phone that you can disable under settings?;;;;;The phone has an automatic timer that turns it self on or off at a specific time when u set it to.check for that..;;;;;What a piece of crap. After the phone has been turned off it turns itself back on after a few hours. It will be going back for an LG.;;;;;Am i able to download pictures or videos sent to me by friends to my computer please?;;;;;I'm just curious does it work only on EE or is it unlocked ;;;;;Just ordered one of these. Free when you buy £20 credit with EE. Can't get much cheaper than that! Just hope it's half decent ;;;;;Come in Romania and you'll get it for 47 euros.;;;;;How do you send group messages?;;;;;How can I uninstall some apps? Thanks;;;;;Amazon, ebay... Loads. Just type Alcatel pixi 4(4) case into your search engine... ;;;;;If you mean the 3 buttons at the bottom then no....  No backlight,  normal. ;;;;;I've just got one. It came with 4.2.2 Is there a software upgrade to be found? ;;;;;I just bought one and there seems to be no backlight on the navigation buttons. Is this supposed to be so or is it just a faulty phone?;;;;;It's the same phone and size as the Alcatel Dawn.;;;;;I can't seem to find a case for my pixi4-4.5 phone can someone let me know where I can buy one;;;;;  EE says it has 3 mp camera and indeed the box said this. But I think it says it upscales it to 3 mp!...is that right??;;;;;I'm not quite sure what you are answering in the affirmative to. Are you saying that the 8GB model is AVAILABLE? If so, where? ;;;;;yes one version with 8gb storage/1gb ram/5mp camera, and other with 4gb storage/512 ram/2mp camera;;;;;I note that availability how now changed to Available - Released However, the 8Gb memory model (4034F) is still apparently unavailable, the 4Gb model has been available some months now.;;;;;it means he has 2 cameras, one in front 2p, and secound 5p;;;;;Camera - 2 Mp or 5 Mp.....what does this mean?  Are there 2 versions?;;;;; i have purchased the but not using .unable to operate please give manual for use;;;;;Where I can buy the one with better spec (1GB RAM and 8GB ROM)?;;;;;I don't understand. Over here, where I live (Europe), there's already a Pixi 4 on sale. 4 inch screen, 70 euro. However, only the lower spec version (4 GB, 512 MB). Is there a better version to be released, or what? I am really with my sights on this phone. It's what I really want.;;;;;In El Salvador: Lowest known price: $44.99 Model: 4034A Screen Density: 240dpi Internal Storage: 8GB RAM: 1GB Video: 720p@30fps Secondary Camera: VGA GPU: Mali-400 MP 
Just wanted to share some of the specifications that I see using CPU-Z.;;;;;I live in Brazil. USD100,00 here, August 2016. Good hardware, low price.;;;;;4034F is the 8GB internal Memory 1 GB RAM model. I am waiting for it to become available in the UK (Western Europe).;;;;;Jaunt got one but won't let me but email in ,help?;;;;;Only sold in latin america;;;;;Just bought one of these - fantastic value, clear screen, fast processor. There are at least four different models available, according to the information in the box:  - 4034D is the dual-SIM version  - 4034X is a lower cost version: single SIM, 1.3MP front camera, 3MP rear camera (although still with HD video) 512Mb RAM. Currently available in UK.  - 4034F not sure  - 4034M not sure;;;;;Got one today after years of saying nobody needs a smartphone, boy my 30 quid changed my world! A great little bit of kit if want the basics, good screen even I can read, I have cataracts. Not that happy it asks so many questions on set up but that's Android. Note to all smartphone makers though: Battery life!;;;;;What an amazing phone for the price, only £25 from asda 😃😃;;;;;I like the size, most of the specs and having Android 6.0 So for now I'm happy with my purchase (model 4034D). Though, I'd pay a lot more to get (by priority): - a better screen technology like IPS/OLED (resolution is good, please no uselessly high PPI) - an higher quality plastic, better finish - the 1GB RAM / 8GB EMMC version (not available in western Europe) - a GPS (the specs are currently wrong on this page, it's only software "GPS" using GSM towers, Wifi AP and stuff like that) - USB OTG I'm sad it's difficult to find good small phones...;;;;;I don't seem to be able to get the 1 GB ram model here in the UK. Can anyone help me.;;;;;Great phone if you're not a hardcore user. It runs the basic apps smoothly. Not a good camera though.;;;;;i got the Phone and about 1 gb ram is not true yes is is a quad core and it is using 6.0 android system but is good not great ;;;;;Better than samsung note 5 in case of lagging

Damm no buy from me. ;;;;;when will it be launching in Indonesia?;;;;;Only problem with Zte specially Nubia phones are android updates, still stuck with Nubia Z11 with Android 6 with security patch of 5 December 2016.;;;;;Ive got 2 ZTE Nubia phones.. Z11 and M2, and they are juz awesome and a big bang for your money...;;;;;say no to zte phone because of their slow updates software and laginess.;;;;;New gen Amoled doesnt burn in so easily;;;;;I don't think so..amoled can cause burn in problem..and expensive ;;;;;it is very unfortunate the phone is perfect except for a few flaws the modem is low category lacks more band while we have a snapdragon 835 which manages the x16 and bluethoot version 4.1 while we arrived in version 5 and the battery a little low otherwise it would be the perfect phone by its characteristics and size;;;;;Does it have hybrid sim slot ..and supports memory card expansion or not???????;;;;;The Archos Diamond Omega is the rebranded version of the Nubia Z17s, So they are the same.;;;;;this is fone have same specs with Archos Diamonds Omega.. just so you happen to have compare both fone.. ;;;;;Does it have OTG?;;;;;ZTE NEEDS TO USE SOME AMOLED...great specs but we need amoled with those specs;;;;;I agree, no card slot is a problem, even with 128GB onboard.;;;;;Yeah and you'll use it with"real" 1 gigabit network right?;;;;;NO IR;;;;;Review pls..;;;;;Can anyone confirm that it does come with the IR blaster? Tks;;;;;And no LTE Band 28.;;;;;no mistake, arhcos is re branded nubia for france  ;;;;;Will be much better of water proof  / Dust proof..;;;;;No card slot. No 3.5mm. dinky 3000 mAh battery. Stretched 1080p display. No AKM DAC anymore. Total fail from ZTE.;;;;;For its price phone looks gruesome even no SD card and other things. Battery should be much bigger with that screen. But who I am I to judge. ;;;;;With its thickness if indeed it is, there so much space for 3.5 mm jack coz there are lots of phones out there have even thinner than this yet have 3.5mm jack...Why Nubia???;;;;;Wireless charging and IP68 should be part of the specs before i will buy phone. I had z11 and its good phone overall...;;;;;i think this is a mistake of gsmarena this phone specifations as same as z17s Archos Diamond Omega  if its true, this will be big juke because everything are the same, JUST BRANDED ;;;;;when this phone will be available in india;;;;;You forget to mention its Cat9 4G speed , haha that's sd835 lacks some high speed chip . shame on ZTE what hell are they doing oh ? even sd821 uses cat12 go for mate for cat18;;;;;Poor Battery !;;;;;Excellent Specs!  Only wish it had Micro SD support and a 3,500 mAh battery.  In the era of everything HD, I wish more phone manufacturers would realize the necessity in having Micro SD support.  Because cloud storage is not the industry standard yet, many people want to have access to their pictures, music, videos, and documents on their person at all times.  And when you add on the apps into that, 128GB runs out a lot quicker than most people realize.  Especially when you take into account that at least 18-20GB of that is system use.  ;;;;;And again no OIS or EIS? Are they kidding with us? This is not a mid-range device, so it is unforgivable to not add OIS, or EIS. And this one also lacks a 3.5 mm jack. The new trend is weird.

phone_reviews:
;;;;;I have owned this phone for not even a month. In this small time of ownership of it I can say this. Do not by I was tricked into it cause it was free. Now let's get to the pros and cons of this large piece of shit. Pors: long battery life. Large screen. Dual camera. Great sound quality. Finger print scanner. Cons: Small memory. Ram 1.8gb. CAN ONLY RUN ONE APP AT A TIME, feels very cheap, uses all of your ram for battery life, hardware is garbage, software is garbage, no stock browser, no stock keyboard, Google is mandatory browser, MMS and text work sometime. And it uses 1.8 of 1.8gb to run your phone. Oh let me not forget the crashes. As I see it this phone should've never been released. Maybe the worse phone ever released in the new tech era. Epic faceplam is needed here.  Overall: Do not buy it even for your cat. It's a very poorly made phone. 2.3 out of 10.0  Yes it's that bad. I am going to contact zte and see what the tech department is going todo to fix this. If nothing I will be filing a class action lawsuit against them for misleading performance spec and knowingly disturbing a faulty product to the American people. ZTE has been fined by the government once already for selling technology to North Korea. ;;;;;I upgraded from the ZTE zmax pro too the new blade which has one processor. The zmax pro has 2 and a wider screen. Yeah it's an older version phone then the new blade zmax but will run circles around it. I do a lot of things on my phone and between the two. I must say the zmax pro is better as far as multitasking. The new blade zmax is a overall quality piece of shit. Sold it first day I got it freezing up and stuff. I have to give them a bad review if they made the new blade like the zmax pro. I'd gave them a thumbs up.;;;;;The phone is OK, not the best. I used to have an LG G Stylo 1st gen which I bought Feb 2016 and it's been working great, just figured to get a newer phone and got this about a month ago. Anyway, back to the ZTE Blade. First of all, it doesn't have as many customizable user changes I had on the LG. Secondly, and this is my biggest complaint, is when I first got the phone, I wasn't receiving any calls. I'm on family mobile network (T-Mobile). I can make calls, but every once in a while, I couldn't receive calls. I looked up other forums and some people have said to turn off the "voice over LTE preferred" which I did, and it worked for a while and then it started happening again. I've noticed that I couldn't receive calls when I was on a WiFi network. Family mobile doesn't have wifi calling feature, and looked into the WiFi calling feature. It was set on WiFi preferred. I changed it to cellular network preferred and so far, it seems to work better than before. Every once in a while, I can't receive calls so what I do early in the morning I do a couple of test calls and use my wife's phone to call my phone to see if it's working. I know it's annoying, but I try to remember to do this every morning. It does seem to help though. I try to do test calls a couple of times a day to make sure I can receive calls. I think maybe around Sept or so, I might trade up to another LG phone, I've had several since and they seem to work really well for me and are more user customizable. So, if I were to give this phone a star rating, I would give it 2 1/2 stars out of 4. ZTE needs to step up their game on their phone line if they want to stay in the US market and increase their sales here. ;;;;;Send picture then reset the phone anytime you want to send another one have to wipe cache every time reliad the.phone thenwirst piece of shit;;;;;I hate this phone and everything about it! this phone should not be sold! they should scrap it and throw it away!;;;;;I hate this phone! the graphics are bad, the text messaging app is bad... Everything about this phone screams HORRIBLE!!! Do not buy it!;;;;;Ah you probably dont understand anything;;;;;Metro PC admitted they have no towers outside of major cities. They offered me a refund of the phone if it has less then 1 hour talk time. Well, I talked to a rep for over an hour, so no return. AND, the phone is locked for 90 days. So I can't use the phone on another carrier. I am talking to a lawyer about a lawsuit for deceptive practices.  We shall see how far metro PC is willing to go just to let a paying customer change carriers, after one week..;;;;;The phone works great. Data does NOT work except in major cities. I drove from Elgin Illinois to Omaha Nebraska today. 450 miles, west on i-80. I lost data in Clinton Illinois, about 30 miles from Elgin. Never got data until Des Moines Iowa ( four hours later );;;;;Bought it today 3-6-18 Lost my LG Tribute HD. So far, WOW!! Videos like movies/YouTube,  outstanding. Camera seems OK. ( I use a DSLR for my camera). Text wouldn't send pics , something about to large of a file. Went to play store and got the Android messenger, works perfect.  Fingerprint stuff works good. Online data, is Great, way faster than my old phone. Been surfing heavily for around 6 hours and still 60% battery life left. And I never charged it when I got home. Annoying metro p, logo on upper left screen. 
So far so good. 
I'll update this post every couple months. 
Got the phone from metro PCs, never tried this company before. 
 this phone was $120.00. 
They took off $100.00 
Because I switched from boost. 
So, for $20 for the phone,  plus monthly plan, $60.00 
What's to complain about? 
All in all I am happy, we shall give it awhile and see how the phone and Carrier work out.



;;;;;I had 3 ZTE BLADE Z MAX and they have been wonderful very fast no issues at all with me so far never had any problems with nothing I even have the ZTE MAX from Boostmobile and theay great phones batterie last almost day and half everything work fantastic. Don't why this people are having problems with them I love the ZTE ;;;;;I've had this phone for about 4 months now and I can not count how many times this phone has freezed on me. I try to open just one app at a time, app freezes, device freezes, wallpaper changes to default and I have to try the process over again. I previously had the Zmax Pro for over a year and I ran into none of these issues. (I only upgraded due to a charger port complication.) This phone was seemingly advertised and brought to me as a well designed phone but the weak components of the phone make it almost unviable for use. I'm usually not one to complain but seriously you would be better off buying a phone such as the Stylo 3 or the J7 instead if this device. The camera takes 3-5 seconds just to register one picture and might crash. App like Snapchat and Instagram have a higher chance of crashing on you. The memory on the phone is so terrible. 3/10. Don't Buy.;;;;;I'm a zte fan but this blade sux. the first phone i bough on christmas lost the charge over the weekend and would never power back on even when charging. I returned it and received another brand new phone. It's now march 1st and the screen has completely gone zombie black on me with flashing colors resembling a rainbow. I never had this issue with the previous zte's. I do agree that the phone can tend to be a bit laggy. The Bluetooth on mine cuts in and out sometimes, but is fixable. I'll say this, I had every Zmax since the first one. When these phones first come out, they are buggy and a little off centered, but after a few months, ZTE usually sends a software update to address the glitches. I am hopeful they will send one for this model, I have yet to see one, but am hopeful. I do think these are better than some of the new LG's that hit the market. Bottom line, it's a budget full HD smartphone. Expect to see glitches here and there...my phone hasn't really done anything to seriously annoy me, but I do understand the comments too. Write to ZTE with your concerns, if enough people write, ZTE will be forced to update the software. However so far so good! No major issues, except for Bluetooth, the best fix for laggy OS, whatever, power cycle, power cycle, power cycle!!!;;;;;I would like to so far should I purchase this the ZTE Blade Z Max???;;;;;this phone should be recalled and refunds given to everyone and they should be fined;;;;;i hate this phone. read my above comment.. these never should have been released and should be recalled and refunds given!! crazy that they get away with this;;;;;do not, i repeat, do not purchase this phone!! i have owned zte zmax....so i figured id upgrade to this one....its oike throwing $130.00 out yhe window. the phone overheats while charging (i haven't even owned it 2 months) processor lags keyboard lags. videos and audio are the worst this phone never should have been released and shoukd be recalled.

no, im not throwing another $15 to replace a phone with same piece of garbage thats going to give me the same problems

When I click on a photo or news story, the phone is forced into portrait mode (vertical) or I have to turn it long ways up and down. Without purchasing an app, is there a way to fix this?;;;;;not work gprs 2g network;;;;;I have had the ZTE Blade Zmax for around a week now. I really like the phone! I've had every zmax version since original launch and i can honestly say, their great devices. I first had the original zmax, owned for 3 years, the zmax pro, owned for 1 1/2 years, and now the Blade zmax. Let me just say, for what you're getting for the price point, you can't really beat it. 6.0 inch FHD display, 16mp by 2mp rear camera, 8mp FRONT camera, 4080mAh battery that works well and lasts long, plus quick charge 2.0+android nougat, and not to mention the storage (32GB internal). Its a good phone! Yes the device may not be the fastest and smoothest OS wise, but depending on how you use it, will dictate how it will serve you. As far as concerns for the device read on other posts, i haven't noticed any issues. Battery performs well for the whole day, sometimes 2 depending on your usage. The only time i noticed the phone to heat up is when you play a game, which i find to be pretty standard and normal. Camera is exceptional and has cool dual effects, and a nice bright led light. The phone can tend to get laggy once in a while, a simple power off for 2 minutes and back on will perk it right up, plus this should be done at least once a day for any phone to ensure connectivity. I have yet to find any major issues with this device, i think for $99 at metro PCS is a great deal for this device. For those who have used ZTE in the past, you should have no issues using this device. But this phone REALLY is!;;;;;this mobile available in pak?;;;;;Can y'all make one for Verizon Wireless?;;;;;I bought one on Tuesday the 29th of August at a local MetroPCS store. I like it very much. 4080 mAH battery, has a microSD card slot, USB-C FAST 9V CHARGING, beautiful display, fingerprint reader, WiFi calling (HD calls), Android 7.1.1  almost pure Google Android experience,  virtually ZERO bloatware on this MetroPCS handset.  2 Gig of 4G LTE data and unlimited calling / SMS for $30 a month, no hidden fees or taxes, no contracts. That's why the claim of the phone having that audio, without a 3.5mm jack (a DAC built in), is bogus.  The phone would have to rely on an adapter to supply the audio out or the headphones (in the case of USB headphones).  Then by proxy it would also rely on the file's sample rate...as some DACs will upscale to their respective output, and others, won't. A 7 rating ensures Âingress of water in harmful quantity shall not be possible when the enclosure is immersed in water under defined conditions of pressure and time (up to 1m of submersion)Â according to the IEC. While a 7 rating guarantees protection for up to 30 minutes, 8 means it can be underwater for 30 minutes at depths of up to 1.5m.;;;;;What about global market?;;;;;Wow, Just wow. I was so amaze with that phone. But the battery :(;;;;;OMGGGG look amazing god job ZTE;;;;;ip68 is more resistant to water and its around 1.5m deep for 30min;;;;;Ip67 : until 1 meter 30 minutes under water Ip68 : until 2 meter 30 minutes under water;;;;;IP Â This stands for the International Protection marking, a standard drawn up by the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC). 6 Â The first digit stands for its resistance to dust, but also general dirt and sand. For example, the Samsung Galaxy S8 earned a Â6Â rating for ÂNo ingress of dust; complete protection against contact (dust tight)Â following an 8-hour test. The iPhone 7 has the same rating for dust resistance. 7 Â The second digit provides certification for water resistance. For our purposes, this is the important bit. A 7 rating ensures Âingress of water in harmful quantity shall not be possible when the enclosure is immersed in water under defined conditions of pressure and time (up to 1m of submersion)Â according to the IEC. While a 7 rating guarantees protection for up to 30 minutes. The Samsung Galaxy S8 received an 8 certification for water resistance, meaning it can be underwater for 30 minutes at depths of up to 1.5m.;;;;;WOW;;;;;is there anyone kind enough to explain to me the difference between ip67 n ip68 ? thanks;;;;;Samsung S8 and Iphone 7 plus killer.;;;;;Its still same 200 mAh difference is nothing maybe a hour or two extra;;;;;No headphone jack... Not like some so called flagships with similar specs and twice or three times higher price. ;;;;;Dolby Atmos audio enhancement, etc.;;;;;Well, the ZTE Axon 7 was (and still is) already   an excellent great value for money phone, overall, a true flagship killer, at only $399 and even less. Now we have this new Axon 7s, and it has some considerable upgrades: SD821 instead of SD820, 6GB RAM over 4GB, 128GB over 64GB, Dual Camera setup, 20MP + 12MP Over single 20MP, and even a slightly More Battery juice. So specs wise it is absolutely even more better than before. But then, what about the sound, the dual front facing stereo speakers, Atoms, etc ? And hopefully this won't be instead of an Axon 8 with the SD835, etc.

phone_reviews: ;;;;;I got this phone for $99+tax at BestBuy and am thrilled by it's performance. If it were slightly bigger, I could hang this on a wall land get rid of my TV. Voice recognition is superb. I don't think voice recognition has to do with a cellphone than the OS, but it is easy to use on this phone. Keyboard is a bit wacky, but once you get used to it, you start loving it. I haven't seen how the SD card behaves yet.... It has been more than 2 months now.;;;;;I wrote it someone on top but if ur not getting any even using ur Fon go into ur apps on ur home screen look for the voice mail app and set it up. After to make sure if u want to hear it to me its annoying so I picked the second option on the notifications of it. It shows on ur notification bar once ur done setting it up go to ur Fon settings and goto apps or notifications find that icon that u played with says voice mail and make sure its not blocked if u want the step by step detailed answer I wrote it to someone else its on top of these reviews gl;;;;;You have to go into apps the icon with dots look for voice mail BC its a external voice mail. Go in n get in the settings make sure its not set to block personal I have it at silent which should b the seconded on the options. Next got to ur Fon settings and then apps, then look for voice mail make sure its got permissions n no blocks if u want to know wen by noise n not as a notification set to priority hope that helps;;;;;This phone is a piece of junk.   Screen goes black watching videos.. Lags like syrup running uphill.. And the bloatware is crazy.  I would not recommend this phone to Anyone.  Glad it was a freebie.  Will be getting a new phone pronto to replace this. ;;;;;Not a good phone. Always freezes.  Apps open that I didn't touch. Sorry I purchased this phone.  Will go back to Samsung Galaxy. ;;;;;This phone is junk! I would not recommend it to anyone for any reason. I have problems with camera Focus and screen not working correctly. My notification light was constantly going off whether there was anything new or not.;;;;;On my second(2nd) Max Xl sadly. Phone has screen shut-off issue while watching videos.You can hear the video but can not see the video! Camera a little slow to focus, i've noticed a little  lag when deleting a pic.Hope they fix these issues soon or definitely with the 2nd version if they decide to make a Max Xl 2?? ;;;;;I can get a voicemail  but don't get any kind of notification. ;;;;;Does anyone know how to get a voicemail on this phone? ;;;;;Could someone please confirm to me if this device works with the 4g lte AWS band?;;;;;I live 7 months in Canada and 5 months down in Florida.  I use Telus while I am in Canada and some other provider while down in the US.   1.  Will I have any problems unlocking the phone? 2. Will the phone be useable in both locations with the appropriate sim? Your advice would be most appreciated.;;;;;everything in phone looks good but just 16gb storage 2GB ram in 2017 is not fair, should be like 32Gb 3GB RAM and 5500mah bbattery;;;;;It's called a BUDGET phone for a reason;;;;;I wanted to know is the volume louder then lggstylo3;;;;;Woah, this phone seems like the best phone that will ever come out. It has 2 gigabytes of RAM! Who needs all that extra memory with the 4 to 6 gigs of RAM? You trying to run Crysis 3 on your phone, hahah! And a 1080p display? That's still hip! 1440p is only for those lame guys who has 20/20 vision. And best of all the best processor of all time, the Snapdragon 435 ARM CPU. I mean, that sounds like it should stay in 2012 but that Adreno 505 GPU is going to make gaming somewhat better as opposed to the Adreno 405 found on the ZTE Zmax Pro. I think the ZTE Zmax Pro is still a superior phone because of the better CPU. The Nougat isn't really a selling point with me because you only get like 3 actual good features like dual multitasking, and better battery optimization. Other than that, don't get this phone unless you don't have a Zmax Pro.;;;;;Snapdragon 435 and 2 gb ram..what year is it?;;;;;Good phone for good price. ;;;;;Wow ZTE z max pro with bigger battery.... Lame

And about the Li-Po vs Li-Ion debate you made here, let me inform you that Li-Ion batteries have a higher energy density & longer lifespan than Li-Po, but are thicker, heavier and can explode if the barrier that separates the positive and negative electrode is ever breached.  Li-Po batteries on other hand are more slimmer and lightweight. They use a gel like electrolyte so they're comparatively more safer, however they have lower charge density and low life span. They both have their advantages and disadvantages. Li-Ion batteries last longer, have more life but are heavier, fatter  while Li-Po batteries don't last long, deteriorate faster with each charging cycle but are slimmer. Of course due to their gel electrode the Li-Po are comparatively safer than Li-Ion batteries.;;;;;Xiaomi mi6 is more expensive than Nubia Z17 mini, about 150USD.  and Moto g5 plus is very bad smartphone, you cant compare with Nubia Z17 mini.  Nubia Z17 mini has better back and front camera, better performance, better body and hardware matterials, also you can see that in battery. phone_reviews: ;;;;;ZTE doesn't even say the screen is IPS, only Full HD and TFT. Almost certainly TN on a low priced phone.;;;;;Hi,  I bought this phone for you opinion, but i am disappointed, No Fm Radio, no update and not coming, so i am not very happy with you. Bye.;;;;;I love this phone IÂm not a heavy phone user and this phone does everything I need and more itÂs fun and ez to use the only thing I donÂt like is the only hard case I can find is the one zte makes and sells I would like more choices but am vary happy over all I would recommend this phone to anyone looking to get a new phone but does not want or can not get an expensive phone ;;;;;Thanks a lot DV.  I loved seeing those photos.  It gives me new ideas of what I can do with my Blade V8 Pro camera now.;;;;;I press the button with one of the fingers that I use to read my fingerprint. I press it down and it clicks on and immediately unlocks.  The only extra effort is pushing down until you feel it click.  You can start the phone with the side power button also and then unlock it with the reader without having to make the front button click.  It's really not a problem.;;;;;I'm using mine on AT&T and I'm getting 4G LTE.;;;;;Mine actually works great on Facebook.  It's really fast. When I tap the icon, it's ready to go in about 3 seconds.  Practically instantly if you have it running in the background.  I've never had a problem with Facebook on this phone.;;;;;Not true, at least now. I got mine a week ago, home button can act as screen on and fingerprint scanner at same time. Also no issues with Facebook;;;;;Great price from Amazon. Feels good, solid, stylish. Fingerprint sensor works very well as long as you set it up right. I LOVE having a home button- an actual button. Those "stereo speaks" you see in the photos ain't stereo. It's one speaker only, not stereo. That's a disappointment. Would it kill mobile companies to put those speakers in the front? I guess so. I know other ZTE models have it, not this one. 14nm CPU though- very fast, low power, long battery life. I wanted a better camera stereo speakers but for the money, I got a lot.;;;;;good thing I dont use facebook :P ;;;;;Handset is not supported to 4G services ...any solution;;;;;This phone is not worth it. I had to factory reset mine twice because the screen was stuck on a start up loop. ;;;;;Same exact problem here returning it for an exchange and selling it a.s.a.p.;;;;;Avoid this if possible as of a day ago the latest facebook app renders the phone unsuable stuck in a reboot loop. I had to factory reset the phone and the only workaround is not to install the facebook app. Also this phone has not received a major update from ZTE, that should raise warning flags...;;;;;i heard 4g not support in india..is it true.. plzz help mee.plzzz;;;;;The Samsung-form factor was a pro to buy the normal V8 , so I hope it isn't the same with that one. I can imagine there will be a workaround for that though, the button of the regular V8 clicks. Disclaimer: haven't opened the box yet, waiting delivery of screen-protector.;;;;;I got it a month ago, and indeed you have to tap the power button first in order to unlock it using the fingerprint.;;;;;I read a review on this phone that says you must hit the power key then the scanner to open the phone.  Is that true?  I would much prefer just the scanner to wake  and unlock the phone at once.;;;;;Well, this is the third month im using it and for the price this zte works excelent. Better than moto g5 plus;;;;;hi guys, can someone please tell me if this device is available in the philippines? and how much will it be on PHP?? and where can i get one?? Thanks :);;;;;This is definitely another excellent value for money phone from ZTE. 100% worth it. ;;;;;Great phone for its value. This phone has Gyroscope, not sure why the specs here didn't mention. I was able to view 360 degree photo with this phone while rotating the phone in different angles. Overall good image quality, except for the indoor/night shots. Typical for cellar phones. Some sample photos can be seen here: ;;;;;when it comes to india.... superb phone...;;;;;when it available in india....;;;;;Battery life is amazing. 5h 30min of screen on time and I'm still at 30%. This is with some heavy gaming (Egg Inc. Asphalt 8). ;;;;;can zte be locked on cloud, just likr samsung s7edge;;;;;can zte be locked on cloud, just likr samsung s7edge;;;;;How much is this phone ZTE Blade V8  now in Nigeria, and how long can the battery stay after charging?;;;;;It's Exclusively only for USA  ;;;;;ZTE just started selling smartphones in BD.Keep your eye on their facebook page,'ZTE BANGLADESH';;;;;Is OTG supported??;;;;;Is it available in Bangladesh? The V8 launches with nougat while the pro still has marshmallow?;;;;;everyone is going to buy this phone if the price is that low;;;;;185gm with 3100 mah ........are you F***8ing kiding me ZTE ??;;;;;Maybe because it's still not stable.;;;;;It's 2K17 never understood why vendor are still using Marshmallow for their new brand

phone_reviews: ;;;;;Does it support both capturing devices and peripheral card readers via Serial Port Profile (SPP)?;;;;;This actually has 2 rear facing identical color cameras. You could use it for 3D photography. Even many of the other dual camera phone models have 1 color and 1 monochrome, so this phone has a slight advantage for that feature alone. You can't even find a 3D camera for less than $200. Let alone one that does 13MP! Not bad. And with a Sanpdragon 435 core, it doesn't completely suck as a personal computing device either. ;;;;;why?;;;;;Bought it for 149Â, it´s pretty good for that price and replaces my - back in the day - way too expensive S7 Edge.  It´s biggest strength is, that it doesn´t have any real weaknesses.  Good screen, good battery run time, good calling quality, great fingerprint scanner, very decent camera and audio via Bluetooth and AUX. It also has Dual SIM (shared), wich is a viable option with 32GB internal memory. The only real downsides are the lack of 5GHz WLAN and the weak main speaker. The Mifavor UI does, despite the not very potent Snapdragon 435 (it´s sufficient for almost all 3D games though), work more fluently and stable than my S7 Edge ever did. I like it, good phone if you get it cheap. ;;;;;zte is really bad ;;;;;blade v8  7.0 frp? help me;;;;;It says that this phone is dual sim, but however in the manual for the phone is doesn't mention anything about dual sim. You can put the 2nd simcard in the SDcard holder, but it won't recognise the sim. In the setting you can't find anything about dual sim or sim management. a ZTE phone is and will stay a joke.;;;;;Is this Phone working for CXT soft ware to collect the Data;;;;;It is dual sim on the phone look up Settings--> Dual sim settings  The menu is visible regardless if you have 1 ,2 or no sim inserted. and check the icon in the sim tray both the nano sims must be parallel  ;;;;;micromax is borrowing it to launch as their dual 4..hahahahaha....;;;;;It does not reckognise the second sim card - is it really a dual sim phone? I don't find the "Dual Card Management" function in the settings menu.;;;;;how to remove frp?;;;;;The battery of this phone is not enogh to last long.I wish to see 4000mah on every device with 5.5 inch.It should be standard;;;;;It looks nice to be honest, but ZTE - why use microUSB v2.0, why!? Move on!;;;;;Dual camera on low budget chipset. Its official. This camera is a norm now. ;;;;;at least, looks different

phone_reviews: ;;;;;It's an impressive amount of use a person must have to roll this down like that! On a slightly dim screen, 720 draws barely anything, and it's got a large battery to boot.;;;;;Its also called (zte blade spark).;;;;;Non-removable batteries are becoming standard in every phone brand. Your best option is to buy a portable battery pack if you want the peace of mind.;;;;;I was quite lucky to get this phone for free with a 2 year old contract with Freedom Mobile. Soon after that, the company realized that this phone is too good be given out like that and downgraded the offer to phones with 1GB RAM and 8GB ROM and 5MP camera. The major issue with this phone is that the 16G isn't nearly enough storage, because is the operating system takes up like 9G (for what? can't imagine) and you can't move the apps to the SD card.  Also, 1 year after release, there's still no way to root it. Otherwise, it's a solid phone which can handle anything modern life throws at you.;;;;;Great phone (does the job great) My unit is running Build number Z957V1.0.0B07. Got it with Freedom Mobile here in Canada. (WiFi calling, and LTE work great) Already confirmed that this phone is not Meltdown security vulnerable.  "are not affected by either the Meltdown or Spectre vulnerability as they do not perform out-of-order execution", "Snapdragon 4xx processors based on A53 or A55 cores";;;;;(Update : Call quality is declining due to too small of a mic space at bottom of device. My phone protector case worsens the issue);;;;;Battery life is great. Problem with the Dolby digital audio app when you receive a call and you're listening to music; it turn the sound very metallic with super low base. As a moderate to heavy music user on a cell phone this is a small but annoying hassle to force stop app and music app to restart. Not a good phone have if you're in Canada and using freedom mobile as a provider. Frequent missed calls and text coming hours later. Other than that it's a solid phone.;;;;;I LOVE MY ZTE GRAND x4.  The only bad thing I have found is the ability to move all my apps to my memory card.  I'm now out of memory and need to go get a new phone.  I'm so horribly sad, this is the best phone I've had in years through Cricket.  I'm sure there is a way!  I will research before buying a new one, for sure.  However, BEST PHONE!!!!!!! I love the fingerprint login, then I can talk about my roommates and they can't login to see where/who/why I'm complaining!  ;;;;;unhappy with not being able to root phone in order to disable stock google junk i don't utilize. also unhappy about nonremovable battery...guessing the phone will need to be pried open to swap out.  thrilled about battery life and camera. ;;;;;Decent phone and putting all the features together am satisfied. The only drawback is the resolution. So pics are not great looking as in Samsung note 4 or 5. So if you are a gamer this phone is not for you.;;;;;Beautiful and powerful phone. Better than a lot of more expensive ones;;;;;great phone, love it

It's just for your security reason.;;;;;what??????;;;;;ok  i sow  very  quality  nexet  week, my view is one  day  this  company  can share   product  phone  and  grow  of  company;;;;;yes;;;;;How much so ? ;;;;;its very nice  and asomeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee;;;;;Battery life is very important! Hope that a new TG in window phone 7 is on the way. Being thin is not the most important, performance is.;;;;;as a user of TG01 I can say that: 1. 1000mAh battery is not enough!!! (only keeps charge for 2 days) 2. no 3.5 mm jack is painfull, but you can listen music through uUSB jack  3. uUSB jack on the side of the phone is not very comfortable 4. when you make a uUSB jack on the side, why not provide a L-shaped uUSB headphone?! 5. 1000mAh battery is not enough!!! 6. no answer/reject hardware buttons :( 7. screen is awesome (especially on the TG02 model I guess) 8. but 1000mAh battery is not enough!;;;;;Toshiba is really trying its best to shoot itself in the leg. Maybe they have too much profit and they are trying to loose some. Why can they not just try and let this phone be near perfect. What will it cost to put a 1500Mah battery and 5 mp camera?;;;;;4.1 inches screen with 1000 mAh battery. i'm wondering how many hours could this phone run after every full charge.;;;;;what the F?! SBP mobile shell runs this phone only...noo wayy for 1gb ram;;;;;Lol @ SPB mobile shell;;;;;We need to get this guy shorten! TG03 will be W7 ;;;;; ;;;;;No it won't. WP7S needs a 5.0 mp camera with flash. This does not have that. ;;;;;This might be able to get WP7, it has necessary buttons, matching resolution and necessary RAM/ROM!;;;;;i think it will have a better luck   with wp7  than hd2;;;;;Sad to read touch CAPACITIVE screen, one thing I have learned through using the TG01 is you NEED a stylus, and not just for the keypad which seems to be upgraded to keyboard. The other specs look almost identical, hey you can get the TG01 at 129 quid at Orange UK stores, bargain of the century! I think the TG01 should have been modified in cosmetic design had proximity sensor added, to enable screen to be centrally positioned, and a radio added. Better speaker/s would have been nice, preferably side or front mounted. Get rid of the flimsy annoying flap on mini usb port too.;;;;;wtf only 1000mAh????;;;;;Well I don't know this exactly, I know only rumors said it is waterproof!;;;;;This phone is waterproof or splash resistant officially?maybe just a rumor...Toshiba...;;;;;Its just a TG01 with a capacative TFT......nothing more or less..... Toshiba sucks in my opinion, they give out the goodies very slow so they can get more money from you! I can tell TG03 would be capacative AMOLED screen lol...;;;;;Wider release for this phone, Toshiba...;;;;;Looks like a remake of TG01, which is very good to a degree. But surely this phone is just a cosmetic makeover. What would be better is if they had improved the form factor, still a small screen for such large body, height wise that is. Better camera, able to video I hope beyond the ten min's of TG01. Still the ugly status led present, lets hope this is not the final version to hit the shops. I actually believe the TG01 under winmo 6.5 is fantastic, it should have been better marketed. Any V2 should be upgraded in the spec's dept.;;;;;I think it is a good, phone, how many phones has 4.1 inch OLEd WVGA screen with 1GHZ CPU??? If you don't like it, you can leave the forum. Japan is more advanced then any others in the world. :);;;;;Terrible Specs according to what would be expected. At least 5mpx camera. 500MB of RAM or near that. That's just to survive. To thrive: AMOLED Screen, Internal Storage, FM Radio...;;;;;i think it will get the wp7 series   the wp7 series will  be released  only after 4 monthes  if not less  after the release of  tgo2  so what ;;;;;LOL compare it to the TG01...any real noticable differences? Why no 5mp camera? Come on Toshiba!!!;;;;;Stand-by 5h and Talk time 275 h ??? :P This is the first phone with better talk time then stand-by :D;;;;;And Toshiba can make fingerprint sensor phones, so you want to tell me they are not good?? Og please, don't make me laugh. :);;;;;I don't cry man, just I know Japan is Japan, and Europe is Europe! There are VERY BIG differences between Europe and Japan! Japan has waterproof phones, they have wallet phones, they have phones with extreme cameras, they have phones with big screens like we have. :) They(Sharp) has XGA screen phones for example. :) What do you think?? Oh and I forget to tell Japan will enter in global markets, Sharp will attack Samsung and LG too! And Nokia ofcourse. They will lead the screen technology and camera technology!;;;;;You don't believe me right? If you have 1500 Euro to spend, tell Toshiba do you want an 1GHZ CPU phone with at least 8mP camera, 4.1 inch OLED screen, any OS(NOT MAC OS or Blackberry OS ofcourse), 16GB internal memory, waterproof... and they will make it for you! :) And they has a 14.6 MP sensor!! WOW! :);;;;;toshiba is a good company, hell even apple buys stuff from them to put in the iphone, toshiba should really make a phone thats not to long, the tgo1 ws too long, make a smaller phone, not too long, and not to wide, then youll have a kick ass phone, ;;;;;Beautiful phone but hopefully this time the availabities can be at reach world wide;;;;;Well, you must agree that it's awsome the +250h talk time at least!;;;;;dont cry man, toshiba will do something 4u. lolz;;;;;is that so?who said so?this phone doesnt suits me..LOL..i still proud of my iphone n BB..hahaha..;;;;;Why would they release the same cellphone again with another name???;;;;;Its interesting to hear that. I thought they should market the phone that way. Upgradeable to series 7. Just like HTC HD2. But there are some rumours that WinPho 7 requires atleast 512 MB RAM, atleast 5 MP camera and the camera should have flash. I don't believe the camera part but probably the RAM part is the reason that Toshiba is not confirming the upgrade to WinPho 7. Its sad, who'd buy it then. Probably that'll leave the space for TG03... WTF!!!!;;;;;haha 5 hour standby;;;;;Toshiba you are a GOOD company, but PLEASE put better cameras on your phones, and put LED flash too, and you will be perfect. This phone has all the things I need, and many others need.;;;;;put android in and i'll buy it.;;;;;I spoke to a guy on the Toshiba stand today and asked if the TG-02 was upgradable to Windows 7 Mobile. He just smiled and said 'no comment', read between the lines! The phone does look nice, but then so did the TG-01. For me it's a choice between this running the new Windows OS and the HTC Desire for my next handset, was going to upgrade to a 3GS but iPhones are looking VERY dated now!;;;;;lol 275 h talking time xD;;;;;275h of talk time???;;;;;this model has Exactly the same specifications of the previous one. The only difference is that the windows mobile version is different and that gave the c**ts a reason to change the model no. Toshiba actually pays employees to change model names/ no. ???? without changing the features ???? that must be the best job in the world !;;;;;3.15 MP is totally outdated... grow up Toshiba BTW... I'm the first;;;;;Hmmm.... Capacitive Screen.... Toshiba already aiming for WinMo 7 which is nice. It'll be only the second phone after HTC HD2 with capacitive (I guess). I like the fact that its 3.15 MP camera. Hope performance is what it delivers and please don't even bother about the mindless Mega Pixel race. Anyone got Vodafone's number?
;;;;;  I got this phone a few months ago from orange uk(a very good price)First impression?Very BAD,slow ,not very responsive,average camera,very unreliable motion sensor.crashed a lot.But I unlocked it and changed the rom(cooked one)and it made a huge difference!I'm using it on 3 uk and when using Opera on good signal area it is amazingly fast!!!The motion sensor is responsive now and after installing a little piece of free software I can use Igo8 (which in my opinion is better than tom tom) .Spb shell looks and performs very well and the quality of calls has improved a lot.It looks like  the tg01 is a reliable piece of hardware but the ORANGE ROM makes it useless,so if you  buy one,better change the rom !;;;;;As a pocket computer it lives up to the specs, although it is completely hobbled by the utterly useless Windows Mobile. Even with SPB Mobile Shell running on it, which was the only way I could find to make it remotely user-friendly, the cruddy little interface, designed for styluses, not fingers, is always lurking to get in your way just when it is most inconvenient.  If you have experience of using a multi-touch capacitive screen the TG01 will infuriate you. Granted, the massive real estate and high resolution are fantastic for movies, the internet and email but it is grimly unresponsive; especially so with a screen protector fitted.  Answering calls can be a joke, with the user reduced to frantically swiping at the screen to answer while Windows tries to wake up. When you finally do manage to get it to respond (or, more usually, have to call back) the call quality tends to start off more or less acceptable and then deteriorate rapidly. Calls are frequently dropped and with every one of the four replacement handsets which Orange have foisted upon me, the person at the other end starts complaining within a minute or so that my speech is being cut up so badly they cannot make out what I am saying. I have resorted to using a five-year old Motorola which is clear as a bell, so go figure.  Conclusion: Great as a pocket-sized internet tablet but in twenty-five years of mobile phone use I have never had such a dog, such a lemon, such a massive pile of excrescence as this phone.  AVOID AT ALL COSTS AND *DO NOT* ALLOW ORANGE TO REPLACE ANY PHONE WITH THIS ONE. I have heard from the fellow delivering my many replacement phones that this is what they are attempting to do with all their unused and justifiably unloved TG01's. You have been warned.;;;;;very good phone if you know what you are doing, i got mine in the post yesterday and withing 3 hours i cooked me own rom to debrand and fix some common bugs, lets face it with all phones they all have issues which are man made, so man can fix them simply!!!   akatrojan@hotmail.com;;;;;DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE - You have been warned. I am on my third from Orange and all phones have suffered from static noises every minute or so which makes me inaudible and winds up my customers no end! Nothing wrong with WM6.5 it is a vast improvement over 6.1 and works well, unfortunately the actual phone doesn't! In addition to the static noises I have just lost all sounds from my phone like one of the other posts mentions. Do yourself a favour and avoid hours on the phone with your operator complaining and battling to get a new replacmeent model that is of similar spec - buy a different phone! The only way to resolve the issue is to fully re-boot the phone, battery off is best. The other really irritating thing is the time it takes to answer the phone - 8-10 seconds before it sorts itself out enough for the screen swipe function to work - result more missed calls. Orange (my provider) will only replace the phone like for like untill I have logged the same fault at least three times !!!!!!!!! Am waiting for my fourth handset as I write. Advice - DON'T GET A TG01

It'd nearly useless since its signal reception is so poor!;;;;;Is Garmin mobile xt (maps software) work on Tosshiba g810??? without external intenna?;;;;;This is without doubt the worst phone I've used. The touch screen is not very responsive and the rubbish windows operating system is not only slow but also crashes very frequently. Texting using the stylus is also a pain because it always flips between text settings if you accidently tap on the wrong bit - it's really irritating !!  There are lots of much better phones on the market, my advice is not to waste your money buying this rubbish !!;;;;;how the gps system is working and what type of external antenna may i use?;;;;;I have updated the ROM to WM 6.5. I need to get back to the older version WM 6.1. Any idea how to do that?;;;;;Most problems whith this phone come from wm6.5 roms. If you have any, revert to the original rom.;;;;;Hi! I'm not technician but I have some ideas to you. First ensure that all buttons are in good condition : not pressed, especially on/off button. Secondly, it can be a moisture problem, in that cas you must turn off your mobile and dry it with hair dryer (in a cold position!). If it is not the case it could be a software problem, you should see a repairman. Also please tell us whether you have had the same problems like this one: "I have had a lot of problems with the actual phone portion of this phone. The hardware is excellent but it has one major fault - it runs a Microsoft operating system." (It is one of the posts). And if you did how did you then solved them? The hardware is excellent but it has one major fault - it runs a Microsoft operating system.;;;;;It's kind of a cool 4ne.;;;;;its a great phone ebay its cheap to buy have fun with it its for the tech guys only;;;;;power supply 240v or 110v, pls advise;;;;; ;;;;;I want to ask you where can I buy one and ship it to Bosnia and Herzegowina.... plzzz i need a answer... this is a greeat phone;;;;;As I heard, Navilux is iGO version of software for Toshiba phones.;;;;;I received this device from a friend in Spain and did not have any GPS software installed on the card. I realized that the problem is not actually the installation, it installs correctly but the problem is that does not start. Someone told me that would be dedicated to work only with NAVILUX, but I have seen users on various forums that say they iGO works perfectly. It was like someone here on this site wrote that installed iGO and it works perfectly. If you know something about this problem please help me!!!;;;;;Hello Crys. What I can tell you is that I got original card with maps when I bought this phone. In manual (from iGO), it says that (backup reasons) it is neccessery to copy all files from original memory card to hard disc drive. But, when I copied that files (from hdd) to another memory card and put it inside phone I could not start NAVILUX (IGO) software. Maybe you should write to them at: ­  Greetings. Dusko;;;;;I tried to install igo on the device and fail. I copied IGO8 files on the memory card and inserted into the device when it asks me if I want to install i press "yes" and start installing. Loading bar installation until end once and this is it, nothing else. IGO icon appears in programs such as installed but when I start nothing happens. I tried different versions of IGO and all the same problem (i tried with miomaps same problem). I tried these versions of GPS on an Asus P320 and goes perfectly. (here, on Asus P320, are several steps installation not only one)  Does anyone know who would be the problem?  Please help!!!;;;;;Well, what can I say. I bought it for a song, half the price of HTC Cruise 09, and it has almost all the functions that I need.  Yah, if you use the phone for five minutes, like wifi, it gets slightly hot. But compared to my Motorola 3Vi, it is not as hot. Just a minor problem with slim phones. The touch screen is a bit less sensitive, so you need to put more pressure with the built in stylus, and you need to be precise as well. Battery life is OK if you are not continuously using 3g. Just imagine, if you were to design a phone that has that many functions, and squeezing it in a slim form like the 810, you will be very lucky to do it right. For Toshiba to make this 'SLIM BEAUTY' work as well as those from HTC and Nokia, they must be highly commended since they have not been a prolific like others. I installed the Garmin map and it worked wonderfully with very fast satellite locking. Maps are quite detailed and for once, GPS does worked as claimed.  I loved the form factor most. Just the right size. Slipping into and out of the pocket gives you a nice feeling, quite unlike those bulky Blackberries. However, the TOS 810 can't handle too many running programs simultaneously, so have unused programs properly closed. Can't blame it as it only has a 400 MHz processor. But then, its battery life is good, even can last 4 days on standby.  Overall, if anyone need a WinMo set on the cheap, this is the set to go for. It has almost everything, and more! Why go for those big branded types that can only go half as far. Get this one before it runs out of stock. You won't regret it!;;;;;Also, it restarts very often:-(.;;;;;do you need a simcard to use this phone? or can you use this even without a sim?;;;;;The 1st day when I used it a lot, it was hot too. But later it will be ok.;;;;;hye yesterday i was just going to buy g810 ..i have try it for a little long time just say one hour and after it i find the cell phone is hot..i asked the shop keeper first he said that is normal with windows mobile but i am a little afraid so if anyone of you can tell me..is it fine or not ?;;;;;Also, have on mind that there is "cold" and "hot" start at GPS receivers. When you turn on GPS for the first time you need a minute or a few minutes to receive the signal from satellite (be outside, please no obstacles above you toward the sky). This is called "cold" start, because for the first time GPS receiver needs much more time to catch the signal. When you turn off GPS and turn it on after (let`s say) 1 hour, it will catch the signal much more faster (this is called  "hot" start). P.S. Do not mind. My English is not too good.;;;;;When I bought Toshiba I got iGO maps. It works perfect. Of course, when you use GPS be outside (not in the house or in a closed space). GPS signal can not brake trough walls or similar. It can work near windows (cars, buses...). Also, check in Options is GPS receiver enabled.;;;;;Hello. So it wont work? Or do you think that if you update the firmware it can still works? tnx ;;;;;I have one. In case people are still confused about the specs: It only has 40MB internal memory, so you NEED a mini-SD card (not a problem for me cause I was gonna get one anyway). 128MB RAM - I understand this is very good for a mobile device, I still haven't used it up fully. Of course the #1 selling point is the screen, WVGA (800x480) in just a 3" screen! I dunno why people are complaining about the size of the screen or the writing being too tiny. You can just zoom in if the writing is too small, and I'm sure the writing will be clearer than a 320x240 screen of similar size.  However I can't comment on the colour depth, I haven't really noticed devices more than 64k colours.  But I do know that for web surfing and image/pdf viewing, you can fit more of the screen on here than on any other device of similar size.  Basically if the writing is too small for you, buy a bigger device with a bigger screen (a proper PDA).
 
Secondly the fingerprint recognition owns, and you can use it as a cursor/trackball (although unfortunately you can't see a cursor, just the links that you highlight). 
Apart from that it is a very new device, so you get almost all the Windows Mobile 6 goodness.  
Supports Wifi b/g, and WPA2 encryption. 
Bluetooth 2.0 EDR, and A2DP (stereo bluetooth) and AVRCP (remote control). 
It's 3G/HSDPA too (which is still not common enough for PDAs). 
Uses mini-SD card, which is cheaper than micro-SD, and hot swappable. 
Keyboard is very good. Decent size keys, and most reviews actually PREFER this keyboard over the HTC devices (e.g. Tytn), cause the keys are raised/rounded here. I prefer it simply because there are more keys, period. 
The unit itself is a bit bulky (a bit bigger than a Tytn), but that's forgivable considering the excellent keyboard and decent sized screen.
 
Now for the bad points.  
Firstly no SDHC support!!! So you can't get more than 2GB reliably at a time (yep I've tried "4GB non-SDHC mini-SD" but they aren't reliable). 
And yep shame no internal GPS (although everyone always says an external GPS box is 100x better anyway) 
And I have to admit the 3g and wifi reception is actually quite poor. 
Triband must suck for Americans too (although I assume this won't be a problem in the future). 
Camera (which is 2MP) is decent for a phone 2 years ago, but crap by my standards. As for video I don't mind QVGA, but I really needed 30fps.
 
Lastly the main thing putting this phone's reputation down is the early bugs. True, if you bought one of the early phones, you were in big trouble, with it refusing to come out of standby half the time. This was partially resolved with a patch, but only satisfactorily resolved with newer batches that contained a newer rom.
 
Overall I'm satisfied with the newer more stable version of the G900. Like most others, am willing to forgive the substandard camera and a few other issues for an excellent screen for web browsing, and imo excellent keyboard.
 
It's biggest competitors imo are the Nokia E90 (better camera, but unfortunately no touchscreen, and I would prefer Windows Mobile for apps than Symbian), and the forthcoming HTC Kaiser (which should have everything you need..  except the screen is still 320x240)
