Questions?;;;;;How many times are you guys going to compare with Nokia?Don't be so damn ridiculous.Symbian s60 is praised from many sources but use it and see what it's really like.I want a PPC to run full quality programs not some half thought out,made in 25minutes 100kb symbian app.If you think Nokia is so good trot off and buy an E90-Nokia claim it's the best unit for web browser!!sure thing.;;;;;Zaelo, you obviously have a problem with Canadians. I for one believe that Canadians are great (although I'm not Canadian) and have made important contributions towards mobile communications eg the ubiquitous Blackberry series. On the other hand you have made zero contributions apart from your ridiculous self-centred concept about mobile devices. All you talk about is what you personally need or like in a phone. Understand that I am talking about technological advances in all aspects of the multimedia palette. This is beyond the whims and caprices of an individual like you. That means on a high-end phone such as this, you are supposed to have a minimum of 3.2MP stills cam. Why? Because it produces printable photos. Video recording should be VGA at 30fps. Why? Because it produces sharp smooth running videos. The 3.0 inch screen should be able to display 24 bit, 16M colours. Why? Because it gives a more vivid and clearer encounter when working with multimedia. This is not simply a PDA. It is a multimedia business device, therefore the features have to meet contemporary standards. If Toshiba sincerely feel that stills and camcording are unimportant they should not include them, instead of giving us third rate features. When a manufacturer meditates on a feature and decides to implement it on a high-end phone (as opposed to a budget one), they have a duty to give you the best. I am not saying that the features should be as good as dedicated devices but they should meet reasonable standards. If the truth be said, the scientists at Toshiba cut back on quality in certain areas and they should not have done. The fact that it is only tri-band is a further irritant and limits its potential use.;;;;;To Zaelo: Stop bashing the Canadians. We are not interested with your grievances or neither do we want your prejudice on here. If you do not want technological improvements and business apps then why the hell get yourself a PDA in the first place? There are still plenty of telephone booths around every country so why even get yourself a mobile??? About 12-13 years ago before mobiles became mainstream, making calls and receiving them was very patchy due to poor coverage, SMS (text) was only to same network, no cameras, no video recorders, no MP3 players, no web surfing etc, etc...You're as guilty as every other mobile user in wanting bigger, better faster more.  Why should we get fobbed off by manufacturers putting in a great piece off technology next to a sub standard one? Cost cutting? Damn, you can get a decent laptop for the price of some of these PDA's, albeit a lot less portable. He's right, leave out the poor camera etc and cut the costs to consumers.;;;;;Zaelo, you misunderstand the point. Toshiba should give users the choice. If you personally do not need high-end features that is your choice but it is also anti-technology and anti-progress. There is no point in placing substandard stills and camcording in the device. Better for those features not to be there than to impose a lousy experience on the user. We are not machines; we are humans. Business and pleasure go hand in hand. You cannot work to a high standard if you do not rest. People want business and pleasure on the SAME device. Companies such as Nokia have proved time without number that this is possible. The E90 has a high res screen, business apps but still gives you reasonable imaging. Since this phone is high-end it should include reasonable features. Oh yes...Zaelo, don't pretend that this is not a multimedia device (geared towards business). Ask yourself what internet, stills cam, video cam, radio, WLAN, e-mail are doing on the device.;;;;;First, those who wrote against G900 are with canadian syndrome (never have seen but know everything) or real canadian (which automatically have this syndrome since they were born). I had Nokia, I had HTC, I had i-Mate. G900 could have some weak parts but... I do not need super video camera in it, I do not need colors more than 65K for PDA and I do not need super surround sound for PDA. And what I need this G900 has in whole and even more. The other "writers" just very seem to be out of ability to read at all because their capability of getting information has a lack. Very big one! Till now this is the most convinient, the most (and more than enough for PDA!!!!) feature holding, comfortable to use PDA phone. Neither Nokia nor HTC have such finger-top featured unit.   ;;;;;Guys, no panic! Toshiba already released the patch to fix the problem for the incoming calls on a blank screen; check   for the update. Let's say the truth, so long it's the best on the market as a screen resolution, processor speed & + WM Professional 6. If doesn't have GPS, it's not a big deal, you can buy a bluetooth one & keep it in you car... the should do the colours just like Nokia's sceens - 16mln...;;;;;I'm glad i did not purchase this PPC. Have you lot heard about the massive problems with this device? Toshiba of all companies should know better! It's not like its a cheap rip-off company somewhere in the depths of China making cheapo knock offs...or is it...I've been waiting for over two years now to replace my MDA Compact with the right PPC but nothing yet. HTC Kaiser looks promising but the screen resolution is still MDA Compact class, what's that all about after 2-3 years? Even Nokia's "smartphones" have better resolution and colour depth (N80 etc).;;;;;Hey, my thoughts exactly, you're 100% right. I think we should not get on the "I want latest gadget" bandwagon unless it has features worthy of its time in the relevant markets. I think they are cutting corners and saving themselves a bundle of cash. Some new technology with some old technology, ie screen colour depth, camera resolution etc...;;;;;Well what can I say. It sure looks like a worthy contender to Nokia's E90. A few points puzzle me. Why are so many pocket PCs stuck on 65k colours? It makes the screen look washed out. What's the point of great resolution with weak colours? Secondly why do pocket pcs religiously insist on substandard video recording and stills photography? If the manufacturers feel that they are unimportant why not leave them out of the device ?? Lastly where is the wisdom in making the device triband thereby restricting its use???;;;;;omg what a great phone with 520 mhz procesor. i love this phone and its camera and its desing and its features too;;;;;this phone good prodction but iam arabic man and i need  know the phone have arabic vargion only this my proplime plz. send to me on my e-mail thanx;;;;;it is writing above... video= Qvga= 240x320 pixels...;;;;;Does anyone know the video resolution of this phone?thanx;;;;;if you want the best pda phone with gps you need to wait for htc kaiser aka t-mobile vario III... the only drawback of kaiser is the classic qvga screen.;;;;;Has anybody got one of these yet, heard it was out in the UK on Friday. Also no GPS. Glofiish X800 looks better on most counts - pity the X500+ isn't 3G;;;;;1GB Rom is okay but...256 ram? Are you crazy? Yeah, what else? A battery lasting a lifetime? Some people just ask and ask without real need. How come it has "only" 40mb of ram? It has got 128 mb of Ram, are you saying that windows mobile 6 and drivers take up to 78mb or ram? Are you crazy too?;;;;;Got the processor speed : 520MHz. Ok that's fine for now but they really stuffed it by giving it ONLY 40MB of RAM. DAMN, it's going to end up running out of memery if you start loading it up and opening app after app without shutting them down. That's like sending Amir Khan in with Tyson for 12 rounds...I really wanted this PDA for the PDA stuff.;;;;;Can anybody tell me the type and speed of the processor. If it is capable of doing VoIP then does it have to be a pretty quick processor or does it not matter? 1GB ROM and 256MB RAM minimum and GPS would have been pretty much ideal for me for at least a year, but then again it does give us the WVGA screen. No doubt there will be other 'must have' features coming out next year or later this year.;;;;;USB 1.1 does knock me back a bit but it does say you can use USB keys, albeit at snails pace i suppose. Can't have everything, is there any other PPC better specced out there? If there is i'd like to know before i order a Tosh G900.;;;;;usb 1.1  wtf???;;;;;Compared to the TyTN this is a Gozilla spec PPC. Surfing the net on WiFi and reading MS Apps should be a doddle on the Tosh G900.  Hello Tosh, got a TOSHIBA?;;;;;I am waiting for this one to come out. I'll get the Nokia 6500 slider for phone calls when it comes out and a medium end digital camera for pictures. I know that it's a lot of gadgets but this Toshiba has a heck of a screen, 800x480. HTC are you watching??? Beat this on spec and size and you have a customer in me. I lusted after the N95 but then fell out of love with it. Be serious Nokia lovers the N95 has great spec but i hear that the camera isn't true 5MP and battery life "sux" besides i have found Pocket PC's easier to live with and for data handling. Are there any compatibility issue with having a screen this size? Selecting of items for copying and cutting such as images, mp3s, text messages, etc. are not improved. Selecting are processed one by one. It's not easy to use. And the GPRS in the Philippines cannot be used in Toshiba G500. It's very poor. I hope Toshiba company will improve this given problems.;;;;;Drop call, switch to silent profile after incoming call, noisy---Toshiba service center said it has good voice pickup. Other problems due to Microsoft, the hardware is OK.  Never use Toshiba again. After one year use of G500, I switch to Nokia E52. My last phone, Ericsson T610, I used it for 3 years until the shell broken down.  G500 has tons advanced functions, none of them work.  1. The profile can switch to silent if the calendar is marked busy. It works, but not switch back after meeting. I disabled this function, it switch to silent profile after each incoming call. So, I have to set the silent profile same as normal profile. Before meeting, I have to modify the normal profile to disable ringer sound. Very annoying. 2. Received lots of complain about voice quality. G500 picks lots of background voice. T610 is better than this high tech. phone.
 
3. I set the wifi, if I entered wrong key, it hard reset the phone. 
 
4. Usually drop call after one ring.
 
I deliver this phone to toshiba serive center. In Hong Kong, Toshiba is selling through Chevalier. The service lady has very good manner.
 
"Soory for lots of background noise. This means this phone has very good reception. For the other problems, they are not a matter of Toshiba. This is due to Microsoft Windows problem. So, we have noway to solve it. I can try to reset." Then, hundred times of sorry.
 
Not thing improved after reseting.

phone_reviews:
;;;;;Nice;;;;;I have one of these phones, very user friendly and the battery as good performance. Not big on standby time but good on real life usage. Unfortunately it was a disaster. Worst buy ever for me and why? Simply because it can't cope with the humidity of the Azores Islands. After only 3 months of usage the keyboard was completely mess up, due to moist.  ;;;;;The main problem with this phone is the very low volume from the speaker. And this is a VERY BIG problem. It is a mobile phone after all and not hearing the phone because you are in the next room it is really bad. There is also NO led or something to indicate that you lost a call. I have gone back to my old Siemens CF62. You can't miss a call with that one. Very loud speaker and so many leds that looks like a Christmas tree if you miss a call. Thank God there is Opera mini and Toshiba is going to be used as a cheap mobile internet solution.;;;;;its showing sogood& nice,what iexplane about this,really good,;;;;;I hve used Toshiba phones, once had Ts605, now with Ts608, they are good, nice designs, but the battery is disaster.;;;;;Hi there, can somebody tell me about Toshiba ts605 :It works in US;;;;;I'm not so satisfied from this phone, because his software its too bad, he is restarting often, if you drop him, he's turning off at the same moment, it's slow, like turtle and the battery is disaster. But i can't say nothing about design.;;;;;Good: *It got bluetooth 1.2 and J2ME MIDP 2.0 *Can take video(3gp format) and photos(jpeg) MIDPSysInfo Java program works! You can check info for your mobile! Not good: Bluetooth and Java: *No bluetooth API for Java applications:  bluechat and valhallachat programs do not work! 
If you want to chat you must stick to regular bluejacking!(device name change, or sending address book contact with intended message);;;;;toshiba phone is absolutely perpect 4 me. so far an a+ rating. now i have 2 toshiba phones       ( ts605 & my latest ts30) frm h.k. i love this toshiba phone its users friendly.;;;;;Once i start to charge him switched off and he stay alive three times longer!;;;;;i have this ts605 from my wife n h.k . i thought it's ok  but the mp3 that i download to micro sd can't read ;;;;;my  batery dies very fast too :(((;;;;;I have the same phone and I love it except the charge doesnt take long. the battery dies so fast. Do you have a problem like this???;;;;;i cant put song ot picure  bigger than 350 kb in the memory card whyyy???;;;;;For the 350 kb mp3 you can put memory card microSD with 1 GB and you will transfer mp3 bigger than 350 kb.That's all.;;;;;I interested in buying this phone because i wish a cheap phone which has basic features and FM radio. now when people say its slow can you please explain what features are slow? thanks;;;;;i have this phone for one mounth and it shutting down by self;;;;;Toshiba have a GREAT PROBLEM with MP3 format, if song or file is bigest 350 k NOT Suported.WHY;;;;;I find this mobile really good. Particularly its design. so thin and not heavy at all.!.!. However i have a problem about finding handsfree for this model... anyway.. it is sooooooo gooooooooooood.. ;;;;;I find that mobile great!!! Although it's a little slow and the sounds are little low, in my opinion it has perfect design! I am certainly gonna get it. It is awesome!!!!!;;;;;This phone is great.Good look.;;;;;I will change my TS605 as soon as possible... this phone is garbage...  work too slow, bluetooth is older, you don`t even know when rings... Toshiba must let Nokia, Samsung or LG to make phones... I regret my money for this phone. ;;;;;This mobile is so GREAT. Cool in 1 product, top top;;;;;you need to set the default storage to memory card so you can transfer bigger files;;;;;I've just bought Toshiba TS605 and it's OK but bluetooth can transfer only 350-400kb, is it right or only on my phone? ;;;;;i hate this phone..i have bought it 2 weak before...its very slow...hanging problem with this phone is not goooooood;;;;;i hate toshiba phones...they r making non sense phone....toshiba phones should be banned;;;;;the software is on the toshiba site   direct   please tell me do you have a menu optio on the usb feature, "pc software" or something like that thnx;;;;;I bought a Toshiba ts605. Which software it is necessary to connect to a PC? How to get it?  How to connect the blue tooth? I try but it was requested a password? Can somebody help me to solve this problems?;;;;;does anyone know why i dont have the usb menu that communicates with PC only usb drive says :@;;;;;thats the correct picture i have it in my hands ;;;;;i have bought this mobile, but all the instructions are in spanish. I have no idea how to work it and also does anybody else know how to lock it? please help meeeeeeee!!;;;;;ok.... so its the same;;;;;the ringtone is alright... use your own mp3.. don't use the built in and the picture is wrong thats TS32;;;;; I have the same problem (low level sound) ringing and playback sound /speakerphone and headset as well. Could anyone please tell me a hint, code, or software to solve it? Thanks Mike;;;;;hey guys,i just tested this phone and saw that it has very low sound level and it's difficult to even notice it ringing!!i ghanged the proper settings but still...have any idea why??;;;;;feature-wise, this fone is drab. but its design . . . wow. amongst the most sleek bar style fones around. ;;;;;Video Record don't work with 1GB micoSD memory card.;;;;;Is there anyway.. some one can suggest TOSHIBA to increase the Talk Time ( battery life).  With a fierce competition from other mobile manufacturers, the talk time is very less. I would be happy to buy this, if its released to Indian Market. TOSHIBA... are you hearing???;;;;;marvelous design;;;;;stick to washing machines toshiba and leave phones to nokia ect ,this isnt even a spec list from 2 years ago very poor indeed;;;;;Hellow, Actually igot news from market a lot abt Toshiba GSM Phones.And Toshiba is comming in a very Strongly to the market.Now im working For Motorola at Bharti (Orissa),im in this trade for last 5yers in so many telecom GSM Products.Though I dont Have the Email Id of Ur HR,im intrested for Toshiba For Orissa.If any Openings pls let me know in above mentioned email Id of Mine.;;;;;it looks great but talk time is suck.......;;;;;Hey!! phone_reviews:
;;;;;Still good, like India and Pakistan. Asiatic people mostly use dumb phones, because of no 3g Technology, Mostly they use phone for call and sms, and big talk time, which not possible in Smart phone.;;;;;do u use this cell????????????????;;;;;Hi Toshiba ur's TX80 is a mobile phone or a calculator...such a UGLY phone I ever seen...should take my advise....stop making mobile phone... ;;;;;your right there they have always been stealing idea's;;;;;i bouhgt 904t for my girlfriend and 911t for me,there's nothing better then toshibas and sharps,nokia never again,nokia just stilling ideas from japanese mobile market;;;;;Currently living in Japan, so I bought the Japanese version.  Got it cuz I wanted a good camera and good music player all on one phone, and also one that can type in Japanese for practice as well as will work in the US (have to pay to get it unlocked somewhere). (keep in mind this is the Japanese version, Softbank 811T) Quick overview:  cons- -No bluetooth -Music player only plays mp4 files (it comes with a program for converting but it has trouble installing on non-japanese installs of windows.  i got it to work but it won't recognize japanese/chinese/korean text in song files)--notice: this con may not be applicable to the non-japanese version -Camera has no auto focus, not great flash -I think its kinda ugly pros- 
-3mp camera has great quality most of the time 
-Music player is pretty good, has equalizer and is quite usable (first phone mp3 player i've used so take this for what its worth) 
-Can control music player without opening phone via buttons on outside 
-Easy to press/see buttons (fully backlit too) 
-Good size (not huge, esp considering the wealth of features) 
-Outside lights for notification of new emails etc 
-Supports video call with secondary front-mounted vga camera 
-Quite usable interface 
-Upgradable/removeable memory (mirco sd card, max size as of Oct. 07 = 2gig) 
-3g and quadband gsm support
 
Personally I have always wanted a phone that would be my music player, camera, and phone, and not suck.  With the nice 3mp camera (even with no auto focus and not much of a flash) and the music player (which I find just fine) I am quite happy with this phone.  No bluetooth support is kind of stupid and a big pain for some.. I personally am ok with it.  The Japanese one DOES make a sound when you take a picture, although it's not very loud.  I keep it on vibrate most of the time but I don't feel like the ring is exceptionally loud.  Hope this helps, sry it's the Japanese version.;;;;;Does the 811T have the same mobile charger as the 903SH? I really want to know! I really like  the look of the orange one.;;;;;Just bought TX80 in red color, which is a japanese version with Chinese firmware. Overall, the phone is nice in terms of sound(via headphone), screen, build quality and reception quality. The only drawback is the absence of the bluetooth. With just few japanese phone in the market, we cannot be too demanding for them. I would still recommend this phone to everyone. ;;;;;Does anyone know what the sound is like on this mobile? Is it loud?;;;;;Scary, looks like a baby moniter. Or something you can get in a pound shop;;;;;it looks like an octopus...;;;;;bought it, everythings good cept that no bluetooth kinda sucks when sending stuff and no autofocus makes it kinda hard to take pics. But other than that the white ones look very very nice. Everyone loves it, just a lil bit quiet tho in my opinion.;;;;;not good.. too complicated and the sound its too low, I never awser my calling because I cant hear the phone ringing!;;;;;Does the internet and the picture messaging only work in Japan?.. Thinking about buying this phone but worried it wont work with my needs.And also, does it take both t-mobile and Cingular..I may switch.---please answer.I am in need of another phone I need help.;;;;;I heard the phone doesn't have shutter sound when you take a picture. The sample photos look nice as well. Too bad it doesn't have bluetooth. ;;;;;it looks like an octopus...;;;;;u could find it on ebay for $300;;;;;400$ for this phone good deal if u dont mind the absence of bluetooth 400$ in the US or canada or where?;;;;;Hey . . . I actually quite like the white one.  And the camera quality with this phone is superb.  But then again, it's quite pricey >_;;;;;I can get this phone for $400, is it worth it? ANYONE?;;;;;eew.. hate this phone its ugly, no bluetooth, no autofocus for $500, i'd rather get a nokia, samsung, SE, Sharp, or even LG -_-";;;;;did anyone buy this phone? any opinions on it? like its pros and cons? thnx;;;;;oh no why no bluetooth>_< if only it had bluetooth it would be the perfect phone!;;;;;why no bluetooth? why? why? why?;;;;;I finally managed to find a review in English, it's on Gearfuse;;;;;if this phone has a price under 400$ is the best deal for anyone.... belive me...;;;;;the pink one is REALLY  ugly =.=;;;;;1st to post again double yeah

Games for this cellphone I dunno, but dosen't need...;;;;;do we need a java code play games like samsung?;;;;;Does any one know if java games may be installed via bluetooth?;;;;;is there a way loading game with bluetooth,usb cable or with a card reader? is it only work with wap?;;;;;hey guys i have the phone but when i run the data manager it cant connect to the pc,says cannot connect or something. i have vista, i just want to put some @$#@!@ songs in the phone and i cant.please help me.;;;;;Hey Angel,  How are you doing today? Therez a very simple solution to your problem, just remove the memory card from your mobile phone & insert the memory card into the card reader and connect the card reader to your computer and transfer the mp3 tracks, I am sure it wud not take even 10 mins to transfer 10 tracks that way. Once ur done, disconnect the card reader from ur computer & insert the card to the phone. Now ur all set. Have a nice weekend. Cheers!!;;;;;please anyone could tell me operating voltage (output voltage)for this phone, i got the phone but charger is missing, couldnt find charger in market, help me..;;;;;Bought it 6 months ago for 300 euros!! today you can find it at the stores for 100! Really sucks! You cant download files more than 1mb via wap and the 500mb micro sd is like useless because if you use the data cable you can only transfer files to the phone memory and  not the memory card! It took me 8 hours to transfer 10 mp3 songs from my pc to the phone as i had to transfer them one by one to the phone memory and then move them to the memory card!! It takes like an hour to move a 6mb song from the phone memory to the memory card!!!! This supposed to be a 3g phone???;;;;;do you know any available game and application for ts705?;;;;;this phone is by far the worst phone I have ever had.. you cant even assigm different ringtones to messages (only the ones which were there by default)..you can only use your own ringtones for phonecalls. Also the batteryindicator is wrong (goes off even though it says its still half full) oh and if you set a "one time" alarm at night (before 0 o clock) to like 6 am in the morning it wont work because it asumes you meant YESTERDAY.. (got late to work because of that).  I wrote toshiba about it..and hey..they dont care.. I  am glad I got rid of that thing. ;;;;;No, only supports a 512mb micro sd card;;;;;pls can anyone tell me if this phone supports more than 1 Gb card??? i`m intrested in buying a 2 Gb card but... i don`t wanna take unless i know if it`s supported by the phone...i have a 512 Mb card.. and...;;;;;amm toshiba, if this phone will become available in pholippines you know i will buy because i like the rotating camera coz i had Nokia 6630 but in the package it doesn't have a video stand free;;;;;this model really caught my eye, maybe because it has a rotating cam, i really want one like that, i just wished it was 2 or 3MP. .;;;;;toshiba plans for a share at european mobile market.why make this model look like SE T610?should try a bit harder on design.anyway it seems nice,the cam function is brilliant and it's toshiba!does anycody know the expected price?i am very curious for the review about the ui etc and the brand generally because its a newcomer ;;;;;it's look amazing i realy craze on this phone anyone tel me the price of this phone and wat abt the clarity of the picture,is it possible to transfer images frm nokia.anyone one tel me.thanx in advance.;;;;;it's nice & good looking it gives an hygenic look in future set was very much impressed by all;;;;;the flipping camera is indeed cute... For such a low price, it's packed with really techy features... I'm wondering, however, why a giant computer company like Toshiba is manufacturing these kind of phones... Sure, they're joining the bandwagon of mobile phone success but I kind of expected more from toshiba. I'm looking forward to the day they would come-up w/ phones w/ unique toshiba interface and wi-fi function, etc... i do hope that this phone will be reviewed just so we can peak into the works of this phone, especially its user interface. toshiba phones make me curious. I loved their computers but I'm not sure if it can invoke the same emotion through its mobile phones.;;;;;Hmm, what a cool idea for a camera placement! Well done toshiba, it looks excellent for normal photos and also self shots..you can even use ur phone as a mirror to apply lipstick, haha.  I hope the hinge for the camera has a lock mechanism or something so that over time, you dont have the problem of dealing with a loose flipping camera, literally. Otherwise a very unique camera design. Hope other companies pick it up as well, i think its great!;;;;;very nice looking phone! i like that candy bar design and it is so male! the phone for gentlemanes! bye;;;;;the phone look nice, it reminds me of the sony ericsson k300.;;;;;Oops! I just realised the the camera flips out! My bad!!;;;;;What the hell is that?! Why put a gert camera on the side of the phone? Gettin it in ur pocket will suck ass!;;;;;Love the flippy outtery camera!!;;;;;Well, in my opinion it`s so great phone. It has so many function although it`s cheap. I think it`s so easyier to handle than others and may pass.;;;;;looks like SE T610 :P;;;;;hai this phone has a difrnt cam setup difrnt but need 2 do morethan tat 2 impress me.

Tx.;;;;;High quality for Japanese market but there are some disappointments: 1/ The contacts list is my nightmare, 2/ on receiving a new sms I can see only the sender's cell phone number even though the number already exists in the phone and on sim.  ;;;;;hi there! we the same unit of toshiba but i cannot play mp3 format? and can i possibly download the software that enabling my unit to be used here in the philippines? thanks;;;;;Just got my hands on this 904T (canyon red) for just two weeks now, installing mp3 is not a problem, just need the beat engine box and couple of instructions, and the correct phone number on the settings menu. also, the beat engine box does not support all bitrates, usually, the songs that i load are 128kbps, with sampling of 44.1khz, 192kbps with sampling rate of 44.1khz, 48kbps with sampling rate of 32khz..those were the tested bitrates so far. and its good just like my 803T before. the only thing that is annoying is the Writing Language, it automatically sets itself to T9 english or japanese. no normal multitap, you still need to select from the Input method.  for the phonebook entry, you need to re-edit every single entry if you just copied it from a simcard, then select the search method (By reading) this way, the phone searches for the last name of the entry. for the beat engine box, try to check the CD that comes with the unit, otherwise, contact me. xyvorxedrix@yahoo.com regarding games, until now, i cant make it work... maybe there's a trick in installing java games on this phone.
 
enjoy

The camera quality is not very good, because it has a CMOS sensor. My sharp 902 takes better pictures than this one. And also, you have to use the Beat software that comes with it in order for you to transfer mp3 to your miniSD card.  Overall, the clamshell is pretty good, the features are good too BUT its good only for the JAPANESE market. ;;;;;if i knew the ui is so retarded, i would hv opt for the sharp 705. smaller, simpler, n cool. the extra features that came w the 904t isn't work the extra weight n bulk.;;;;;you have to use the "beat engine" software to transfer mp3 to the phone.  i can't get the phone to connect to my win xp pro notebook. nokia worked fine. i want to sync w my outlook contacts etc. anyone know how? i miss my nokia. these jap phones hv lots of catching up w nokia in terms of ui n sync w pc.;;;;;i got and unlocked one from ebay for $285. the size wasn't what I expected lol. it's probably the the biggest phone I ever had lol. i got a 1gb memory card. put a bunch of mp3 and some images. none of mp3s worked and all gif images wouldn't work because "image size is too large".  those are the negatives so far. i will update later!;;;;;Heard from someone that the mp3 ringtone can only store a maximum size of 300k is it true?;;;;;well its great..i have been using it for a month its has no problem..it cant play mp3 but u must used beatengine to convert it...n the batt is 880mah...but if in sms it cant turn off the t9 function..its a problem for me...i love the design only its too big..stereo sound its not bad...overall for me its a good phone....;;;;;The built-in MP3 player software has the 2 following functions: a 6-mode equalizer and a 6-mode surround... It has a stereo speaker as well.  Menu and sms language only in English and Japanese. the 5 tiny buttons on the "Head" of the phone controls the mp3 player while the clamshell is closed, the keys can be locked if u wanna put the phone into your pocket...;;;;;Amazing fone, the coolest!!;;;;;By the way this phones got 3G! Fix the error! :);;;;;As I know T-mobile doesn't support the GPS navigation service in America.  Correct me if I'm wrong.  Thanks!!;;;;;another cool phone from toshiba.... hope i`ll can buy sometime a toshiba fone :)

Default is 1234, if this doesn't work, ask your seller.;;;;;password is  9999;;;;;atually my mom is using this phone, it is quite handy.. but im having difficulty finding what type of media format is compatible for it? because mp3 doesnt work in it either...;;;;;pls help me.why is there a pasword wen i use the bluetooth..whats d default pasword?how to know it?i bought it 2nd hand;;;;;i really like my vodafone than to my other phone..but i want to know how to download games and MP3 on my phone...pls..tell me how..thanks;;;;;well for me this fone seems great except for some features like mp3? and  java games? but the macro and the camera itself is really perfect. maybe one of the best if ths two problems may solve.;;;;;Continuing from my previous post... I've tried almost everything, and so far .3gp and .mmf are the only file types that work, .mmf being the higher quality of the two.  Today I decided to make a search in Japanese for "chaku-uta" files, and I stumbled upon a guide for converting to .mmf files.  The program supplied is a Japanese program, and it is excellent.  You can choose the sampling rate for the .mmf files, and its obviously been designed for making ringtones (you can even make your own vibration/LED pattern for each song).  Make sure to cut your song to around 20 seconds, and convert to .wav.  The resulting .mmf must be 300kb or under to work.  Scroll down to the bottom, all the programs are supplied there (the most important being mmf converter, and SSD-MA3-SMAF, which is required for installation.;;;;;how can i put some mp3 files on my vodafone 903T??email me pls...thanks..;;;;;Design: 8 out of 10 Great looking phone, clean and simple.  I think it could be perhaps be a little thinner or at least lighter, and a little shorter.  Overall its a pretty bulky phone.  Also, the hinge seems a little flimsy.   Features: 7 out of 10 To be honest, if you're using this phone outside of the Vodafone network (like in America), you're missing most of the key features like the GPS and browser.  The GPS wasn't a big deal to me, but not being able to use the browser was kind of a bummer.  The biggest disappointment though is the lack of MP3 support.  Not being able to use my own ringtones is a huge disappointment to me (3GP 's quality is absolutely terrible), and I'm currently trying to figure out how to convert my MP3s to Mpeg-4 aac+, which is the format of the Chaku-Uta ringtones, and I'm not even sure if it'll support that. Everything else program wise is pretty much standard.  The large screen is nice, and the camera seems to perform well also.   Performance: 8 out of 10 As a regular phone it performs well, but theres really nothing too special about it.  The lack of support for 850mhz is also something that American buyers need to remember.  I get decent reception, but definitely not as good as my Cingular 3125, which I usually get full bars everywhere I go.   I bought this phone because I found it for a good price and wanted to have a phone for when I next go to Japan.  If you're only planning on using it in America and were hoping to get a "super advanced Japanese phone", you should probably just save your money.  If you're looking for a Japanese phone just because its Japanese, this one is a good choice. ;;;;;if yuo want to experience watchings mtv clips here is the quick guide on activating your mms/grps/streaming.. for 3g settings for smart users only: type in:  set N90   ----send it to 211 go back to the main screen and don't touch anything even if there is a message just don't read it and keep it onto the main screen and never touch anything until you the mms/gprs/streaming settingswill arrive...and if it asks for a pincode just type in 1234....after that just turn off your phone and turn it on again...try to go in vodafone live and it should direct you to smart hmepage..... note:you should have a load at least P15... if you have some few questions just try to text me onm y number 09184219142...if I can't reply onto your message it means got no load :p hehehe...;;;;;Do you think this is like a laptop or something? Thank you! ;;;;;oh so sorry if you don't know the process of downloading a file in rapidshare here's the shortcut link i'd put on my last post...click this url,scroll down,enter the code,and download... try it..  you can try this downloading via your phone using web browser..(didn't try it maybe it'll work heheh just try if you don't have usb,card reader or anything which you can connect your phone into a pc)  ;;;;;h! friends...i have a problem with my phone,,V902T i cant download like games,and i think my phone memory was good enough and more spaces to make it download,,when i download it always prompt this THIS CONTENT CANNOT BE DOWNLOAD DUE TO SIZE LIMITATION i really dont know why is it happen 2 my phone,even the small kilobytes i downlod,its always failed,i was so bored with my phone,what can i do,pls hope u understand my english,and i really hope that somebody want to help me,pls.post your answer.here.tnks 2 all;;;;;hello guys..its me again...the ma-5 thing...ok i'm gonna shed some light now...this phone is not supported with mp3 playback right...they only play mmf...and mmf has  decoders mainly ma-2,ma-3,ma-5 and ma-7...ma-7 is the latest and has the greatest audio quality of all but sad to say toshiba isn't supported with it...but ma-5 also gives you better quality(i also used this)    well here is a lil try of what i've edited...just click this url download and save anywhere you want on your pc and transfer it onto your phone....   and that's what it is...try it and you'll love the sound quality...the song is beautiful girl sang by jojo... if you want to edit some wave files by yourself... just visit this site   and fine wave ound decorator and dload it...but remember the file size is limited and the edited mmf file should not be over 300kb..if you have something to ask just post here and i will try to answer...have fun^^;;;;;aw...i think it was you who texted me last night about music features of 902t. Honestly, i am interested on texting you about it however, i was so sleepy last night. just to let you know i am working on night shifts so i hope you understand if i can't reply to your messages.  you know who you are. anyways. going back onto your post, i hope you don't mind if you could share tips and tricks in regard to this phone. particularly you have said something about that ma-5 thing. how does it work? how can you play full track music given that you said it's only good for 30secs? where can we download the converter (just be specific hehe)? comparing to mp3 what can we expect?  i really dont know about that info. hope you could shed us some light on this, it would be appreciated.  thanks   ;;;;;its works very fine for me when it comes to music....mine is a japan made toshiba 902..yes it an't play mp3 music but it can play ma-5(visit yamaha site and you can see an mmf converter)don't use ma2 converter use wave sound converter...ma-5(much more better than that damn mp3) supports better quality than ma-2....you should try to grind it yourself....just use a lil brain on doing it.very simple...well its good only for 30 secs of music...but i figured it out myself o how i can play it full track but its for my personal use only....;;;;;please let me know via this post if the steps i have provided worked on your phone. if you have queries..just post. ^_^;;;;;for the convenience of smart users who wants to unleash watching mtvs, video clips, and hi-speed downloading on your 902t, here's what you need to do: **again, smart users only..no globe: SET 3G N70 (send to 333 - just do it) once done, you'll receive your settings and will be asked to activate them. Code required will be simply 1234. then, check your network settings. It should give you Smart Internet Smart GPRS Smart MMS
 
These settings can be viewed but cannot be edited.
 
Reboot your phone then try the Vodafone Live! link in your browser...it should lead you to smart's home page.

 
Try other sites such as google and yahoo and it should work. if you have questions text me at 09286570631
 
thanks and good luck....^___^;;;;;h! every1...i have my v902t,,and i really love it..but sad 2 say..theres a lot of problems with my phne.,ac2ally im a globe users,,so,i hve already a gprs nd mms settngs..but un4tunately,globe cannot give me a cmpatible 4 streaming settngs.and ever since,i cant try 2 experience the live channels..i hope somebody help me on how do i get the cmpatible streaming settngs and even smart cannot give me a mms and gprs settngs,specially streaming settngs,,,and also my prblem is my phone is not cmpatible to files like, sis,zip,wav,mp3, only jad,3gp,amr,jpg,smf.and when i downlod,like gif 10kb,the prompt is This content cannot be download due to size limitation...i think my phone memory is enough 4 me download,but sad 2 say i really cant do it.  i hope u can understand  my grammar,coz i live here in the philippnes..and i hope u can help me,,i wait 4 response soon..i really really need your help.you can txt me my smart no.09202221925,un4tunately my globe no.is private,and sorry 4 that...please hope somebody want 2 help all my prblms..BIG THANKS 2 all.;;;;;one more thing, if you are going to download games from republika.pl, do it on PC, hover the mouse on the link, type the link on your phone, and it'll do straight download.  DO NOT use the phone to browse the site. it will waste your time and your load as well. lastly, for music stuff, unfortunately, the phone can't read mp3s - only 3gp, amr, midi, and smf. so just bear with its low quality sound or sell the phone if you are not satisfied. anyhow as for me it's still a very nice phone. ^_^;;;;;hi again, i have read the posts from other 902t users, and I think i can help you with some concerns.  in regard to downloading games, try to get them at these sites:  www.getjar.com  wap.getjar.com  uncleallevil.republika.pl  sharp_902.republika.pl do not save them on memory card, use phone memory instead. It won't allow you to save games on memcard for reasons that i don't know. don't worry though, the phone has lots of space good enuff for maybe 10+ games (or even 20 i guess). I only have 5 with me and I enjoy playing them. 
default password of 902t in case you do not know is 9999. you should try these passcode if you need to master rest the phone. please refer on my previous posts on how to setup your 3g to enjoy downloading games and browsing stuff through this mobile phone (NOTE: smart users only - no globe).
 
as for bluetooth, unfortunately u can only use blutooth for sending contacts and notes. but for sending pix and other stuff, you can only use MMS or Infrared. You can receive pix via BT but you won't be able to send using it. 
 
as for USB issues, i do not have a USB cable with me. what I use to transfer stuff is a memcard reader, and OTA - for downloading stuff online.
 
hope this post helped you in someway. my contact 09286570631. i do not answer nos. from TM, globe or sun.

RAMISH is in distress!!!;;;;;helle ppl, it's me again. For SMART3G users, to unleash the phone's 3g capabilities, register your phone as N90, and it should work. Vodafone Live! menu will be enabled and it'll lead you to SMART's homepage. For detailed instructions: - SET 3G N90 (send to 211) - GPRS ON (send to 333) - MMS ON (send to 333) As for everyone's concern regarding playing music files...someone suggested to convert mp3s to 3GPs to play them. I've tried that ImTOO software thingy and sad to say, i am not satisfied with the results. 3GP files have a very low bitrate - PROS: if you have a 1gb sd card, you can store LOTS of music files  CONS: WORST SOUND QUALITY EVER!

Thanks.;;;;;Free Vodafone Toshiba TS803 USB driver download (English version with connectivity software): Link:   Easy way to play MP3: 1. Format your SD card first using your Toshiba TS803 2. Do not use Beat Engine software to transfer music, because itll encrypt your MP3 files and if you change SIM, you will no longer be able to play those songs. Also it'll no longer be in "MP3" format so that you won't be able to play it in another device. 3. Now after connecting USB cable, go to the menu Settings >> Connectivity >> USB >> and here select Music transfer mode in your mobile. Now youll see a new drive in My Computer in your PC. 4. Go to that drive, and go to the folder like M:\PRIVATE\VODAFONE\My Items\Sounds & Ringtones. And here is the most important trick that is DO NOT create any folder under a folder in it. That is you can create a folder named John Denver under the folder Sounds & Ringtones but DO NOT create any folder under John Denver folder. Only you can put MP3 files under John Denver folder.
 
5. You can create another folder named George Michel under Sounds & Ringtones folder. Just copy and paste MP3 files in it. Nothing else. And so on. IF YOU PUT ANY MP3 FILES OTHER THAN UNDER THE FOLDER  Sounds & Ringtones, YOU WONT BE ABLE TO PLAY IT. This is the trick. Also make sure your mp3 files bit stream is not more than 192kbps. Sometimes you can find people selling the cd.;;;;;from which website can I download the beat engine software??  can anyone help me please?;;;;;Great things about this phone- camera is great quality. pictures and videos are very good. Mp3 is clear and loud. Message input is easier after getting used to it.  -------------- I spent a few hours trying to transfer my mp3 files using beatbox. I transferred all my songs except some. (phone says file can't be played). ANYWAY- before tranferring music files, you install beatbox software. NEXT, you make sure to install all usb drivers using the cd). THEN, from beatbox software, you have to set your mobile number. (this can be changed if you switch usim cards).  ALSO set your mobile number in your phone under CONTACTS. ---then connect your phone using the USB.  
while its connected to the computer, go to SETTINGS on your phone, and then CONNECT(USB). Set it to music transfer. (Dont worry about the offline thing.) 
 
Then open beatbox software. You can add all your mp3 files to library. Then, transfer to your phone.  
WHEN you are done, go to file on beatbox and quit. 
 
then disconnect your phone.

In sunlight, pictures taken to objects not too far (a few meters) are very clear, as if it would have autofocus. Objects that are far, like buildings or threes are not so clear, especialy if they don't have direct sunlight. Indoors or in the night, pictures are bad. Colours are great, "CCD power" !  The settings available in the menu are great, a lot of small details that together make up quality ( operator name on the screen *yes *no, folder password, different led colours for different warnings, etc.). And the design of the phone is stylish, it looks much better in reality than in the pictures, especialy when it is open, deppending of it's colour.  On the whole, a great phone, a great brand. ;;;;;I bought one of these phones the other day. It was described as good working order. I plugged it in to charge up and it still wasn't doing anything after six hours on charge. It wouldn't switch on or showed any sign of being working.;;;;;here we go;;;;;Don't buy it. Can't get a new battery anywhere. everybody who advertises it eventually cancels the order and refunds the money;;;;;i lost my charger  where can i get one (mission impossible);;;;;I realy like this phone but can't find it anywere.  Can anyone tell me how i can buy one please?;;;;;Love the phone, but cannot get a new battery anywhere!;;;;;Not to buy in Central Europe.;;;;;I had this phone since Jan 07 and is still using it. It's pretty cool to carry a phone which no one has and it look like an iPod. Most of my friends cannot find where the SIM card is placed.... I give 90 marks for a not expensive, cool, different, light and trendy phone. All cheers.;;;;;Well ive had my phone for over a year. When i first saw it i thought it was cool looking.  Then when i got it out of the box i was shocked to find it was painted plastic !!!!   The 2 weeks later found that I couldn't not buy ANY accessories for it !!  My Vodafone store couldn't  or wouldn't help and said to me what do you want for a cheap phone ? Funny you wanted to sell it to me. !!   Any ways even more miffed when I find that I cant hook it  up to a PC to get all the photos I've taken with it in to the PC to print out !!   Any one know how I can do this ???  as so far NO one can help . Tried Toshiba but after spending 25 mins on the phone getting no where I gave up.  I'm still using it the Phone and taking pictures,  the night time setting is good for very low light photos.  Ring tones are very bad.  Tried recording my own but gave up as the sounds is dismal. 
 
I'm also wondering how do i get the phone to store Incoming Txts to the Phone an don't the sim card ?  Is that even possible ?  The instruction manual is  not very forth coming with info.
 
At least its compact and not heavy.  Even if the battery life is very short !!  an not coming with  a car charger its a real pain !!
 
Well if any one reads this and you can help me out drop me a line  daveinvicta999@yahoo.com.
 
Cheers
;;;;;this phoneis the worst phone ever its slow doesn't have bluetooth or even infrared and won't play mp3's and it's boring ps the case is made of PLASTIC.....;;;;;how do you change phone 2 alphabetical key's , any one got copy off the manual!;;;;;Very plastic.... Very lame....;;;;;hi. i'm thinking on buying this cellphone, but i would like to know first if its outer shell is made of plastic or metal (aluminium or whatever). thanks. ;;;;;the phone is useless  - menue is awfull -  design nice to beautiful the rest horribly worked out  - ;;;;;how do you download ringtones for free without paying a subscription can  you tell me plz ;;;;;I really love this phone but have been trying for the last three months to get a car charger for it. Toshiba didn't make them. Vodafone don't have any now as the phone is "old". One I bought from an independent accessories seller didn't work in spite of being specifically advertised for it. The port looks like a mini USB but it is not standard. Does anyone know where I can get one as I want to use it with a Solar powered charger (which has a Car charger socket attachment) and go "green". ;;;;;well i never knew that toshiba made phones and i work in a mobile phone repair shop;;;;;this phone is a really stylish phone pretty retro looking have had no probs with phone ;;;;;Hi there Can anyone tell me whether you can download ringtones, wallpaper, screensavers etc on to this phone? Thanks!;;;;;firstly my english is not good but i can try.like someone saythis phone is different like the person who want to use it.of cause ihe don't have blutooht and infraport but it's nice for me to use it.thanks;;;;;hello..ive had this phone frm march 2006 and at first i thought it waz relii gd but later after 2 weeks i got reli bored of this phone..if onli it had bluetooth,and memory;;;;;Good basic phone and easy to use. I love the design. Sure is a head turner.;;;;;I've had this phone for a while, and despite being a little bit too basic, with no bluetooth or features like that, i still consider it a decent phone with good, funky looks aswell as a decent camera (shame about no videos)but, if you want to be different from the crowd, then buy this, if only Toshiba added the features. (by the way replaced it with a LG S5200; because it had no bluettoth etc.)

phone_reviews: ;;;;;I have been a vodafone customer for 15 years. I bought this phone for work and it does everything I want it to do. Sim free and cheap phone with lots of functions. Can't complain;;;;;i buy voda smart E8 but it seems its very hard to use specially some of the setting are make my life hard and its delayed slow response. no good;;;;;I bought this phone as a backup or secondary phone but it is taking so long to set up, even as a new phone. Anyone else had this experience?;;;;;For about USD $40 it is a damn good phone. Can even make phone calls!  Awful pics, not even tried vids. Some Apps work but for an Android 7.1 this phone gets "May not work on your device" warnings and some bigger Apps failing to download at all. If you want to take your high end Drone for a fly, forget it but for a quick reply on FB no problems.;;;;;Considering the Qualcomm MSM8909 Snapdragon 210 was only released in 2015 for mid range market it is not 2012 but the basic phone hardware itself has been around the Chinese markets for years. Qualcomm MSM8909 Snapdragon 210 is limited to 720p 8Mp video but this phone barely touches it at 5Mp anyway. Only thing 2017 is the Android version 7.1 Nougat so in a way it is a 2012 phone upgraded for the umpteenth time plus you'll never have to worry about finding a spare battery!;;;;;States 128GB SD card but use a good quality brand UHS-1 U1 or U3 speed class. 64GB UHS -1 U1 should be enough for your phone and a lot cheaper. ;;;;;What is the max. capacity memory SD card this telephone supports? Thanks ;;;;;Are you sure it doesnt have NFC? The manual of Smart E8 says it has NFC. Can you confirm this? ;;;;;This device does not have NFC;;;;;No NFC;;;;;A phone from 2012 released in 2017. Nice.;;;;;These specs are pretty below average, especially for a 2017 phone ;;;;;Indeed you can.;;;;;If you're in the UK then probably, it depends on your current network provider - ask them and check their answer with OFCOM guidance on network switching, the only potential problem would be if your intended new network provider does not operate on the transmission frequencies the E8 does.   ;;;;;Total rubbish. This makes the Smart Turbo 7 look like a masterpiece, and the smart turbo 7 is the bain of my existence.;;;;;Is it possible to port the number from an existing (NOT Vodafone ) phone to the E8.;;;;;Really? Funny, only the phone was only just released in June so how can you have them all returned "in few months" when they've only been on sale for a month? LOL ;;;;;i sell alot of these bunch of crap in my store. and in a few moths there all there again to go to warranty. lool wath a piece of crap;;;;;super fast phone with great features. you should try it. you'll never be disappointed with this. :D;;;;;This is not even a entry level phone lel;;;;;Funny this phone. Wonder if someone buys it :-)

phone_reviews: ;;;;;Hi there did you manage to solve the issues with snap chat?  I just bought that phone I've tried to change the navigation settings but the keys don't work either. So snap chat won't work at all, may take the phone Back;;;;;Don't worry about finger print You can make another one. ;;;;;Great all rounder. Well built, very sturdy. Has finger reader on back but won't read my finger! Very fast responsive screen! ;;;;;Battery is non-removable according to the manual.;;;;;How do you ;;;;;Yeah, you can.;;;;;Yeah, you can.;;;;;You can't send snap chats on this phone ;;;;;I have this device for 3 months and it has proven to be a very decent smart phone. It is comparable to the Nokia 6 in performance with a newer chipset the 435. It is a smooth operating phone if not the fastest but it gets the job done no matter what it is used for. The screen is bright and the colours really pop. The 16MP rear and 8MP front cameras are very good and with plenty of manual controls and other photo options. It is all round a far superior device to last year's Ultra 7. If it were sold under any other brand name apart from Vodafone it would be a far more popular device. It is as good as any other lower end mid range phone on the market right now.;;;;;Smart Ultra 6 was a revelation, produced by the Chinese company ZTE. The Smart Ultra 7 was produced by Alcatel for economy reasons i suppose. Poor product. Smart Ultra 8 (V8) produced once again by ZTE. It seems Vodafone learned its lesson. Ultra 8 - Pros: it's a Best Buy, responsive, 32 Gb ROM, 3Gb RAM, Fingerprint reader that works perfectly, superb design, contrast and color photos better than Ultra 6, photos of the subject in motion without streaks behind it, strong volume and bass much beter than Ultra 6. Cons: The pictures are a bit grainy, like the Sony Z1 that I owned before Ultra 6; In low light grains becomes upsetting; The On / Off button is uninspired placed on the left side. The Ultra 6's was on the right side right under the volume. If you turn it on the landscape mode, chances are very high that you will touch this button with your left hand's  big thumb and close the device while playing a game or taking a picture. After 3 weeks, I'm still not used with it. Personally, I would have liked to have touch buttons outside the screen, underneath it as well as Ultra 6. So, it takes 2 steps: One to activate the virtual buttons bar and the second to push them. Besides that, the active screen gets smaller because of the 3 buttons bottom bar. It would be great if the next generation of Ultra, V9 or so, would have dual cam and IP68/69.;;;;;Have had no issues like that. No issues whatsoever.;;;;;not worth the money Vodafone is worth next to nothing if you sell it second hand;;;;;not very compatible with Snapchat app. Anyone experience any issues? Phone navigation keys block some of the snapchat function keys, especially when trying to send.;;;;;Love this phone but does it have a facility for answer phone? I.e. Can someone leave a message? Bought in Spain as live here but don't speak the language therefore the leaflet useless.;;;;;Its not very clear the Radio information, according to the voda shop and i know you should believe that its cat 6 so this or a p9 lite is their any other cheaper phone that does cat 6 im purchasing this phone when my EE mast goes 4g+ and allows you to use 2 xmitters;;;;;FYI:  Vodafone Ireland very recently pushed an o.t.a. 'force' update that cannot be skipped or avoided in any way. That update kills double-tap to wake. It also causes problems with admin right, e.g. fingerprint unlock clashes with Arrow Launcher's double tab to lock feature. Go figure.  Worst of all: I tried 2 V8 devices, and both suffer from significantly poorer 3G/4G reception. Frequent dropped calls where, in 12 years with Vodafone, I never had a single dropped call. Oh, and bizarrely after the update certain Developers Options are enabled by default such as btsnoop hci logging. ALTHOUGH dev options are NOT visible in settings. Result: random and fairly chunky btsnoop_hci.log files - in one instance a 600MB (!!!) after a transfer of 5 ordinary jpegs. Ouch.  Since Vodafone Ireland probably didn't cook up the update, I wonder if UK handsets will have similar problems. ;;;;;where do I buy this phone? Just looking at my options;;;;;Can it make video call?;;;;;why has the contact and messages aps disappeared from the front screen?;;;;;Bought this and unlocked on eBay, nice big multi color notification LED on it. Very fast and nice alternative to a Nokia 6. Smart V8 has the newer Snapdragon 435 also.;;;;;Pretty solid specs on this phone at the price.;;;;;It means to keep the trees from falling over;;;;;what does root mean???;;;;;Well duhhhh!;;;;;So it has the Apple store ?????? Lol;;;;;I'm sure we can root it soon ;;;;;Got one this morning , used to have an iPhone 6 , had to sell due to circumstances, had a budget smart 7 prime which was a bit rubbish, but so far this phone is awesome , really fast , does every thing the iPhone did just as well if not better , very happy at the second but will have to see in next few weeks if there are any problems but so far really very happy with it ;;;;;I am see stats at gsmarena my friend so i said my opinion.  Thats not clueless but clever. I am able to read :-);;;;;This looks like a very decent upgrade to last year's Smart Ultra 7 which was a very good device. I'm getting this device in a few days and can't wait to test it out.;;;;;Don't know phone, not available in country. How do you know it's definitely a good phone then? Your funny and clueless.;;;;;Would be better if it is using Pure Android Stock UI and a 4000 mAh battery;;;;;For its price its a definitely good phone despite i dont know this brand and its not available in my country.

phone_reviews: ;;;;;The serious design flaw with this handset is that the power button is a third of the way down the right hand side of the phone, about exactly where your right thumb naturally rests when making/ receiving a call. I've lost count the times I've been in mid-call and then accidentally disconnected by inadvertently touching this button. Why not have the end-call button on-screen and the power button out of the way like an iPhone. Other than that I can live with it for the £80 I paid.;;;;;I think Vodafone is the best very easy to access I can just do without it . the management teams should continue with there good work . God bless.;;;;;The second on I've owned.  The first was stolen.  For the price with all the features it unbeatable.  As for it being locked to voda? it's easily unlocked.;;;;;My niece looked into phones for me as I am not very good with new devices. She has chosen very well indeed for me. Thanks Alicia.;;;;;You can't beat it for the price, I have bought 12 of them for our fleet of drivers.;;;;;It's a terrible phone. Terrible. They managed to skip water resistance, and mine has already been water damaged. I'd just buy a Galaxy S5, even if you don't get Android 7.0. Also, this phone is stuck to Vodafone, therefore they put lots of their own bloatware on to the device's 16GB storage. Even then, there is no sign that this phone is getting Android 8.0. Most of the time, the bloatware (especially VF Accessories) takes forever to recompile to work on the latest version. The performance? It's not so good. It has a low-end MediaTek processor, which is fine for games like opsu! (an open-source version of the already open-source osu!) but in Minecraft, the render distance is limited to... 6 chunks. That's not that much.;;;;;Had a galaxy x cover 3 prior. This is better in all aspects except for not being waterproof. 1.5gig of ram was a concern but so far has not been a problem. Camera is better than the xcover in that it is clearer not so blurry. Screen is retina dislay quality and rom at 16gig gives about 10gig free for apps. ;;;;;Have not been able to unlock the phone since I got it. Have been operating on it with wireless network. Now the screen got broken 2days ago and can't get where to fix it please help me out o;;;;;my vodaphone n8 cuts out sound to my callers ,had it sent away 3 times for repair ,alright when it came back then didn't work again after a few days . vodaphone then gave me a new n8 , had it for about 9 days and now this ones done the same thing grrrrr.;;;;;First of all, this is a brilliant phone. It has optimal performance and a good battery. I was playing games for 4 hours and it didn't even break a sweat.;;;;;Ok. I hear you talk about updates. I just wanna know the quality of the pictures.;;;;;Nope, not getting this one. Smart Prime 6 never got an update. Its hardware is only a tiny bit better, but costs more than double. Fingerprint scanner won't save it;;;;;Why people are whining about updates... Based on past experience they will only release 3 security patches, then trash the phone. Smart Prime 6 only got 2 security updates in 2 years. Phone shipped with 5.0.2 in 2015, it's still on that version;;;;;Why are people whining so soon about no updates?  The phone was only released in June 2017.  The N8 I used had an OTA update on 31st of August to 7.0-120FCN1.;;;;;Wouldn't get this even if they gave me money to have it. No support, no updates, no nothing.;;;;;Please not buy. Firmware download=not, tehnical support=not, product is "alcatel"?  Just name alcatel, alcatel romania decline this product. Vodafone ...support have not suuport and have not link to product alcatel. Update...NEVER. please do not buy alcatel, philips, e-boda, allview, prestigio brand. If is vodafone branded, buy zte, qualcomm or other real brand. For example, vodafone smart ultra 6 (zte name is vodafone 995n),  firmware, suport and 4 update from android 5.0.1 to 6.0.1;;;;;nope, not getting that. Not even the fingerprint scanner can lure me to get another Vodafone, I'd rather get the Galaxy J3.;;;;;good to know.;;;;;Oh dear me...part of Smart Ultra 6 touch screen failed after 10 months, preventing part of the keyboard working. Took it to Vodafone for repair, who examined the externals very closely and found NO damage (I always kept in a case covering back and front of phone) before sending for repair. Vodafone now tell me the fix is chargeable (£70+) despite still being well within warranty. This phone is built to a price, as are it's successors (Smart Ultra 7, N8 and on). I wouldn't choose this phone or it's successors if I was buying again...specs good, great when it's working, but simply not robust enough for my real world use. My experience of Vodafone after sales service is worse than disappointing... A 4* phone, with Vodafone after sales customer service feeling more like an abdication than a service;;;;;good to have;;;;;just realized that Vodafone produced smartphone;;;;;better then 10 time moto E4, redmi 4 $70

phone_reviews:
;;;;;I would try and get my mom this. She has a mobicell and it is giving more issues as its a SA own brand.  With Mobiel you cannot update your whatsapp even Would rather go for this .;;;;;I like the phone for the price it works great.I wanted a phone that has fast internet and 4g it works great for me.the camera is poor but it is useable I'd rather have a camera then none at all.if your looking for cheap phone I'd highly reccomend it.;;;;;Bought this phone while I waited for my Samsung to be repaired, Got it for R999-94 (about $71.00) and did not expect fireworks from it as it is a budget phone. I actually liked it, for that little money it is a capable little phone, good screen for price, fast internet and running games like Into the dead and Enemy Strike without a glitch. Battery do take long to charge though. ;;;;;firstly - its a 4 gig storage phone - total storage - and the camera is so poor for a 5 meg camera - I sold my mobicel switch for this , but surely it was na mistake, even tho it had a 512 meg processor;;;;;My god...this phone has THE lowest pixel density (PPI) of ANY Android phone, ever, period!;;;;;Do Not Buy, even if someone gives it to you for free, don't take it. Touch it with wet hands and the touch screen will go crazy for an hour and you won't be able to use the phone. Getting a call while playing music? the phone won't bother to pause the music, so you'll listen to music while on a call. Touch not very responsive.  Camera not that great.;;;;;Lmao seriously don't bother you will regret it but if your up for a challenge format sdcard as internal storage but if you sdcard is slow it will lag like sticky shit on the wall .must use UHS class10 or its gonna hurt. And that sdcard will never be usable in an other device again screw mine up unformatable fully encrypted for that device you have been warned;;;;;I must agree with others what a price of shit iv rooted  this device xposed models don't help greenify bearly makes any difference on battery life keyboard sucks ass it really is dumb slug 7 I wouldn't even want to port another ROM to it as I don't think it would help lmfao $99 I played $98 to much back to my j2 Samsung smart prime 7 could do 1080p fuk sakes lol and that was $100 worth every cent to oh well dig deeper people coz this is an anchor in your pocket;;;;;battery is total rubbish, it charge for long but stays less. then storage is too bad. period ;;;;;This phone is ok. It's not the best phone in the world but there are worse phones out there.Yes, the touchscreen is not total garbage but it is overly sensitive. The internal memory will get filled up VERY quickly. Adding a sim card seems to add nothing to the phone. The only VERY ANNOYING "feature" to the phone is the ridge round the edge of the phone which will chop your ear off if you hold the phone next to your ear! A blue tooth headset is required. Or, better still, a better phone!;;;;;you really get what you pay for with this phone. touch screen is absolute garbage. taking deep breaths when texting seems to help this phone not end up in pieces. buyer beware.;;;;;The phone is great, however after charging to 100% of battery, it can hardly go for 8 hours, is there a problem with may battery. I bought the phone last month.;;;;;how does one turn off this phone, keeps rebooting???????;;;;;Go to where the apps are ;;;;;big chance that this comment will be deleted because it's too ruthless but, I am so sick of Vodafone, not only they lack of unlimited mobile data, it's because they don't know how to make good budget phones. Since 2013, my experience with Vodafone's smart phones is a living hell, and since I got the Smart Turbo 7 or should I say the 'Dumb Slug 7', this phone takes the cake. First off, the keyboard is a living hell. It glitches really bad, even the most precise touch and resetting won't help. My other smartphones may be slow and no longer work, but their keyboards are fine. And there's something I don't get, is that this 5 inch phone only displays 480p resolution. The smart prime 6 can display 720p HD quite nicely. Though this phone has 8GB internal storage, even if I have all my files on my SD card, the internal storage is 90% full and no files are even in there. Google Play always notifies me that I  have no storage left. The camera is bad, period. Processing is awful, Pokemon Go won't open.
 
In conclusion, I have found the bottom of the barrel and I have lost respect to Vodafone and all their phones, I don't trust their quote unquote 'faster' smart N8 and all of their other phones. I'd rather switch to cheap chinese phones or go back to the Samsung C3050.;;;;;How do you Turn off talk back.;;;;;When incoming call it rings but cannot slide left to right as no button to do this;;;;;You can download the user manual here -   As long as your phone browser supports pdf files? If not try Firefox browser;;;;;Sounds like you haven't removed the protective blue plastic sheet from the screen. On  the apps and crashing have you turned everything off you don't want with nothing left running in the back ground? If yes then you need to upgrade to probably a £200 plus phone.;;;;;Try Opera mini browser.It works great.;;;;;I've had this phone since Christmas and it's working great. Good screen, great battery, only disappointment is it lacks NFC... But that's a minor problem for me.  I was worried about it being a Vodafone phone, but it is well made and it didn't need unlocking to work to the cheaper talk mobile network. Great starter or second phone.;;;;;I hate the turbo7 its total rubbish. Motorola kindly gave us the moon tech. In the 60's this thing couldn't even download the clip. Rotten! Huawei p9 you're it!;;;;;Please can someone help me, how can you move your apps to your SD card ;;;;;Like larger screen, good 4 utube, e-reading x;;;;;I'm delighted with this smart phone- my first! Thank you Vodafone for giving it to me for cherry points. I'm gradually getting used to using it and it can do so much;;;;;For 49 GBP you can't go wrong.  Seems quite well made and works perfectly well.;;;;;Pretty rubbish phone, screen is terrible you have to have it directly facing you to see it properly.. Dark parts of images are very hard to see. Scrolling is very slow, the precision of the touch screen is also bad. Its also pretty slow and force closes apps all the time, can't keep apps open without having to restart them and struggles to keep a few web pages open which is annoying.  Definitely avoid and get something else. Cheap for a reason. ;;;;;I have it, three days older in my possession but the big problem i have discovered  is the poor battery. It takes long to charge and it stays for less than 6hrs;;;;;so far am liking this phone.... for it's price it's worth it..  ;;;;;Ican not see how Vodafone can charge £11.00 more than Argos for the Vodafone turbo smart 7 and nothing to show how to used it.;;;;;I know but if your willing get a charger with power IQ it has helped me immensely;;;;;I just buying before 2 weeks,this phone have lot of problem,take long for battery charge, battery backup also low,when I make video call in 5 minute phone is so hot,browsing speed low,not working nicely all apps,app permission apps making tomuch problem.my money is worst with this phone;;;;;Just bought this phone about a month ago already its just presses itself after unlocking it REALLY DISAPPOINTED just waste of money;;;;;I bought the phone 1 week after its release everything about it is perfect except for the battery, the battery don't last longer and it  takes forever to charge it  because it don't have fast charge technology and u must install one to charge it faster. Very bad phone;;;;;Lol why so little people interested in this phone it have decent specs it beats the Samsung galaxy j1 mini LTE via price point and others in the class it got really good chipset Mediatek MT6735M Quad-core 1.0 GHz Cortex-A53 Mali-T720MP2 ;;;;;have you never you never used a phone before? just tap on the messages button, its on the homescreen;;;;;Unrootable with Kingo or Kingroot etc... alot like a Moto, without all the jokerola apps... Snappy to use, but annoying long boot time to say it's stock & I haven't messed with data partition.. I'd rather have alcatel Popstar, which is 1click root..;;;;;I bought this mobil last week - new one ,but it was without any fitting instruction,please let me know how to send text messages from this mobile thank you Jerzy
