phone_reviews:
;;;;;This is a known issue, it seems that this phone has an issue with the motherboard. You'll have to take it to the voda store for repair;;;;;Don't buy this phone. Multiple cases of rebooting loops after 6 months to a year of use. Same happend to me and the smallest dent or scratch will make vodafone say it's out of warranty. And because it's a vodafone only phone no one else can repair it. It would have been an amazing phone. But this issue just renders it as a terrible product that will leave you stranded without a phone and a 2 year contract. ;;;;;I have to say this is the worst phone i have ever had, I really regret getting it. Unfortunately I'm stuck in a 2 year contract with it. Its already been into the repair shop because I couldn't make calls, the photos were terrible quality, I couldn't get on the internet. It would dial other people while I was in the middle of a phone call. All of this by the time it was 6 months old, I was given a new sim card as they couldn't tell me what was actually wrong with it. Now I can be seconds into a phone call and it will just cut me off. Absolute rubbish!!!!;;;;;This is probably vodafones best phone....but theres no updates whatsoever. Yes the update button is there, but its function has the same use as north korea to the rest of the world. Can it be...theres a 73.4mb update...bug fixes...nougat?;;;;;Terrible Phone. steer clear. The back camera lens glass cracked in the first week. And this voided my Vodafone Ireland warranty when the main circuit board failed after 6 months. And Vodafone Ireland and their repair contractors won't confirm the reason for the main board failure so I can't claim on my insurance as they need a reason for the cause of loss. Steer clear of Vodafone Ireland;;;;;For me its an hidden gem. Front facing stereo speakers, QuadHD OLED display, ARM A-72 cores for fast single-thread performance, fingerprint sensor, 32GB ROM and 3GB RAM. One cannot find many devices with these caracteristics. (doubt me? go on phone finder and activate "OLED display, stereo speakers and fingerprint sensor". Spoiler: there's only 15 devices.) The build quality is good, feels like a premium device when holding and using. The OS is clean, almost vannila android. The downsides: not so premium cameras and OS doesn't upgrade. For the price this device is unmatched. BlackBerry DTEK60 is a good alternative, packing the same features but for an higher price.
 
PS: I might be lucky since im not experiencing any battery problems that other people complain.;;;;;Worst phone I've ever had, camera is poor quality, has to be turned on and off to change over from WiFi to mobile data, slightest knock and it cracks. Got this phone based on reviews from tech geek sites on contract 12 months ago and it fell off the sofa onto wooden floor and smashed into a million pieces, so had to go back to old phone. Trust me this phone is nothing like the branded phones.;;;;;Will be updated to Android 7.0?;;;;;A budget phone that looks and feels, and for me,performs like a flagship model. I've read somewhere that it isn't fast enough for intense graphics gaming. I don't play those sort of games, so can't comment. The most graphically intense thing I do on it is watch Netflix and stuff in the BBC iPlayer. It's well up to that task. The sound quality without any external speaker or headset is the best I've heard. Handles online banking, spreadsheets, docs, pics, movies very smoothly. The camera is fine for me, but it might bother some that there is no auto focus. I love it.;;;;;For screen try the alcatel idol 4/4s android and wondows model screen, both the vodafone and alcatel is TLC Brands!;;;;;Try alcatel idol 4/4s android and windows model screen. There is a seller on ebay!;;;;;Smashed the screen and no where can seem to supply screens to fix it... Vodafone want £99. I own it outright so back to my Vodafone smart ultra 6. If anyone knows where I can get an LCD for the vfd900 please let me know!;;;;;Great phone, just the problem with the battery. Had the same problem, constant bootloop unless plugged in. Bought a new one from China and it works now.;;;;;The same happened with me, today i took it to a Vodafone store to replace the battery Hope it works;;;;;Had the same issues (random shutdowns and reboot loops). Everything was solved with a battery replacement under Warranty.;;;;;Hi, Try this:   I was reading about VF phones for the first time & have decided I'd try with one. So I got to VF Smart Platinum 7 and it reminded me of my Note Edge. I had the same problem. It was about the time when the warranty was due to expire. There is one crucial difference, though. The Smart Platinum appears to have a non-removable battery. I have never had such a phone, so this is only a wild guess. See if someone can open it and replace the original battery with a non-VF battery. I have a feeling manufacturers put such commands in batteries to make you purchase a new one. Good luck!;;;;;For no apparent reason my voda smart platinum 7 mobile is resetting when it deems to. I did soft and hard reset but occasionally it still restarts on its own. I have loads of free space and currently using d latest software. The only apps I use are whatapp, chrome and one drive apart from the preinstalled apps. Any suggestions?;;;;;Ok, there was another update 28 MB a few days ago that fixed the heating and battery drain issue. The phone works fine again.;;;;;After this update my phone is getting hot while just browsing or texting on whatsapp or using satnav. Battery life got worse. Bad update, I don't recommend it.;;;;;I got this phone earlier this year 2016 working fine and all ...very slippery though  but few days back it just kept restarting after a long call. I've tried factory resetting and even hard reset but it still keeps restarting. i figured i need to completely flash the phone but i can't find the firmware anywhere online for download could you please upload and and email me the link ... i really don't want to loose my money like this ;;;;;Just install any dialer app you want and disable the Vodafone one. It's as simple as that. I've done it this way and now I use Google dialer.;;;;;My batterylife greatly improved too great phone i used to own s7 edge but this vodafone can compete ;;;;;I have this happening on my Moto G4 Play. I don't think there is a way to remove the orange bars. This happens on Stock Android Marshmallow.  Maybe try installing a custom rom?;;;;;Love this phone but find the design for making calls very confusing. Its a Vodofone phone, so I can't use the Google software to make calls and manage contacts. The installed contacts software is really badly designed. I can't access or edit contact information from the dialer. Is there an app that I can download that'll replace this? Thanks;;;;;Any way to get rid of this horrible orange? I'd like to leave it on battery save mode, but the thing goes bright orange. Never had a phone do this, and its really annoying. So I leave it off, and the battery goes down quickly. Any way to change this? Its a good phone, but this annoys me. Thanks;;;;;"Regulatory & Safety" it was before this update too, but I noticed a very important battery life improvement, very good. The google security patch is from 5 january;;;;;Ok, I have installed the update after all. Not many changes are visible to the user but I have noticed 2 changes straight away. There's a new section in settings menu named "Regulatory & Safety" where you can actually see who made the phone (TCL), a full manufacturer address, CU Reference, Blutooh declaration and a few certification logos. But more important is the second change - camera focus finally has been improved a little bit!;;;;;There's an update available in the UK. 653.7 MB although it's still android 6.0.1. I haven't installed it it. Has anyone tried? ;;;;;Powersave if you don't using heavy games.....but the only way to find out what's best for you is to try all setings...I use performance not for gamea but I like speed ;)....the batery is to good anyway;;;;;what is best for battery? cpu governor interactive or on demand? from stock is interactive;;;;;Don't know about that...I'm a driver and for me is good that increasing volume 'cause if the phone rings louder it scares me :) Anyone noticed in the "developer option" there is an "CPU governor" with 5 different settings??very usefull This phone almost doesn't need root 'cause it has all you need...many tricks and sets....and this days you don't need root for adds blocker;;;;;yes with this app work very good!! thnaks! ringtones volume back to normal!:) just i hope this app to not reduce battery;;;;;There's a free apk in any app store calles "disable increasing ring"...works perfect!you can set the volumes for ringtones;;;;;nice phone guys but plz how to disable increasing ringtone volume? is too low and i cant hear it!:(;;;;;I have mobile upgrade q 5.0.6. installed on my pc...and the last in devices list is VFD 900.look carefuly;;;;;plz can you tell me what software exactly to download from alcatel to to reset platimum7 ?i tried 5.0.6 but i dont find vdf900;;;;;Go to alcatel website...you will find Mobile Upgrade Software.it's a PC software.s earch variant 5.0.6..install it on your PC.open devices list.last is VDF900...select and read carrefully the steps to resoft your phone...cheers;;;;;So I bought this phone....great phone,great price.....after one week I can tell you this: camera is indeed dissapointing...not the camera itself but the software of the camera.After I installed snapcamera apk the results are waaaay better!!!Another good news is that Alcatel offers a software for PC for upgrade/resoft this device..(good to know) Overall the phone is excelemt...jbl speakers very loud&clear but the waves maxxaudio is hidden in sound setings and you have to make a lot of steps to get into it. Display is amazing and it has lots of option. Fingerprint reader...great job! Battery...preety good... Quality of materials...flagship!!! Procesor...more than enough... Compare to OP3...hmmmmm....if you like hard games..take OP3...if You like quality multimedia,browsing or social media platinum7 is better than OP3 This realy is a FLAGSHIPKILLER!;;;;;1500lei;;;;;Thanks...that's good news...'cause I wanted to buy idol4s but is more expensive.but if platinum7 has maxxaudio I will buy this......reversible is a feature from idol series wich allows you tu use the phone in any position...even upside-down;;;;;Yes it has max audio,  not sure what you mean about it been reversable ;;;;;Does this phone have maxxaudio app like alcatel idol 4?and it's reversible?;;;;;There's a reason why the phone starts ringing quietly and you can't change it in settings. It's a security feature because there are front facing speakers, pretty good and loud ones. You can find the same feature in other phones with front facing speakers (for example Motorola).;;;;; Change the length of time before calls go to voicemail Your Vodafone mobile is set to ring for 15 seconds before going to voicemail, but you can change how long it rings for, choosing from 5 to 30 seconds in 5 second intervals. To choose your desired ringing time: ÂEnter **61*121*11* on your Vodafone mobile ÂChoose the number of seconds youÂd like your phone to ring for, followed by #, and then ÂPress ÂcallÂ ÂA message will pop up to confirm the new ring time has been set.;;;;;Provide Your number and i can give you a call for this mobile for rooming ;;;;;thank you for that i will try that. i agree with you it does not ring long anough before it goes to voicemail ;;;;;thank you for that i will try that. i agree with you it does not ring long anough before it goes to voicemail ;;;;;I had the same problem, just posted a way of making them louder.;;;;;For those saying the ringtone is quite low, yes I agree. But after a little perservence I now have the ring tone how I like it. (Nice and loud!!!) First of all, it gets louder the longer you let it ring, but in my case it went to voice mail before it got loud, so I googled how to make voice mail activate later, followed the instructions and set the voice mail to activate after 30 seconds and now the ringtone gets progressively  louder!!! Also downloaded a app called "disable increasing ring" this allows the ringtone to start loud and stay loud. It is free, but only for a trial period, then you have to pay. This was my only gripe about the phone, now I can hear the phone ring I am very happy, but why you can't do this in the phones settings is strange. Brilliant phone, very fast, good screen, and fantastic for vr!;;;;;try going on zedge and downloading ring tones off there i often do this and they are loud enough for me. hope this helps ;;;;;i have buy a vfd 900 but now is bricked on logo, please need firmware;;;;;Ringtones are very very low .Cant really hear it in a pocket;;;;;yes;;;;;could any one tell me please how does the ring tones sound and are they loud inough to here them as i am a bit deaf many thanks;;;;;could any one tell me please how does the ring tones sound and are they loud inough to here them as i am a bit deaf many thanks;;;;;What is the price for it Unlocked in Romania?;;;;;is it worth it ;;;;;Does this phone have a torch light included ?;;;;;Where can i buy it in Tanzania? ;;;;;Find it @ Makro R5999;;;;;Hi there. Where can I buy the Vodafone Smart Platinum 7 Cellphone in Cape Town, South Africa please? THANK YOU.;;;;;Yes it is comparable with a vr headset;;;;;What about FM radio?;;;;;when will it be available in indonesia??;;;;;Ok, I got mine in september, from Vodafone Romania. My contract is 39E/mounth, so they give it to me for free. I got to say, I love this phone. It looks spectacular, with glass back, and metal edges. Though I have a tiny problem, it slide in the hand pretty easy, but this is expected because it made in glass all over. The phone works great, and fast, with his pure Android, the Vodafone intervention is optional. The sound in built in speakers, and headspeakers is amazing, and you can customize it. Camera though, is not at the same level, could been better. Well I am not a phone picture fan, I prefer my DSLR. All in one, is a very good phone, and don't forget is cheap, or even better, is free.;;;;;Is it available here in Philippines?;;;;;Hello Nic you didn't finish your comment which should have ended ... anything ..;;;;;Sorry for my bad English. I bought this phone, last week-end, at Black Friday, from a Vodafone dealer, in Bucharest, for 100 euro. This phone it's really amazing...;;;;;I really don't know all this - you guys are Top;;;;;I don't know;;;;;When its on a table to check time or notifications.... Anyway i have it already and i have to say he is a beast of a phone;;;;;It has got fingerprint reader, why do you want the double tap .. ;;;;;O think it does not wake up with double tap..... ;;;;;Vodafone Smart Platinum 7 is half of price top brands...;;;;;Does this phone have double tap to wake?;;;;;Do you know where I can buy this phone in Australia or I can ship it from the other country? I bought a Samsung s6 currently, it costs a lot for nothing...;;;;;Not for free, but for 50% of the price on a carrier offer while onePlus ain't available for sale in my country and carrier. That's a solid reason 2 get it. Plus the fact that dwice the specs is only the RAM, the rest is sometimes better, but i couldn't really call it twice. And i really don't like devices without a sd-card slot;;;;;Lol, I guess you never heard of the Oneplus 3, it's twice the spec for the same price..... Vodafone for Life lol.... whatever you say.;;;;;But you could buy the OnePlus 3 for the same price... You are crazy to buy this phone unless you are getting it for free on contract or something..;;;;;I got mine a week ago and though I was skeptical beforehand, switching from Sony Xperia Z3, I can assure you, this is a awesome handset. The Smart Platinum 7 is not perfect by all means but watch this space, as I believe the Xperia range entered in similar fashion and were disregarded for so long and look at their progress and achievements thus far. The Platinum 7 features a well balanced package, has an great look and feel to it and being a critic myself, I know that if Vodafone commit themselves to improve on this allready-great-handset , the future for the Smart series looks promising. A step in faith will reward any new Platinum 7 owner with hours of joy.;;;;;Hi, I'm From India can i get this in our Country i like this phone very much now i have decided to buy these handset so i want to know that the handset is avilable or not India and what is the Exact cost to buy..and also ask to who have already use this handset what is the performance to access... Thank You all ..;;;;;So many things wrong in that comment.;;;;;There should be a review for the device;;;;;There should be a review for the device;;;;;I Love This Phone... Its a Beast... Compared To Other Phones In Its Price Class... Vodafone For Life!;;;;;Absolutely amazing phone, speakers are beautiful for a phone, screen is quick and very responsive, excellent ram and m memory and octocore processor, gets a but warm with use liked most do now.  I cannot fault this phone!!;;;;;@Leandro, I had the exact same doubts being a Vodafone Viva client. I chose this one for it's superior AMOLED screen! The P9 Lite will have better support in the future, being a Huawei, and it's cheaper using the Vodafone points. It's also slightly smaller which I also prefer. Again, the only reason I took the Platinum was due to the AMOLED. I had an Ultra 6 and the Platinum is considerably better ;;;;;Thanks Nochnoi. Im thinking about this or P9 Lite. Wich one you recomend?;;;;;what is the lens type of the 16gb camera ? is it sony , if yes wich one ?;;;;;@LeandroPT No lags with the GPS at all. Sometimes it loses signal for a small period. What you fo have to do is Force Stop the app after about 2 hours of intensive use, it seems it fills some buffer or whatever. BTW I'm also in Portugal;;;;;Does anyone here play pokemon go wiht Vodafone Smart Platinum7  Does it run well? Any lags with the GPS? Thank you;;;;;love u ;;;;;Anyone know a place to get an unlock code for this?I have checked ebay but there is nothing. i dont want to wait 30 days for vodafone to unlock it haha;;;;;Great! Thank you for the reply! Think i will go for the SP7 thanks!;;;;;Depends what you're looking for and where you live. You can get Xiaomi Redmi Note 3 with the same specs cheaper than the Vodafone Smart Platinum 7 but if you live in the UK and want to take advantage of 4G network that can be a little problem because Xiaomi phones don't support LTE band 20 (800 Mhz). If you want a good multimedia device with front facing speakers then the Vodafone SP7 is the best value when we consider closest new competitors: Alcatel Idol 4S which is a very similar but more expensive device and ZTE Axon 7 which is more powerful and more expensive as well but hard to get as for now. Also you can get last year's but still overpriced HTC M9. Considering all above I have chosen and ordered Vodafone SP7 today. Currently I'm waiting for the delivery ;) And don't worry about a simlock. Vodafone can unlock it for free if you apply for it on their website.;;;;;Do you think it is worth getting this or is there any other similar phones that are cheaper?;;;;;Alcatel's product has been released and you can buy it same as the vodafone. They are basically the same phone;;;;;The idol 4s does have a fingerprint reader. This phone is virtually the exact same as the idol 4s. They both even come with VR headsets.;;;;;GSMarena when is possibile a rewiev whith this phone? Pls.;;;;;This is Alcatel Idol 4s, same phone, just different name. ;;;;;is there any unlocked version (non-contract) or international edition of this phone? and does it available with dual sim version? but I don't want alcatel version :);;;;;yes  ! like it;;;;;Yes it is;;;;;">;;;;;Please tell me, It's available in Africa? I really like it.;;;;;Its not dual sim ...;;;;;It is better than Idol 4s because it has fingerprint but Idol 4 doesn't.;;;;;It does indeed ship with a vr headset! ;;;;;I am a Vodafone employee who has been extensively playing around and testing the device and I can say it is fantastic, now it isn't as high spec as the Samsung's and the Sony's of the world but it is fantastic for the price point! Very premium feeling too and if her print reader is super quick nearly as fast as the Nexus 6p.;;;;;Great phone, it would have been greatest if it packed snd820 and all its features. Maybe put some more juicy on battery n ram.;;;;;its just a  rebranded alcatel idol 4s (vodafone uses stock android, good)   ;;;;;Are you high on crack? The Idols are already released;;;;;Yes but you cannot buy the Alcatel idol 4s as it is the Vodafone smart platinum 7. That's why alcatels device was never released despite being announced at the start of the year. If you wanted alcatels device you will have to get the Vodafone smart platinum 7. Most of the bloatware can be deleted and the rest can be disabled.;;;;;what countries will it be available?;;;;;This is an astonishing spec for a sub £300 device. According to Vodafone website, it's shipping with a VR headset in the box. Really?;;;;;There is hardly any "bloatware".;;;;;useful;;;;;This is sold as Vodafone Smart Pro 7 where i live.;;;;;The battery wont be good with 3000 mah at 5.5 inch qhd. The processor will not be amazing- soc 652 wont do well with high res. screen. However, apart from that, this will be a good phone. I have vodafone smart ultra 6, its amazing value for money.;;;;;It´s an Alcatel idol 4s, with vodafone logo and full of vodafone bloatware...No thanks....

phone_reviews:
;;;;;Seriously awful phone, multiple issues, loaded with standard social apps; facebook, twitter, instagram, snapchat and WhatsApp, all run slow and stop responding, the device states that it is out of space yet there is no file stored locally according to the phone (other than whatapp which I have to clear constantly) If this was the only issue I could persevere however, since day 1 the bluetooth is severely flawed, I use several bluetooth devices, all of which had no issues with previous phones.  After a couple of disconnects and reconnects it no longer wants to accept using the phone function on several devices until you reboot the phone. The phone function (the primary function) crashes quite frequently sometimes leaving you unable to answer calls, see who has called you, see who you've called and sometimes calls people you have not actually dialled instead of the person you intended. I have tried resetting to no avail!   *** AVOID THIS PHONE AT ALL COSTS - NEVER BUYING A VODAFONE PHONE AGAIN EVER!!! ***;;;;;Coming from a z3 compact I knew this would not be as fast but it has to be one of the worst phones out there. Running apps is great... When they start. For example opening messaging cab take 30 seconds.... Really?  18 months in and the battery doesn't last a day, it can go from 20% to 0 in a blink;;;;;No one would care if you "disapeared" one night so no one actually cares about your opiniin either;;;;;Had mine about three years. Specs match up to LG at a fraction of the price. Camera not brilliant but otherwise a good bit of gear. Apps ll run well, reasonably fast and plenty of storage for what i use it for. Battery life is better than many of it's higher priced competitors. Value for money it is an excellent everyday tool for me, ;;;;;Worst phone I've ever used avoid this like the plague ,not enough space here to explain it all ,now looking for something better!!!.;;;;;camera is very bad. ;;;;;phone died suddenly. has been working fine but has been a let down. will probably go back to Samsung now;;;;;brilliant phone for price ad it above 12 months not ad a single problem;;;;;brilliant phone for the price ive had it for twelve montys and not a single problem ;;;;;The Vodafone Smart Ultra 7 has been a very useful and reliable phone for me. The screen is a bit of a fingerprint magnet, and there aren't too many cases that are made for it, but those are my only real grievances. For the price you get a very usable phone, and it has lots of good features as well, but that will take me too long to go into. For the price range this is one of the better phones in my opinion. Vodafone hit the sweet spot here.;;;;;Just got this phone and have been back to the Vodafone shop. It continuously restarts in the middle of doing things, worst time when answering the phone. All they did was remove some of the apps. Paid Â160 and fuming with Vodafone. Don't buy this phone;;;;;you can replace by yourself LCD befor you order one from aliexpress or send to warrnaty , you will get the price for repair the glass;;;;;Hi I took my vf700 smart phone in to a shop. Due to the glass broken. I've been told I've got to take it back to Vodafone ?  As no one can do it.  Is that right. ;;;;;Rubbish phone , less than 9gb usable out of 16gb, dunno where the rest of the memory is , plus out of the 9.7ish usable space over 3gb is taken up by system sw .  regularly hangs , is unresponsive, loses my details and I have to set up apps from scratch....installed high quality fast extra storage and the phone can't seem to access it efficiently, all apps on the SD card run really slow and hang. DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE !!!!;;;;;Oh dear me...part of Smart Ultra (6) touch screen failed after 10 months, preventing part of the keyboard working. Took it to Vodafone for repair, who examined the externals very closely and found NO damage (I always kept in a case covering back and front of phone) before sending for repair. Vodafone now tell me the fix is chargeable (£70+) despite still being well within warranty. This phone is built to a price, as are it's successors (Smart Ultra 7 and on). I wouldn't choose this phone or it's successors if I was buying again...specs good, great when it's working, but simply not robust enough for my real world use. My experience of Vodafone after sales service is worse than disappointing... A 4* phone, with Vodafone after sales customer service more like an abdication than a service;;;;;This phone was fine for 6 months, now it is a nightmare.  I had to have it repaired by vodafone, leaving me without a phone for a fortnight.  It came back and was great again for about a month, but it has started malfunctioning again.  It overheats, turns itself off and the battery lasts no time.  I have factory reset and this does nothing to stop the continual crashes. Avoid this phone at all costs.;;;;;Exactly the same for me.;;;;;Do us anyone know why my V D F 700 is constantly updating,several times a week? You tube and google update almost daily;;;;;lol;;;;;The phone has a lot of performance issues, very slow if you have added SD card. Absolutely hopeless screen brightness and very poor 4G reception. Very little Android updates and lot of technical snags. ;;;;;For the first month or so, this phone was amazing.....but as time went on, problems began to rear their ugly heads in day to day use. Here are just SOME of the many issues I have discovered:  -The phone doesn't even have Google Now On Tap support, even though the Android version "claims" it's running "6.0 Marshmallow". -The phone dies at 30-50% battery sometimes. -The phone restarts during the middle of tasks, like phone calls or just flicking through your home screen. -The phone's CPU regularly overheats, up to temperatures like 70-80°C. -The phone's touch screen becomes unresponsive at random intervals of use throughout the day.;;;;;best mobile phone in the market;;;;;best mobile ever;;;;;I got one on a Vodacom SA contract. I can honestly say I love my phone; it's fast, the display is beautiful, responds very well to the touch and visibility is good in sunlight, albeit not great. I also haven't encountered an app I can't run, except the Samsung exclusive Resident Evil 4. It charges quite quickly and has decent battery life for the specs. BUT. I'm very gentle with phones, hence my device still looks as pristine as it did when I got it 2 months ago. However, for some bizarre reason the ringer stopped working. I discovered this when I overslept due to my alarm not waking me up! The phone hasn't been dropped or anything more violent than putting it down on a table. If I tap it in the speaker area while playing music it actually makes sounds, so I think it's a loose connection. I just don't like having a brand new phone I have to use headphones on just to hear the sound on a video clip I got over Whatsapp. The biggest issue here is that Vodacom wants to send it away to be repaired, which leaves me stranded without a phone for about 3 weeks. Which is NOT ideal at all. And if I take it to a local repair shop, my CONTRACT phone's warranty is void. So I'm in the middle of a predicament. I guess what I'm trying to say, is that it's a nice phone for the price, but don't expect Samsung or Blackberry build quality, or classic Nokia reliability. It just isn't there. If you need a reliable phone that can take a punishment, rather go with something you can actually research on the Web before buying it. If you need a portable media player and Android gaming device with a full-HD screen and don't care about the actual purpose of a phone (making and receiving calls...), go ahead and get one. One last minus is that due to its relative obscurity, rooting it is a mission. I wanted to try but after some research I decided against it, as I didn't want to void my warranty AND run the risk to brick my phone at the same time. Here is my verdict for the Vodafone/Vodacom Smart Ultra 7: 
Display: 8/10 
Build Quality: 5/10 
Sound: 6/10 (if it works) 
Performance: 8/10
;;;;;Absolutely hopeless phone ever, cheap & horrible. Worse than my computer, freezes, pin number to get in doesn't always work, gets stuck on something, send people messages & I can't see what I've sent, & vice versa;;;;;Buy a new phone, preferably that is not on the ultra cheap side...;;;;;Its been almost 6 months since I am using smart ultra 7. Very good phone for the price. I mainly use it for browsing internet, social media and reading emails. So far no problems. Sound is not that great but using headphones solves the problem. I have added SD card for the extra memory.        ;;;;;This phone is extremely slow with some apps not functioning at all and others running agonisingly slow. Sometimes device restarts in the middle of your doing a task. Was decent for the first month. Not sure if there is something wrong with it or if I did something to it.;;;;;5 GHz Wi-Fi is not visible in Wi-Fi search mode. any solutions..?;;;;;Having wasted almost two years struggling with Vodaphones Nokia Lumix 635 I am VERY impressed with my brand new Smart Ultra 7.With a 25% rebate it is actualy as cheap as my Nokia.;;;;;This phone is laggy and generally slow.  Can stall for 5 seconds taking photos before it finally 'fires'.  Struggles to run apps like the weather without taking 5-10 seconds to load.;;;;;Can anyone help please! How do I edit my photos to change the file name. Thanks;;;;;Is a excellent mobile;;;;;Its a good phone.;;;;;General Question I have a Vodafone phone but I need to find the model. can you help please   ;;;;;Am about tobuy this phone, somebody give me a reason not to or why i should?;;;;;Good phone... bad camera(s)... All round a nice device, but the poor cameras are very disappointing!!! Also, a bit fragile as for damage in the screen or on the "metalic" besel. If that besel was really metalic, a real scratch resistant screen and "normal" cameras... a awesome option! But it isn´t so... only a economic option.;;;;; ;;;;;Good luck broke mines screen and nzs biggest tech repair agent cannot find a place to buy the screen for it ... Its like the part does not exist I would not buy another one of these they are a good phone but 400 and if you break it its a write off so go with a name brand you can get repaired ;;;;;Why woukd you drop the phone. its obvious that its going to endure some damage.  My friend had a iPhone and her boy friend sat on it because it was in his back pocket, the screen is cracked an it looks horrible.  Now she needs wait for up grade. Sucks, but what can you do;;;;;check that time and date are correct;;;;;I just got the smart ultra 7 on wed 22nd, but I am having great problems trying to set things up on it, I also cant get into the internet at all it keeps coming up that its authentication problems, can anyone help me? This was a gift from my husband and I feel ungrateful as I keep moaning about this stupid phone. I am 58yrs and had a wee phone, I love the look off this ultra 7 but its doing my head in. Any help will be appreciated ;;;;;I have a quick question: how do you increase the in call volume? I can't gewr anyone on my calls!;;;;;Any one no how to change the colour on photos ;;;;;One of the best midrange phones.;;;;;lol;;;;;It's a question ... how on earth do you answer the phone???;;;;;Had the same problem.  Had to move everything off the SD card, reformat and them put the data back on.  The phone is OK except for the FM radio - its a piece of crap;;;;;No read counter of Wazzap messages . Any Help ?;;;;;What's your thoughts on it so far?;;;;;Vodafone Smart Ultra 7 = Alcatel Pop 4S =  Alcatel Flash Plus 2 = TCL 562 = TCL 550 It's the same design and the same hardwares more or less.;;;;;It's a value for money phone. Strong enough for everyday use and of course the battery keeps all day with an average use. 6.0 thats why!;;;;;Sorry that's £89.00 and currently out of stock.;;;;;Vodafone still selling the Ultra 6 for £89.99 on their website;;;;;Same problem.flash and shutter out of sync . This phone is terrible . Very slow. Ultra 6 is do much better. ;;;;;Hi. My SD card is not mounting to my phone it says its corrupted. It does give me an option to fix but it fails to do so. Anyone know how to fix. Worked perfectly fine in my phone b4 this model. Thanks;;;;;I have just bought one;;;;;I've had no problems with this so why the hell would you drop it and some of the people on here don't know how to handle a phone or you wouldn't drop it wtf...;;;;;Wtf would you drop it !!!!;;;;;maybe its because you don't know how t handle a phone properly;;;;;What is up with the flash on this thing? The flash goes off and then a split second later the shutter snaps, giving you a great picture of black, or if you're lucky, a lovely dimly lit blur. Totally useless and absolutely pathetic.  ;;;;;Easily the worst camera in low light that I have ever seen on a phone in the last 5 years. The ultra 6 by comparison is in a different league.;;;;;I agree with every word,I am a novice smart phone user, I have had many problems with both the phone and Vodafone. If you go to Coolangatta Assie, they employ sales girls that are dumber than myself,they cannot help you. Roaming charges there are horrific, get a different option.;;;;;I am disappointed with it after a few days using it. The most disturbing is that the zoon is not progressive, it just goes near or far "by parts". The speaker on the botton sounds bad and the material is very delicate. I didn´t expect so much about it, but I think it doesn´t worth to buy it, at least in Spain for 200 euros you have similar smartphones with better performance.;;;;;You get what you pay for. A substandard camera and the laggy touchscreen let it down. Multiple touches on the recent or back key are required at times to get it to respond, which just screams Cheap! The camera simply doesn't live up to the specs. ;;;;;If you drop it on the floor that's your fault not the phone or Vodafone.....;;;;;very good phone for the price . if you want to secure it buy a case from Vodaphone website  i have and it fit well.;;;;;i bought this and it's HORRIBLE!! Phone broke as soon as it landed on the floor;;;;;There is no smartphone on the market that has the full specified storage space available. System software and apps take up a portion of that total storage space.;;;;;I have this phone - Its great but the memory is 10gb according to my computer and not the 16 advertised;;;;;This is made by Alcatel according to Vodafone Ro site.;;;;;This is made by Alcatel according to Vodafone Ro site.;;;;;I wanna buy this one, but is it possible to ship to Viet Nam?;;;;;Hey, i might gonna buy this phone tommorow, this realy lagg´s? I would be thankfull for a honest and decent answer. Because i´m really struggling about a decision to make. ;;;;;Hello Ian, What was the bluetooth Problem?  Is there a solution?  My son has just got an ultra 6, which he loves but it will not pair with his Sony bluetooth speaker Pat.;;;;;To screenshot, u press power and volume down together, simples :-);;;;;This phone works like a charm, it has snappy performance and antutu gives a score of 47000+, but I've found a problem with the SD card, when it's inserted and formatted to be used as internal storage almost all apps that require GPU won't work until the phone is restarted but if the SD card is formatted as portable storage the problem disappears. I hope Vodafone fixes this problem soon.;;;;;update: it was a bug when you format the sd card to be used as internal storage.;;;;;I get above 44,000 in Antutu;;;;;Can't play any game and even antutu gives an error when starting the benchmark;;;;;can anyone tell me how i can get texts to appear in the lockscreen? I've turned on notifications and when I receive a message, I still have to unlock and then slide the screen down to see the message. (also side note, any ideas how to screen shot?) Overall, phone is quite good and camera is excellent;;;;;Upgraded to Ultra 7 as it is supposed have a tougher screen than the 6. Very pleased with it so far. I used to have a Bluetooth problem with the 6 but this seems to have been disappeared on the 7. Phone looks and feels better quality than the previous model.;;;;;It's OK, using one to write review. It wouldn't read files off memory card used in Galaxy...odd...had to format card. It gives option for default storage but makes no difference. During FB messenger call if you press home button turns camera off...most continue working. Supplied earphones are better than Samsung, and audio improved a lot since ultra 6. So a mixed bag. If it were £99 be worth it..well in UK. Overpriced, and no FP scanner.;;;;;Looks really similar to Alcatel Pop 4S;;;;;I had assumed on the FP scanner to be honest however it does accept a higher SD card - 256gb over 64gb of the Ultra 6;;;;;Hi, you should try an ultra 6 or better, they're pretty nice for less than 200Â. Had one and no lag with normal usage and gamming ;);;;;;actually no FP scanner and not a bigger sd card capacity;;;;;Really doesn't seem like much of an update over the Ultra 6 from last year.  Smaller battery - just, slightly smaller body, FP scanner, similar chipset with equal GPU (405 has better peak while the T860MP2 has better consistency) and 2gb RAM, it can hold a larger Micro SD card and a newer Android (the Ultra 6 can get Marshmallow but might not get N) that's about all the differences. I was impressed by the Ultra 6, this is just a bit...meh.;;;;;Its the same as the ultra6 in atleast 90% of the features . atleast a bigger battery and better ram wouldve made me wanna buy this. ;;;;;Personally preferred the Smart Ultra 6 with the SD615,I'm sure it performs better aswell besides the heating issues which I never had anyway;;;;;They do lag;;;;;I like vodafone phones they use stock android which is lag free plus mediatek 64bit non heating processors which are efficient

phone_reviews: ;;;;;The device itself was okay. The camera wasn't to bad, was snappy using the Internet, browsing, YouTube, Facebook. It handles games like Temple run 2 fine. You won't get much from the GPU. But, it took a small fall off the coffee table to ruin the screen. The LCD was fine and the phone was usable. Soon though it froze, I rebooted it and never came on again. I sent it in, repairing it would've cost prety much the same as the phone. So the built quality was poor. Hauwei should be making Vodafone again on the side. Not Alcatel. Specs wise it was great for the price. But the device would need a super tough cover. It doesn't take much to damage it. Rather pay a little more for the hauwei Y5 2017. Or the better built but weaker Nokia 3 if you are on a budget. Super cheap entry level phones aren't worth it. Around the Samsung J3 prime,hauwei Y5 2017,Nokia 3 price range is as low as you can go. ;;;;;I have been using this device for nearly a year and the screen shows 2 burned areas, the camera is very faulty (i believe is the software) giving me black squares and missing colors on multiple pixel (front camera a total joke unless you are in a very good lighting condition). it has a way of overheating by doing simple task like browsing through web (sometimes even when watching locally stored media). Even though its an android the user interface is complicated and unbearable. My device came with 2 apps for calls and 2 for messages, and i needed to disable 2 otherwise i wold get every notification in double. Storage is so low that i am afraid i might run out of data even from updates. Its a pretty bad device and all i loaded to it is: whatsapp, viber and samsung health ;;;;;Rubbish this device runs slow 8gb of storage what a joke! even for basic use it's no good;;;;;Been using this phone for 3 months, got some few tweaks enabled am a baby user, but still functions great, the battery omg...two days is rare but not when using this device;;;;;this phone beats most phones and if u dont believe me, get your bitch ass here and i will show you it is worth the money cause it is;;;;;this phone is dope if you just figure out the hidden stuff on it. it is the reason why vodacom exists. its better than the j1. go search online and you will see. pieces of shit;;;;;What's wrong with it? ;;;;;Don't even. After less than 5 months having bought it, I regret it, hopefully you didn't buy it;;;;;This phone ils rubbish.  Vodafone should remove it from their stores.;;;;;It has only 4 GB internal memory !;;;;;Hi guys.  Does this phone have MirrorLink?;;;;;Seems impossible to create group message. Any ideas?;;;;;hey guys  so i recently lost my samsung phone  and i think i should go for this phone. i like it for the fact that it looks like an i phone 7 .. but looks can be deceiving so should i buy the phone or not ? ;;;;;I've just bought this phone after my Samung S4 decided to cook itself to death. As there was no music player i loaded the app VLC.   It scanned for my music on the SD card which  contained my music files.   No problem in playing music or videos.  Also the app contains a equaliser which improves sound quality when a suitable type is selected.;;;;;Biggest load of rubbbish I have ever held in my hands. I demanded my money back after 2 weeks. It is so slow that it sometimes cant even answer calls! It cant save numbers for whatsapp, it hangs all the time, always runs out of space. It is simply unusable. Dont waste your time and money. If I could give it negative stars I would.;;;;;barely had this phone for a year and its freezing doesn't let me go on any of the apps should of expected this from a cheap phone. I liked it at first but now its just, basically unusable. Thought it was the best £75 I've ever spent but I was wrong it was the worst ;;;;;Bought this phone 2 days ago after finally letting go of my Samsung S4. I would definitely recommend you check this phone out! Vodafone have some really nice handsets for a fraction of the price of bigger name brands like Apple and Samsung. The display is fantastic, unlike my s4 it does not heat up. Apps run smoothly even with Nova launcher, snapchat, drive, whatsapp, pixlr express, face book, twitter and the list goes on. I like the thickness of the device and it has a premium feel in the hand. Camera is fair but good with HDR enabled. The Smart Platinum is also a strong contender but quite a bit more expensive. Very impressed with the phone for the price and it has LTE. ;;;;;When I get an incoming phone call the screen goes black and I have no way of taking the call. Otherwise the phone seems to do everything including messages send and receive ok. Help!;;;;;I bought this phone is just awesome and nice pics and the memory card can be used as internal storage and I like thickness of it is just amazing and the price is reasonable;;;;;I just bought this phpnr, def satisfied with it. Does not feel slow at all, though you may experience latency depending on the apps you use. The screen is also really nice. Excellent value, do recommend.;;;;;Very good phone. Great screen area and very thin. Would def recommend. I haven't had any problems with it at all except the fact that it doesn't have emojis/ emoticons. Otherwise great great phone. Had iPhone 4s previously and switched to smart prime 7- very glad I did its soooo much better. I dont understand why people don't like it? :);;;;;I have learned to keep away from all phones being sold by Telecom providers. They put so much crapware on the phones plus limit its usage with their locking restrictions, that it is very hard to truly enjoy the phone. I low end smartphone offers better usability than these locked, restricted phones.;;;;;very slow phone!! bought it a few days ago and straight away noticed it taken a while to open apps etc like google maps takes about 10 seconds, and havent found a browser yet that works very well on this phone, I owned the prime 6 which was a lot better than this, I just hope they sort it with a update which there is but but this phone wont install it for some reason, if you buy one get the white as black one looks cheap;;;;;Looks decent cheap but slow, freezes constantly,  network error with wifi and there's no issue with my wifi. It may be a budget phone but honestly don't buy it it's not worth the stress mine just sits in the draw only used for a week.;;;;;The worst phone i ve  ever used. IT s really really slow and IT has ping to almost every  action  that You want  to take. When someone calls  it  takes almost 5 seconds  after the ringing for the screen to reveal the name of the caller. Also...when i put it  into the pocket it  takes  photos by itself. Because the keys on the right (volume and power) are built there very badly. Beside that..it  freezes like a lot..very often. And can t do anything about it...can t restart. Can t turn off...the battery is non removable so i  can t get it  out. IT happens to stay  like this as long as it wants...because can t do anything until IT recoveres. And this may take up to 15-20 minutes. For this entire time i may have an emergency and the phone CANNOT BE USED. It  s the worst achievement i Be ever made. Doesn t even Worth those 35-40 usd. Do not buy it...make something better with your money;;;;;nah i dont think so;;;;;I have this phone it takes good picture during the day but the front camera it's not good....... my question is , is it going to receive Android 7.0?;;;;;  2.5D Dragontrail glass;;;;;Hi guys I got the smart prime 7 and it won't let me play my music nor open the files I have downloaded its says it had a music player and it doesn't please help as I carnt find my recept;;;;;ya i have to  ,,,,i also got this this problem in use  mobile;;;;;I bought Vodafone smart prime 7.its a very special fon. But I have found that the handset gets hot,is it the way its suppose to be.it makes me uncomfortable.;;;;;smart prime 7 its very good phone since i save my imformation from huawei p9lite , when i got it just retrieve in a wink off and eye got everything back nice one,,,,i love it...;;;;;What is this phone like for snapchat? Is it good for those kinda selfies where a front flash is needed or is the front screen flash on the Prime 7 useless?;;;;;Bought last week and am amazed with the Performance for £75 good looking ( White)looks Good. Voda have well thought out this Mobile.A Brilliant buy on a Budget Phone. Will sell in white and Gold. To be Honest at its Price you can't Knock it. Will move to the Ultra At Christmas but Great Value For Money. Give it 9 out off 10 for looks and same for performance ( x Mobile Shop Guru)  ;;;;;Vodacom is doing great I lv it more Dan de words can I express;;;;;I just got this phone and its pretty good. No problems what so ever. I just think it needs a better cooling system but apart from that its a great phone;;;;;just keep waiting for 6.0 (good phone good batery and fits well in the pocket)   :);;;;;The clock speed on this processor is actually 1.3 ghz, this means that it's a SD 212 processor and not an SD 210..;;;;;This phone is fine.  It uses marshmallow SD cards properly, so if you put 128GB SD in it you have 128gb system memory.  So don't worry about the 8GB onboard memory.  It has NFC, Strong Bluetooth and wifi radios, full 4G.  It won't play the latest games, but surely you all own tablets for gaming.  This phone is great, the only limitation is the 1gb RAM, but as long as you remember to close background apps this is not a problem. I use the gps while driving and I listen to google play music at the same time.  It receives all Fb, whatsapp and line messages whilst I'm driving and doesn't miss a beat.  Sometimes even a top flight phone will splutter the music with that lot going on.   I'll say it again.  This is one of the very few handsets available that actually utilises all of Marshmallows feature set.  So, Android Pay works, SD card formatted to system memory works, it's good.;;;;;do not buy!!! buy vodafone smart ultra 6. amazing value 4 money!;;;;;This is a crap piece plastic. Snapdragon 210? WHAT? prime 6 had soc 410!!! This phone is a mistake. I am using smart ultra 6. It is awesome. Best specced vodafone. Seriously guys, you would have to be dumb to buy this. ;;;;;Hello guys, atm I have a Alcatel C7 Pop and I do intend to swap it, but I am a cheap bastard, so I was woundering if this was a upgrade since im only paying 80 euros for it and I dont really understand a shit about celphones;;;;;who manufacturers this phone? what comes in the box? how is the build quality?;;;;;this smart prime 7 is a downgrade from prime 6. for exmaple CPU is more slower then last year model;;;;;Great value for money, I was using the VF Smart Prime 6 device before and I'm really happy with my new VF Smart Prime 7. ;;;;;Lol Vodafone isn't able to build good looking smartphones with good value. They should rather invest their money into 5G and the web of kabeldeutschland;;;;;SOC and Video Res specs are incorrect. It actually uses the 1.3Ghz SD212 (identical to the SD210 but 200mhz faster). Video recording is limited to 720p, not 1080p as the SD212 can not handle higher than 720p.;;;;;You would pretty silly to upgrade your prime 6 for this. Comedians.....;;;;;25 Â euro phone;;;;;Yep, Vodafone have made a mistake. The obvious downgrade in chipset (SD410 down to SD210) is the biggest hit but they have also made it bigger but kept the screen the same. So it's now slower and less ergonomical. But it's ok because they've given us, wait for it...40mah of extra battery! I don't think that's an argument it can win. 'Yes, we have given you a slower chipset, so much so that anything above Temple Run 2 will lag, but we've given you more battery. Unfortunately due to the outdated technology of the A7 cores there's no real efficiency bonuses so the 40mah extra will - perhaps - add another 5 minutes. On standby.' I do hope they get it right and upgrade the Ultra. I liked that phone and got very close to buying one.;;;;;What an opportunity to improve on the 6, but Vodafone are giving us a lesser chip? Vodafone, tell us this is a mistake and they come with the Ultra's MSM8939. Or at least the 410 same as the 6. Not less???!!!;;;;;Lmfao , the smart prime 6 had a sd 410 while this has 210 , is this a joke ?;;;;;Really Vodaphone? Crappy smartphone

phone_reviews: ;;;;;Hello All, My dad got me this for a first phone but it was completely trash because i changed the password and it didnt let me do anything. To me this is a small phone that cant do anything as it i sonly 3G so it cant connect to many internet sources so i couldnt use whatsapp and frequently didnt pick up calls or messages until after a week. I do not reccommend this to anyone looking for a smartphone;;;;;I bought this phone as a cheap fitness tracker. Perfect. Installed Whatsapp and Facebook Lite. Perfect. A few small games, books, radio and news apps. Again perfect. It was so good I bought for my sons to play games on. Like minecraft. Best of all is, nobody gets hurt if they break as they are so cheap.;;;;;Its utter garbage;;;;;Android 5.1?! The Samsung Galaxy S4 goes up to Android 5.0.1 WITHOUT installing a custom ROM!;;;;;In my opinion the vodafone smart first 7 is an annoying little phone which intermittently deletes my contacts, opens apps which I have not requested and has a very unresponsive screen. Also continues to claim that the internal memory is full despite me adding a 6gig memory card. The one plus for the vsf7 is that for such a small phone it plays movies very well with good resolution and sound. If I could give one piece of advice, maybe check out models in a higher price range as the old adage goes, you get what you pay for.;;;;;good day pls my voda phone just show sim permanently locked don't know wat to do;;;;;Google found the manual. Here you go ;;;;;i got a new vodafone smart 7 but i cant fine users guide or manual    as  i dont know hoe it is working,pl.help me to  this manual;;;;;Oh well that's rubbish;;;;;This is a great phone for the price i bought a brand new one for 15 quid and i was surprised with how good it is... It can be a bit slow and the camera is hopeless but if you want a phone for texting calling and srolling social media its Perfect;;;;;I totally agree this phone. ;;;;;Hi,           I can't transfer data from internal memory to sd card...  Therefore I can't Di important updates....  Thank you... ;;;;;Yup, it's a downgrade if you previously had a Smart First 6.;;;;;No, you cannot rotate the screen - this phone does not have an accelerometer. This also means: 	Maps will not show direction phone is being held in 	Apps that involve tilting the phone will not work 	Compass apps do not work;;;;;Can it rotate tha screen;;;;;cool phone gettin one from asda 17 pounds cheap-ass phone mice monies;;;;;Got to the photo you want to delete at the top it will have the sign to share then next to it is the Bluetooth sign & finally 3 dot's on top of each other click on that & the delete option will come up ;;;;;previous version. I thought this w ahahahah i love android 5.0?;;;;;it's hsdpa only.;;;;;i cannot connect to the internet, please assist;;;;;this is the worst phone I have ever owned. it can't connect to the internet and it is missing all the features of the previous version. I thought this was just an upgrade to the older (much better) model I managed to break, but it isn't. ;;;;;having trouble on how to delete photos help;;;;;no it doesnt\;;;;;Hi, i just get this phone and no, there is no front camera.;;;;;Hi can anyone give any info on this mobile, does it have a front camera as well as the back one. Its for my daughter and she won't have it if it hasn't. Thank you;;;;;Can you use strava on it ???;;;;;i have just bought vodafone smart first 7 everything except messaging is fine , i can receive texts but the phone will not allow me to text out please help i am at my wits end;;;;;Network unlock codes available on ebay for around £1. Search for: "Vodafone Smart First 7 unlock" or something like that.;;;;;Yes, WhatsApp works fine - it's an Android phone.;;;;;yes;;;;;WHO CAN tell me whats original firmware is used by vodafone smart first 7  or how can i unlock for read any SIM CARD?;;;;;can i download apps such as whatts app to this phone;;;;;some youtube videos have playback anomalies;;;;;how do i get the mms to work on this device ;;;;;wow, iPhone 4s speed for 30Â, very good.;;;;;if it has at least 4g, it could be my hotspot/secondary/emergency backup phone;;;;;Lol;;;;;WOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOW Maybe a phone for 1 euro / 1 Pound or maybe 1 Japanese yen :-)

phone_reviews:
;;;;;Please I bought my Vodafone vf 795 around June las year. My battery is 1780 mAh  and my internal storage is about 4GB. I wish to find out if I can get a battery with a higher mAh than this;;;;;those phone are manufactured by ALCATEL;;;;;Copy of some sort of Alcatel phone;;;;;just press power button and volume down at same time.;;;;;please help, how do I take a screen shot with this phone. messages, whatsapp, screen shots?;;;;;The phone (new) cannot work on ugandan networks and demands for some codes to open;;;;;Why u lying?;;;;;The battery is removable. Not like it says above.;;;;;Is it open to 2degrees network;;;;;Piece of crap. Never buying another Vodafone marketed phone ever again. For  $89 you get a phone with a severely underpowered processor and glitchy display that randomly restarts itself whenever it feels like it. Battery life is decent but that's about the only upside to the device. Went back to using my Samsung J1, as Samsung knows how to make a reliable device at least ;;;;;My wife and I bought a phone each about 5 months ago. Both phones have increasingly performed badly vis a vis battery losing its charge overnight while on idle. The phone has been sent back to Vodafone on several occasions and no improvements have been made. I guess if you go cheap, you get cheap.;;;;;If it can play Pokemon go fully,could you do gym battles without it crashing? I'm being certain,sorry ;;;;;Yes you can but witgouth the RA mode;;;;;can you play pokemon go with it;;;;;I had my smart speed 6 for about 3-4 months until this thing came up and i pressed 'ok'  by accident the last thing i saw was power off or shut down after a couple of secounds my phone turned of itself. help me.;;;;;how to answer call, sometimes answer icon appears at top. normally a spinning circle appears,.....?????;;;;;Recently purchased this unit and what i can say  is stock android is smooth no lag and the mediatek 64bit processor is non heating its effecient on 1Gigbite ram  average of 200mb ram free even on heavy usage and battery lasts overall great device, thumbs up;;;;;Yes this phone is only a Ghz but it does have the newer  64bit cpu rather than 32 so has double the processing power and with 4 cores that's pretty good. What lets most phones down is the software and the camera is terrible being fixed focus rather than auto focus ;;;;;The battery is removable, as the sim and SD cards are underneath the battery.;;;;;click and hold the google bar until the delete icon shows up at the top of the screen;;;;;how do you get rid ov the google task bar from the home screen plz can ANYBODY help me Cheers Pops ;;;;;vf 795;;;;;Scree is not IPS. It is a ver bad TN screen, with a very slow response time.;;;;;i just love the device especially for that price  ;;;;;i just love the device especially for that price  ;;;;;Seriously.... You have to be working for Samsung.;;;;;best example for "you pay less, you get less" sub-mediocre screen, mediocre perfomance, medium battery life. unusable camera - not only without autofocus, but with very bad artefacts and weird color reproduction. not even remotely reccomended...;;;;;It's pretty descent device for this price. ;;;;;To open the back to insert SIM, battery and optional microSD: start at the lower left corner (facing screen). There is a small notch, pry open the thin, plastic back. To replace: just snap it back on, you hear it click in place. Note: this phone is mechanically similar to Alcatel Pixi 3 (4.5) for case and screen cover, battery?;;;;;Vodafone V-795, Smart speed 6. For US$40 (NZ$60) as purchased at HarveyNorman NZ, including NZ$29 Vodafone SIM it is a great, cheap phone. You get 1GB/8GB, quad core SoC, Android 5.1, LTE (4G), GPS, 4.5" screen, removable battery, micro-SD slot(up to 64GB works for me). The camera is less than stellare, but adequate for snaps and WhatsApp. I keep it in the car: great for Navigation, GPS is good, even has a compass. Usable in emergency even without SIM. 4.5" is a good size; any smaller is hard to read, any larger its hard to carry. (I have owned all sizes). Good first phone, spare phone, and for Android beginners. Not a trophy phone but great functional value.;;;;;How do you open a new phone to insert battery and sim card;;;;;The battery is removable,  you have to put it on first  ;;;;;can you give me the model number of this phone cuz i need model number please;;;;;It does have a removable battery as I have just put mine in upon purchase today!!;;;;;Please amplify re the 5MP camera. You say it's not!;;;;;I think it's a great option,considering the low cost.I have not faced any kind of issues(hardware/software) so far,and i have to admit,it carries a very powerful wifi card! The only negative is the rear camera which is considered 5.0 MP,but its not over 3MP... And of course,there's no available root technic...;;;;;Can anyone help me my LTE service isn't activated please help;;;;;have had to reset twice in first 24 hour of owning, its not looking good! and not charging very well either ;;;;;this phone needs a serious update, message vibrate doesnt work and google search bar keeps disapearing and option to change wallpaper when u hold on home screen is not there any more apart from that its ok for £40;;;;;vodafone is taking care of this phone just received an update many manufacturers couldnt even be bothered with that;;;;;Don`t opt for Android at Vodafone. Wait for IOS in Vodafone. LOLZ....;;;;;After coming from flagship phones its no shock my review wont be the fairest. Its solid made but still feels less than budget in the hand, although it almost stock android its jam packed full of vodaphone bloatware that is not needed and hinders the all ready over driven CPU and the small amount of ram,  After a good clean out of all the vodaphone apps i found it to be a little faster and the UI is smooth untill you start running background multitasks,  WHY vodaphone have made the text app all about them is horrific and its better to root your texts via the google hangouts app to avoid the pointless ram eating and very anoying pop ups. The camera is shocking to say the least but will take a picture good enough to be viewed on the handset or of a meal to make your mum cry that your mates mum cooks better grub. The screen is enough for doing normal tasks but you can see the lower spec when trying to read text and view pictures, internet browsing is not very good and you feel how slow CPU is working when loading pages and if you receive any calls or messages the phone clearly cant cope and becomes slow and glitchy In reflaction they could of done a little more at this price but for a very low end phone it does the job, calls are clear and signal is great! simple games work fine and its good to check social media, its very good as a first phone,a back up,going out in the mud or for kids as its built like a tank and can take a few knocks and at the price and be easy to replace if lost or broken,
 
if this is your only option at this price then grab a bargin but if you want a grown ups phone or something for the advanced android lover then hold on to your cash and save up for something far better
;;;;;i loove this phone it is way beyyer than all the other phones ive had and the camera is soo clear and very good just dont know what music apps are recommended for this phone ;;;;;...Released 2015, October !!!;;;;;It`s actually a pretty good phone, considering the specs it has. I bought it an year ago and it worked just fine;;;;;can't download my music from the computer without an account as with other phones, if so I would like to know if such an app is available? ;;;;;Its a basic phone.  What do u expect.  You will need the ultra 6 if you want higher end specs;;;;;So Vodafone smart "speed" 6. Yeah..... speed, with a 1.0 ghz quad-core Mediatek cpu and 1 Gb of ram. On the other hand the cpu and gpu don't have much work to do because it has a stupid 4.5" 480x854 pixels screen.;;;;;pathetic 5mp camera, 1gb ram and 720p video when calendar shows 2015!!!

phone_reviews:
;;;;;Wow my Vodafone smart ultra 6 the camera is 4k and 4k will play and the phone is very fast. Best phone ever.;;;;;When I am using WiFi and when charging my phone is over heating. So please give me some suggestion;;;;;It is in deed wonderful to have this phone. It's awesome. Regards;;;;;I've had this phone for 17 months and overall it's a great phone for the price, but the screen looks to be failing slightly - the letter Y hardly works any more and battery doesn't last as long as it used to (used to get 1 1/2 of moderate use now I only get 7 or 8 hours).;;;;;It is a very good phone,It has almost 3 years and it runs like new:It is easy to find a lot of cutom roms or custom recovery for this phone,all these are easy to install compared to other phones.Now I have Android 7.1.2 boosted by grenify and installed by TWRP and has dolby support.;;;;;First phone a dud. Replaced by Vodafone three years ago and use it as a mini computer very day. Excellent photo resolution, but need to update to ensure I can keep guaranteed phone/ email/ social media contact. Which phone to buy ?;;;;;Please, how much shall it cost me to get replacement for Vodafone Smart Ultra 6 LTE VF995N VF995. Touch Screen Digitizer(NO LCD).;;;;; worst mobile phone I ever got. is super slow, is always jamming, opens folders alone. will find me crazy;;;;;im having a problem with my Vodafone Smart ultra 6  sometimes the screen vibrates forcing some key pad fail to operate secondly its touch jams forcing me to reboot it;;;;;hi, dont think they sell this anymore. i know they dont in the uk where im from ;;;;;is this phone available in Phil.???;;;;;I've had this phone for about a year and it's great. Love it, no complaints. I will seriously consider another Vodafone when I upgrade in a year or so.;;;;;On my SU6's second birthday, a big crack appeared on the screen, and I decided to call it a day. A fantastic phone for the time I had it....well deserving of full burial rights in the back garden XD ;;;;;Near made it to the 2 year mark but sadly the touch screen has stopped working around the corners. Pretty good but really I wanted it to last a bit longer...;;;;;Almost two years have passed and it still working fine. No problems with the tap screen, nothing. Very satisfied wity vodafone.;;;;;Lmao, same ;;;;;best budget smart phone ever - had it for 2 years and it never went wrong - safe FAM!!;;;;;Got that phone two years ago. It was good value for its money, having a 1080p screen, but as it turns out its not particularly reliable.  I have started having issues with the touch screen - parts of it sometimes become unresponsive, usually the left-most quarter of the screen. The interface glitches sometimes, closing all apps constantly to the extend that it makes the phone unusable. Even though its a cheap phone, I expected more longevity from it.;;;;;Same problems as the others with the touch screen. It's so annoying. Don't buy this phone.;;;;;started off as a great phone with a great camera, but after less than a year parts of the screen wouldn't work so some letters didn't work on my keyboard, and then two out of three of the main buttons on the bottom of the screen broke, so it quickly became very frustrating to use.;;;;;Oh dear me...part of touch screen failed after 10 months, preventing part of the keyboard working. Took it to Vodafone for repair, who examined the externals very closely and found NO damage (I always kept in a case covering back and front of phone) before sending for repair. Vodafone now tell me the fix is chargeable (£70+) despite still being well within warranty. This phone is built to a price, as are it's successors (Smart Ultra 7 and on). I wouldn't choose this phone or it's successors if I was buying again...specs good, great when it's working, but simply not robust enough for my real world use. My experience of Vodafone after sales service is worse than disappointing... A 4* phone, with Vodafone after sales customer service more like an abdication than a service;;;;;Hi Did you manage to resolve your issue with network error as i seem to be receiving the same message;;;;;Hi all, I recently purchased a smart ultra 6 and i am pretty happy with it. I am experiencing a problem when attempting to update the Software (OS) to marshmallow; after downloading it via the software update window on the phone, the phone refuses to install and states a mismatch. Did anyone encounter such a problem and how did you fix it? My baseband is : P839V55B01 Kernel version: 3.10.49 Build number: VDF-995NB01-IT09b (I suppose the IT means Italy)

;;;;;Does anyone know why Ultra 6 stops support selfie stick from March 17? I can't use my selfie stick any more.;;;;;Dear vodafone smart ultra 6 user in my phone the storage is also 11.16gb after upgrade. regards;;;;;To answer my question from the previous post, I have now been told by someone who has done the upgrade that the storage space available is the same on Marshmallow i.e 11.16GB;;;;;Hi, Please can someone who has upgraded their Smart Ultra 6 to Marshmallow 6.0.1 tell me what the Total Space size is for the Internal Storage after the upgrade. Currently with 5.1.1 it's 11.16GB. Thanks, Mark;;;;;Steve corrected that statement. It is of course the newer Smart Ultra 7 that is made by Alcatel (and is not as good).;;;;;That's a Marshmallow feature, storage is handled differently, not a fan.;;;;;Same problem, 'standard home screen stopped' repeatedly after upgrade. Did you find a fix?;;;;;device supports any network simcard but its only one sim;;;;;Does it let any SIM card to work or only vodafone SIM ? Can i replace sd card with second SIM ?;;;;;What do You think is better,hwawei p8 lițe or Vodafone Smart ultra 6?;;;;;That is probably because your phone's internal memory got full. There are some applications that use phone's internal memory as their default storage. Email services, and Whatsapp are the common ones, you may need to clear up the contents to free some more space. Please note internal memory is not the RAM (currently goes up to max 4GB in high-end phones), it is the storage (usually comes with over 16GB space in new phones).;;;;;There is a Android 6.0 update. I received a notification today and updated my ultra 6 to marshmallow.;;;;;I have the sane issue since the update last week. Surely I'm missing something - my phone is now constantly telling me I've no space yet my SD card is virtually empty. So angry as I got rid of my previous phone for this very reason and have had no bother at all with the smart ultra 6 til the last update!!;;;;;I tried to update my Fone wen it finished uploading & I went to install d package a lot of writing came up and said reboot etc I cudnt get d new update 😞 why is dis;;;;;Yes, no option to format the SD as internal storage, despite what the Vodafone website tells you. Vodafone help was also pretty useless - the box there got me to do a factory reset. Didn't work, but the upside to Marshmallow is that my battery life has improved enormously. ;;;;;That must be why it has 'Made in China by ZTE' stamped on the back. :-) ;;;;;Yup, same here;;;;;Updated it yesterday to 6.0.1 ...since then i can´t install any apps on my sd card...did it happened to you aswell? regards Diogo;;;;;I have this phone since August 2015, And it's Awesome! I bought it with point promotion from vodafone. costed only 90Â at the time. Damn Octa core, 2gb, ram, 13mpx camera, 16gb rom. Super for that price there would be nothing better. The only cons I have is that the camera is a bit slow to shoot. Besides that everything top. It falled maaaaany times... Really.. and it's completely functional, just some scratches. Screen is perfect too. Very nice build. I would buy a next model that was just good as this. (not the su7, its not that good) And now with marshmallow I think I'll have this phone for more a couple of years.;;;;;Excellent phone, have used this for 15 months, still working well. Upgraded to Android 6.0.1 last night without issues, compares very favourably with my experience of Samsung phones. Incidentally my phone is unlocked and I'm on 3, so very happy I still get android updates (including security updates).;;;;;upgraded yesterday, anyone else having major battery issues loosing 1% every 5mins approx.;;;;;The upgrade process for Marshmallow is a little cumbersome but all then same the new update is a nice reminder I'll probably not need a new phone for at least 3 years. The phone is top notch.;;;;;Not impressed with new SD card options with Marshmallow, had to do lots of fiddling about to move apps to card and still having problems, bit of a backwards move from Android this.;;;;;got the new 6.0.1 update today for smart ultra 6 and its not working right  it keeps coming with  standard home screen has stoped whent in to the store and found out i was not the only one they had 5 more with the same thing. and no help file on web site and not much help form on lone asistance;;;;;Android 6.0.1 is now live ;;;;;For those who are interested, I have just upgraded my vodafone smart ultra 6 from lolipop to marshmellow.;;;;;It is a good phone.After two years works perfect.No lag,no problem.;;;;;hi all;I got this smartphone since December 2015,,,,,,,so far I didn't have any problem with;it works absolutly great,,,I reccomand.;;;;;and yet it fits an iphone case ...;;;;;I must apologize. I gave a few bad reviews regarding the Vodafone Smart Ultra 6. I was originally very disappointed with this phone. After about 3 month of frustration I decided to go directly to the customer care and explained my problem with phone. They checked or tested the phone and after a few days, they swoped it and gave me a new one. Since then, it's about two months now, I have'nt had any problems.;;;;;I have had the Vodafone Smart Ultra 6 for nearly 1.5 years, and it has been a fantastic phone. Perhaps I have just gotten lucky, but all of the negative reviews I read about it are completely different from my experience. Some of the reviews don't seen to take into account the price. This phone (when new) cost about 25% of comparable big-name handsets. Of course so many people foolishly forget about price because they spread the cost out over a 2 year contract, which is frankly just poor financial practice. I have dropped this phone more times than I care to admit, but luckily it has not been affected apart from some scratches on the corners. I use my phone *constantly* - I listen to music and podcasts all day, make many calls and texts, do web searches and watch videos, and in the evening I play games on it. The battery has obviously weakened over time, but it still lasts through my work day until I get home, which I find very impressive given its age, and the very heavy use it gets every day.  Of course there are some minor issues, mainly that the OS has become slow with age, however I think this is because it needs to be wiped and freshly installed (when I get around to it). But I have less trouble then my family and friends, who all have Samsung, Sony, and Motorola phones (costing much more than this phone did!) All around, I consider this phone to be one of the best purchases I have ever made, of any kind!;;;;;I have one of these which I use in France, Asia and Australia. The biggest problem I have had is that i don't think the antenna is very good.  Away from cities in Australia, using identical Sims, my wife's iPhone 4 often picked up a good signal whereas I picked up none at all. Otherwise I am pretty happy with this phone.;;;;;Nicely put agree with you great phone for the price I bought mine for £90 brand new had no problems with it does everything I need value for money compared with how much you pay for a iPhone or galaxy.;;;;;I thought it was made by zte but OK anyway will it get the 6.0.1 update;;;;;I have a Vodafone Ultra 6 using Android 5.1.1. Does anyone know if I can update to 6.0? The phone is unlocked and NOT with Vodafone. I've tried the phone's 'online update' feature but it keeps coming back with 'network error' message. Thanks for your comments.;;;;;It looks nothing like an iPhone ;;;;;Pressing pause in the call it will doping what tou want...;;;;;I loved this phone, sadly I dropped it a few months after buying. I still used it for a year with the whole screen cracked that's how great the phone was wish I could have it back.;;;;;Yes the battery is great, lasts ages, the weak points are think are the camera and no Gorilla Glass, good phone though.;;;;;I bought this phone in February 2016, and being a teenager, I used it a lot. It was my main source of contact. I use it for Snapchat, Instagram, Kik, Twitter, everything. I fell in love with it at first sight because of its massive screen (size of an iPhone 6s+ and not far off the iPhone 7!) I remember asking for the price and it was £120! It was like heaven on earth! Sadly, within the first week I was having problems! Of course, being a teenager, I text - A LOT. I had an unlimited texts, 150 minutes worth of calls and 500mb of data, I managed to use the unlimited texts up (um, excuse me? UNLIMITED??) I paid for unlimited and got 1000? I've been to Vodafone several times in many places and never once have they sorted it out: "bar in your number" "We'll sort it, wait 24 hours". What a load of rubbish. Never worked. So apart from terrible service and bundles, I had problems with the speed of the device.. "Snapdragon".. More like SNAPTURTLE. If you want quick access to an app or want to answer a text quickly - THIS IS NOT THE PHONE FOR YOU. It takes me several attempts of restarting my phone and going in and out of apps before I can actually physically reply to somebody. Not to mention: app crashings; phone taking control of itself. I bought the phone in February and already wanted a new one in August. I hate it so much! Don't get me wrong, the size and price is exquisite, so is the camera - I love the camera! Amazing flash, so many lovely comments on my photos on how my quality is good! But if I go into Snapchat for example: it crashes!
