Isn't it?;;;;;Got this phone this morning and i would say its on top of everything considering the price. Thanks vodafone for making this phone available.;;;;;Will buy this phone or asus zone 2 please replay which one is batter;;;;;No. Go into Options, Storage, three dots in the corner, USB computer connection, turn MTP on.;;;;;Hello! How to connect the cable to the smart ultra 6.  You need some software?;;;;;After disappointment with my Sony z5c I sent it back and bought this to put me on till Nexus 5x arrives. Cannot fault it except bit to big for me. Does everything even camera results are more acceptable than z5c . On my box it does state it accepts a 128gb card which is great just stuck mine in out of z5c for now. Nice bright screen always available 3 android touchscreen buttons lit in blue. In fact it could look like iPhone 6 plus if your budget is low and want a lookalike. How they built all this lot for 125GBP is amazing.It even has NFC because on set up process is said tap to exchange data off other android which is NFC action and yep it has it.Vodafone could be subsidising this I suppose,it even has 3000mA battery. Easy a 400GBP sim free device.;;;;;Picked this up 2 weeks ago after my Xperia Z3 screen cracked. Can't say I've noticed any real difference in the quality between the 2 considering the price. Very few complaints and they're only niggly stuff (no proximity sensor for calls etc). For the price you pay, this is an absolute bargain.;;;;;Just a heads up, the Android version is 5.02 but the phone runs smoothly and the price product balance is really good. The headset that you receive with the phone is bad quality, I am using my old in ear headset.The GPS runs great, I have installed the latest NFS-NL, Corridor Z, Clash of Clans and Dead Trigger 2 and all are running great. The battery life time is not that great even though it is a 3000 maph. The 4G runs properly and the signal antenna is fine.;;;;;If you buy it online from vodafone website, you will only pay £125. No £10 topup is needed if you buy it online. Select keep using my own sim at the bottom and you will be good to go. ;;;;;I have HTC one m8, but wanted to get Vodafone Smart Ultra 6 for my mum. i think Vodafone is out of stock.  i didn't see it on the shelf. where is the best place to buy it from which is in stock not paying more then £125.;;;;;Have this phone for few days now. Does not get 'hot' but sometime after heavy use, it gets little bit warm around the camera but that is perfectly normal. About the lag, it depends on what mobile phone you had before. If you ask me, this phone does not lag as such. Given the price, its the fastest phone. Even Galaxy s6 lags now and then. I do not have any complains about lagging. Excellent screen. Best battery life i have ever had from any mobile phone. Cameras are surprisingly good. Excellent selfies but in low light, main camera is a bit average. Overall its a great mobile phone. In £99 i have a 13mp autofocus cam, 3000mah battery, 5.5" fhd lcd, 5mp front cam, mem card option. All sounds too good to be true but it is.;;;;;Does the phone lag or get very HOT? And how is the battery life? I heard its the best budget phone in UK?;;;;;excellent value for money better than Iphone 6 not tied to apple . ,lightweight ,big memory ,excellent sound system ,great camera updateable. over all excellent phone buy it now.;;;;;No, it does not have a gyroscope sadly.;;;;;I've not found it easy to scratch. Screen is quite resilient, and has coating to resist fingerprints. It is not gorilla glass to my knowledge, but certainly OK.;;;;;It has NFC, USB HOST etc. Screen can be relatively easily scratched. Beautiful phone. Up to 128gb Micro SD. Currently upgradeable to Android 5.0.2.;;;;;Their are two colours available, from my voda store. You can unlock device, it seems to be a zte. It is better than iPhone 6 plus, camera by far better. Plus you get NFC, for touch and pay...if voda have sorted that out and not insist on you sticking a tag on their NFC enabled phones??;;;;;Their are two colours avail;;;;;Vodafone smart ultra 6 300$, Samsung Galaxy A7 510$, Htc desire 820 430$, Sony M4 aqua 370$. There is no chinese phone with snapdragon 615 in turkey. ;;;;;Only app lock don't work with this phone its security issue it need to be fix you can't secured your photo or videos;;;;;No;;;;;No there is only one colour;;;;;Lags in transitions. Anyone else experiencing it? Otherwise the display is gorgeous. Hope it gets an update to marshmallow.;;;;;I got it from Vodafone NZ too, but it was free on a plan. I'm actually really happy with it. Value for money it's exceptional. One pleasant thing worth mentioning is that it supports OTG out of the box, so I can mount my USB thumb drives. Makes sharing stuff around a bit easier. No other phones in this price range with a big display, plenty of power, good battery, lots of storage options AND 4G/LTE. I was looking at an S6, but for $900 more I couldn't justify the spend just so I can brag about having the most expensive phone. It's a no-brainer. 4.5/5! If it supported the 700mhz LTE band and had a sturdier build quality I'd give it a 5.;;;;;thanks, has the LED have only 1 colour (blue) or multicoloured?;;;;;go into storage nd click top right to see option to enable to connect to the comp as a USB.  so you can transfer ;;;;;Have you tried tapping build in settings about to get into developer mode and enable usb debugging? - might work;;;;;can I unblock it because I want to use it in another country, please?;;;;;What is the screen made of?  There is no detail re the screen glass above.  ;;;;;Not really sure about airdroid, call me critical and cautious, but i really dont like giving 3rd party apps my details/letting them view files etc. google cloud photos are probably almost the same, but at least google is large international company. ;;;;;how or where do I get one to buy in Ghana. place ;;;;;First of all, Turkey comes installed with version 5.0.2. You can't see the percentage of battery remaining. Modified according to Vodafone the SMS part. 3 GB of RAM and Processor Speed should be 2000 MHz.The graphics card in games can be weak. You need to update the phone version 5.1.1.;;;;;Thanks.. but how it going? i mean pulse...;;;;;Same here;;;;;yeah it does have the circle led on phone glows;;;;;That's in dollars and why is over priced when its got middle range specs. phone_reviews:
;;;;;google how to unlock your cell phone,   i unlocked my one for free cos its over a year old,    theres a code that you have to put into ya fone,   was easy as once i found it on google, ;;;;;My mobile networks are blocked what should I do;;;;;Hello.I have an vodafone smart prime 6 with touchscreen broken.I find only in Romania service to change the broken touchscreen at this site servicetelefoane.ro;;;;;Best phone for the money I have spent on it with a contract on Vodafone Romania. Great battery time, great signal. Over 5 days with one hour of internet daily, 10 hours bluetooth and 2-3 hours of conversation. Great camera on daylight also, never blocked to need restart in one year of daily business usage. ;;;;;This phone is amazing. i have had it since November 2015 and it is worth the money. Also to ANYONE who is looking for a phone too root then this is a good device i rooted my phone 1 month after i got this. No problems. i have my own custom boot animation and other root apps and it still runs fine. (I use KingRoot) If you do root, you WILL loose your guarantee.  Pros: 1. Its Fast (for a budget phone 2. Its Cheap 3. Vanilla Android (No Skins like Samsung) 4. Big HD Screen 5. Good Camera for 8MP 6. Feels Comfy 
7. The battery lasts 2 days of constant use. 
8. Easy to root (Avoids Warranty) 
9. Very Responsive Screen 
10. Very Bright Screen
 
Cons:  
1. Can be laggy from time to time 
2. Not That much Storage (For me as i like heavily detailed games) 
3. 1GB ram (not enough to play new 2016 heavy games) 
4. It is not Virtual Reality Ready (needs Gyroscope)
 
Overall i am still stunned by this phone. I love Android.  
I REALLY recommend this phone for IOS or new users to get as it is cheap and can help you understand how to use Android;;;;;Am in uganda my phone failed to read sim cards  and when I tried to reset it failed to switch on, it stop on powered by Android. What is likely problem ;;;;;Great phone had two ... For one reason .... I like them fragile screens tho ;;;;;Is the Vodafone smart grand a good phone compared to the Vodafone smart prime 6;;;;;Great phone it has the snapchat filters, which I know some phones don't work with, it has worked well for me. Also it holds charge really well like once it reaches 5% it lasts for 5-10 mins for me sometimes.;;;;;I tried the smart 6 ss it looked a good buy. How wrong can you be. The phone takes me back to the very early smart phones that tried to take on Iphone. Its poor in just about every respect and typical of badly designed cheap alternatives (like this) the thought given to the user experience is non existant. Fill a small plastic case with cheap electronic components. Stick a screen on (cheap as poss) make it a phone using Android and sell it as a smart phone. Really avoid this phone. Its a waste of your time and your money.;;;;; ;;;;;Me neither.  Very happy with it.;;;;;Had the phone over 6 months and will change back to iphone.  The Bluetooth is particularly bad especially in the car (new Merc) whilst the wife's phone works perfectly as did my old phone. The device keeps hanging and very small memory.  All in all have decided enough is enough and its getting changed.;;;;;I must be the exception, I have never had a problem with mine;;;;;each time my web and text freebe ends whatever i have as credit vanishes after 3-4 texts and this happens again and again. The last time yesterday i had £8.92 credit. I made several local texts and my credit dropped to £3.62. Boy what a stunner!;;;;;I love it :p;;;;;Have this phone for almost a year now. had to replace the stock sms app cuz of sluggishness, and thats about it. Overall, great phone for its price.;;;;;hate it hate it hate it. Such a frustrating phone to use,  sluggish and constantly hangs.   I'm sure this phone will end up flying out the window soon.  You really do get what you pay for sometimes.;;;;;This phone stopped charging after a month and was replaced by Voda - they are forcing me to take second hand products now despite the fact this is against the CGA.  It's a nightmare, the second voda model they gave me also had issues with the homescreen disappearing - their branded models are crap;;;;;It has all been said before..this is the most awful phone I ever had. The specs are so bad that spotify can't play a song without crackling sound and hickups via Bluetooth. The combi processor and memory is dramatic. If only calling is what you want than it could do (barely) but anything actions towards a smartphone are a pain in the rear.;;;;;Phone is pointless can't for the life of me view my pictures in the gallery as they don't show up even though they show up on my laptop, rang Vodafone to complain and got nowhere only called madam when I'm a man and then they hung up tried Twitter useless to and so is their web help Vodafone are useless. ;;;;;Well we have one for more than a year. And sins the android software has been updated its working much faster and also works very fast on wifi now.. And sound has been improved as well. For a phone that's only $125. It works very well. And is still the most sold phone in the Vodafone range. ;;;;;Rubbish loudspeaker sound, bottom part of digitizer works rubbish also, donț buy this brick;;;;;A pile of dung use it as a spare and in fairness it does tide me over. but it's v.slow, camera doesn't always save pics. doesn't have enough power to open videos at times (instagram) really just an emergency phone;;;;;Threw mine in the bin within 2 weeks of receiving it. A truly awful phone.;;;;;I take photos but when I check my folder it's saying nothing is in the file?;;;;;Touch problem it has been broken and half of de touch is not working;;;;;Yeah im having the same problem and only got it last week.. On my second phone!!!;;;;;The battery is non removable on smart prime 6;;;;;The is non removable on smart prime 6;;;;;Yep I think its rubbish how you can't move things over to your sd card and when you try you end up doubling up on items like your music and photos.Now and then my fone flickers on and off then I have to shut the fone down then start up again to get it running. Value for money?? I DOUBT IT!!!;;;;;Totally agree!! Can't move anything to sd card when you try it doubles up what your trying to move to your sd card. eg:music, photos. Not the best is all I can say. Value for money?? I DOUBT IT!!!;;;;;my son has had this phone for nearly a year, and has never had a problem with it of any kind. I would thoroughly recommend it to anyone looking for a low to mid range inexpensive phone, it has a great screen for the price, and is user friendly.;;;;;must be a last-grasp HTC mobile;;;;;I totally agree, brutal rubbish phone, keeps freezing, switching itself on and off, only have it 6 months and it's been rubbish from the first day.  DON'T BUY IT!!;;;;;I have this phone for 9 months.  Its not great.  I have to shut it down several times a day as it constantly freezes and I cannot answer calls.  It is very slow.  I have cleared nearly everything off the phone.  So its not loaded with apps.  Would not recommend it.  Also will not restart sometimes, just get a blank screen;;;;;anybody know why it keeps saying network error retry when i have wifi,only just got it and havent a clue i,ve tried everything would be grateful for an answer  thank you;;;;;this phone is only a basic phone .;;;;;Well this phone is absolute rubbish. First it has a micro SD card slot yet you cannot move anything to the sdcard and 2; the battery is NOT removable for Â110 it is rubbish .At least with my old phone Huawei y 550 I could move things to the sdcard .the only way to move things is to remove sdcard insert into a computer then pug phone into the computer and copy from phones internal memory to the sdcard a lot of hassle for such a highly praised iPhone clone ;;;;;i have same phone mines been ok for last 6 months x;;;;;I got my phone 4 days ago & its already freezing all the time and I gotta run the phone out of battery until it can unfreeze because I don't wand to reboot it and lose all my stuff. Love the camera but that's about it;;;;;My phones screen not working n i cant even turn it off...so wat can i do;;;;;My phones screen not working n i cant even turn it off...so wat can i do;;;;;I brung my vodafone 895N from new Zealand to Australia.... and i have no reception.... can someone help me please;;;;;Phone has locked and no helpful advice from Vodafone store or help line. Connect phone to computer was mentioned but store couldn't do it. Why?;;;;;Bad phone have 2gb left due to sim card and apps and phone still slow camera doesn't work sometimes sometimes work good other times wait 5 minutes for thing to load. Not a good phone but it is cheap enough so can't complain;;;;;Take note that it is upgrade-able to Android 5.1;;;;;I get 9 hours screen on time on a single charge, can easily last me two days if I do basic housekeeping, even longer if I become meticulous. Try disabling radios when you're not using them, dropping your screen brightness (take it off Auto), clearing recent apps when you put your phone away for a while, and let WiFi go to sleep while your phone "sleeps".;;;;;Proximity sensor is located between front speaker and front camera.;;;;;I have no idea what you have been doing with your phone, I've had this phone almost a year and I have had none of the problems you have mentioned. So slow and sluggish? What apps are you putting on it? If you're loading the phone up with your Facebook rubbish and chock full of mobile games that constantly play ads, push notifications and consume power in the background, then of course it will run terribly. Do you manage your storage properly, not letting it get too full, do you clear your recent apps when the phone gets a bit slow? Did you even run software updates when you got it? Sounds like you did none of this. Protip, no phone "just werks", not even an iPhone or a Sony or whatever brand you like to mention, they all have bugs, they all get updates shortly after release to fix problems, and all companies botch releases or have the odd faulty unit. "Spend a bit more money buying a proper brand" Saying this has made you sound so silly. Alcatel or TCT Mobile is a proper brand, and they make more than phones. Take your snobbery and ineptness elsewhere.;;;;;I don't get what people are talking about, I've never had a problem with this phone, has never overheated, never freezes, doesn't "black out" whatever that means, runs smoothly for me, apart at the beginning where it just needed updating. And not once do I need to restart it during the day. @LN;;;;;What Elain said, slow, sluggish blacks out, wont action commands until minutes later.  One word.. Rubbish!;;;;;Hi you have to hold the turn on botton.on the side next to the volume.. for a few seconds maybe more then it will reboot.Also i found out that if you dont remove stuff that you have been looking at it will drain battery.t do that push the square button and swipe off .;;;;;This phone is dreadful, I'm going to bin it and spend a bit more money buying a proper brand. I have to restart it several times during the day, it's sooooooooooooooo slow and sluggish, freezes far too often, doesn't respond to commands, basically useless. DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE, SERIOUSLY. How do I reset phone?;;;;;love this phone being using it for a while. thank you;;;;;can you get the screen fixed anywhere?;;;;;there are no proper instructions in the box, so I have to go back to the shop.;;;;;I bought one and it won't read Sim it sucks I have go get a blank Sim and try it this not cool because I kinda threw everything out no proof of purchase and I don't even know my number everything else work perfectly ;;;;;Bought it 5 months ago. It is worth the money, although the battery drains a bit fast. I have a problem with the new update and i cant connect to 4g networks, but even with 3g, this phone is worth the money. The cpu runs quite good, it is very smooth on the menus and it has a very good camera. The only problem is that its internal storage is mounted as sdcard0, and as a result you cant install apps on external sd. Im very happy with this phone and i am not going to replace it any time soon....;;;;;Is it waterproof? ;;;;;Can't use it..;;;;;I brought this phone a couple days back and I absolutely love it yes the camera could have been better but I got it for a really good price brand new I love it a lot compared to my other one which was a huawai asscend which I did not like ;;;;;the phone looks ok, nice design and quite light, the battery is pretty long lasting, good quality calls, be it phone or other apps, loud speakers and that's pretty much all good about it. it comes with a shitload of preinstalled apps. doesnt have the option to reorganise the menu items and i even had problems downloading apps on it. for example at some point it said it downloaded an app for 2-3 hours and it was just a 25mb one and my internet speed was good. doesnt let me move some apps on the sd card for no apparent reason camera is claimed to be 8mp. either it's not or (most-likely) the compression is too big and it makes the pictures look rather grainy  it also doesnt have the option to move or copy my contacts to and from the phone and SIM card. this can only be done individually. When it wants it can move pretty ok, including the internet surfing and the switch between apps (not too fast but at least gets the job done), but I had it freeze so many times and generally fuck up everything that I preferred to open my laptop to reply to a fb message. My advice would be to save some more money and buy a better phone. This one is cheap and non-reliable, and I'm not saying it's cause it is a Vodafone phone, as from my experience the quality is pretty much directly proportional with the money spent, regardless of brand.;;;;;I blame myself for buying this in a rush when I was broke instead of waiting an extra week and buying a proper one. As mentioned in the above comments the camera is terrible, however what do you expect for this price. The main problem is that the normal telephone functions are very poor. I don't care if the camera is shit but if I have to struggle everytime I use the phone it doesn't really work...;;;;;I bought this brand new and I could tell within ten minutes that this phone is some bullshit they threw together at the last minute, while wearing blindfolds! I never have 4G internet even though I paid for it and every area I am in has 4G coverage. I called Vodafone yesterday and they said they would fix it within 24 hours but it still says H+ when it should say 4G! Wtf is going on?! This phone is literally slower than my moms four year old Motorola RAZR M!!! This phone is garbage!;;;;;You can't remove the battery in smart prime 6;;;;;So slow charging phone, worst camera and I don't recommend tu buy this phone;;;;;Cheap and basic but even at that not worth the money. Spend an extra few quid and get something better. BIG DISAPPOINTMENT!!!;;;;;ive owned this phone for 6 months, its very slow and freezes when using large apps such as facebook, messenger, instagram, and snapchat. its ok for the price though.;;;;;Hi Savanna, This freezing of the screen happens to me, very occasionally. I have been able to re-start my phone without having to wait for the battery to go flat. This may be of some assistance to you. The following link shows two methods to re-start, I have only been able to try Method 2:  Method #1 involves removing the battery, waiting a few seconds and then replacing the battery and re-starting the phone from the power button. However, the battery in my handset is not removeable. Consequently, I use Method #2....... The method that this link demonstrates, involves you holding down two buttons on the side of the phone until the re-start process starts. It feels like a very long time but it is only 10 (real) seconds, so be patient. The link shows you which two buttons to hold down. 
Good luck.
 
Downunder Dave
;;;;;The blue LED at the top left corner of the handset has two functions: 1) When connected to a charging lead, the LED lights up to tell you that your phone is being charged. 2) When you receive a text or eMail AND you have the LED Notifications option set to ON, the blue LED will flash about once every on and off about five seconds. ;;;;;does anyone know what to do to open a mms on this phone? ;;;;;I got this phone 2 years ago and it was completely crap .It was lagging from the first day, it doesn't have a flash so I switched to huawei p8 lite which is a much much much better option;;;;;I do have a Vodafone smart first 6 I know the camera is not the best but would like to know how to transfer the photos from the phone to my computer ;;;;;Don't buy it coz it's crap, you would be wasting ur money. It gets worse as the months go. It's quite a problem.:-@;;;;;What did you expect from a phone that only cost £30? You make no sense.;;;;;Crap, avoid if possible.  I was originally looking for a specific cheap smart phone which my friend had purchased at Asda. Hers was cheap and cheerful at £40 , and worked remarkably well. Unfortunately, that particular phone had sold out, so I decided to spend that £40 on this instead.  Big mistake. Was glitchy from the get go, including on basic call/text functions. Most incoming calls cause the screen to freeze, by the time it unfreezes, I've missed the call.  Camera is crap.  Keyboard is crap (and has these weird, inefficient glitches). Memory is crap.  Touch screen can be crap.  Speed is crap.  
And battery is most definitely crap. 
 
If I knew all of this, I would not have wasted my money..which could have gone towards a better phone, or on the cheap and cheerful alternative I originally set out to purchase. 
 
Add that onto the fact that the Voda pay and ho network is also a pile of crap, and here we have the most recent and persistent bane of my life. 
 
Never buying Voda hardware again, and never opting into the network again either. 
 
Why are they even in business? Leave it to the pros, yo.

The Android version is compatible (why I bought it).;;;;;Hi Barracuda, To delete a contact from your phone's Contacts list do the following: 1) Open the Contacts app 2) Scroll to the entry that you want to delete 3) Select the person's name, not their picture/icon. This will bring up a panel showing all of that person's details (phone numbers, eMail, street address etc.). 4) Select the phone's Menu button. IMPORTANT: This is the right-most button of the three printed buttons at the bottom of the phone, and which looks like an empty square. Selecting this button will cause a pop-up menu to appear. 5) Select Delete from the pop-up menu. You will then be asked to confirm that this entry should be deleted. I hope that this helps. 
Downunder Dave.;;;;;Hi Angry User, I suspect that if you are not getting more than 2-hours running time from a 100% charged phone, the battery may be faulty and you should return the unit to whoever you purchased it from. If after charging for a few hours and not doing anything with the phone, just letting it charge, the phone does not show 100% in the top right hand corner of the screen, there is either a problem with the battery or the wall socket supplying the power. Try charging the phone on someone else's cable and wall socket and see if that makes a difference. I reckon that the Smart First 6 is a pretty good, entry level phone for its price. As for whether it is user-friendly or not, a lot of that is down to the Android operating system. If this is your first Android device it may take a few days to get used to. Try and find someone else with an Android phone and look for help there, that is what I did. I hope that this helps. Downunder Dave.;;;;;Colette, You can download the English version of the manual for this phone (Vodafone Smart first 6) as a .pdf from:  or  In the past when these manuals have been distributed with the boxed phone they have been so small that they are hardly readable without a magnifying glass, so the .pdf ends up as a better option.  I hope that this might help you recover your phone from the Christmas dustbin....... 
Good luck,

Shane peacefromabove@clear.net.nz  ;;;;;Does anyone kow if i can update this phone to android 5.0 lollipop ?;;;;;U can just turn airplane mode on and then go into settings and put WiFi on.;;;;;Same phone as Alcatel S7. Smart Phone Power says it's Alcatel 985N. UK : I prefer European budget brands as  Alcatel as the LTE & 3G chips works better. I've had budget Chinese Huawei G535 Kestrel two times, both times poor LTE, 3G. I had better 3G than Huawei with cheap Alcatel Pop C1, SPop. Alcatel CHEAP TO UNLOCK £1 on eBay. Sony, Blackberry £15-£30 to unlock.
 
Alcatel my favourite budget phone brand.
 
3000MAH battery on Smart 4 Power makes it the best phone on the market for battery life : 
because it's screen is just 940*560, processor just quad core 1.2ghz. 
This is fine by me as I'm not power user. 
I bought it because of battery life and 5inch screen.
 
Really like 5 inch screen. Get WHOLE 5 inches cause home button is on the bezel not on screen. 
Eg. Sony looses 1/2 inch cause home button is on the screen on Sony's.
 
Front camera is just VGA 0.3MP it should have been at least 1MP. 
Storage just 4GB it should have been 8GB. 
Can add storage by microsd.
 
NFC really like which is unusual in a budget phone.
 
Was £80 from Vodafone now £100. 
£55 grade B & £60 grade A from CEX Entertainment Exchange. I bought mine from CEX grade B.
 
My favorite 4G budget phone is this smart 4 power.
 
The only phone I would exchange Smart 4 Power Alcatel S7 for is Alcatel S9 which has full 6 inch screen, HD screen, 2Mp front camera, 3400MAH battery.




;;;;;Does anyone know if this phone can be updated to Android 5.0 Lollipop? Thanks.;;;;;Kingo root worked for me. Tried it a few months ago with no luck but worked on 2nd attempt a few weeks ago. Must have been updated and now supports this model!;;;;;Does anyone know which rooting applications will root this device  ? I have already tried several but still no luck. Any solutions? Thanks.;;;;;how do you delete messages without deleting completed threads and all messges?;;;;;Dial *#*#4636#*#* choose phone information then lower click turn off radio and you can use your Wi-Fi...to turn back on, do the same... ;;;;;A minor CON Power button right below volume button. The number of times I've accidentally pressed power and put Smart 4 Power to sleep when I merely wanted to change volume. ;;;;;Another PRO 4G LTE CAT 5 = 150mbps download  (theoretically max 18.75MB MegaBytes a second that's like six 3minute videos a second)  / 50mbps upload  (theoretically max 6.25MB MegaBytes a second that's like two 3min videos a second) HSDPA + 42mbps download  (theoretical max 5.25MB MegaBytes a second that's like one and half 3min videos a second);;;;;Bought the power 5 inch a week ago Nov 30 2014. PRO + Price : cheapest 5 inch on the market by far + Proper 5 inch screen : get whole 5 inches with Android buttons outside screen on the bezel. Better than Sony, Lg, Samsung, Huawei 5inch as they all loose 1/2 inch cause android buttons on the screen taking up 1/2 inch so they all are actually 4.5 inch. + 3000MAH battery : 4 days standby, 2-3 days normal use, 12hours continual video on YouTube. + NFC : very useful but keep it turned off until required to save battery. + Very little bloatware.
 
CON
 
-Low screen resolution : not even HD but this helps battery life last long 
-Low quad core processor mediatek : its not snapdragon, not even 64bit snapdragon 410. But this helps battery life. 
-Low graphics Mali400 : cheap tablets have this. But this helps battery life. 
-VGA 0.3 MP front camera : not even 1MP , eveb video chat is unclear. 
-Speakers low : even full volume. 
-4GB storage : cmon that is pants 8GB is cheap 
-32GB max microSD capacity: cmon with just 4GB storage, atleast 64GB microSD was required.


 
Summar 
Best low cost phone for someone that wants looong battery life, large screen. 
And is not a gamer nor power user.

phone_reviews: ;;;;;Not to be rood dude but all smartphones ive had the pleasure of using do the clock thing - sorry for the camera and calculator problems, but thats pretty much just your phone. Lag will happen to all smartphones, from what I've seen as far as to the ones with 1gb ram. Im pretty positive its something to do with the software, the camera thing  Also why not get a newer model now - 6 has 1 gb ram and 2mpx front camera, and autofocus, and is in about the same price range, or free with a plan. ;;;;;I was given this phone by a friend after my S6 fell in a pallet crusher at work. To start on a good note , it works. Calls texts Facebook WhatsApp ect all work jolly well. Camera is better quality than I expected with regards to picture , but getting it to work is another story. It often tells me camera is unavailable even after I close all tabs. The phone is slow and has very little memory , both hard drive and RAM , and many apps I found were rendered useless by the VodaSmart4. I found other niggling problems with the calculator and clock. The clock will stop recording time when the phone is locked using side button. So you lock the screen at 12.30pm it will still display 12.30pm if you check the time 2hrs later. It works as a temporary phone if your good smartphone is out of order and you didn't have to pay for it .. Don't part cash for something that is cheap for a reason.;;;;;Very good phone with so so rear camera and poor front camera;;;;;so its one of the cheapest phones on the market with a 5mp camera and a decent screen. works pretty well with what i need it for even if the 512 ram will quit background apps if the foreground uses too much memory. battery-wise lasts about as much as your average smartphone and its pretty fast on wifi. mine would randomly restart but seriously its a 2/10 price range phone, its not like i can give little money and expect the world. still better than many bootleg smartphones on the market ;;;;;Do not waste your money on this phone. It's slow, freezes & the touch screen works when it wants to. I will never buy a Vodafone again as Vodacom does not stand by their product. I'm still waiting for a call from their useless shop after asking for them to source me a cover. Never again;;;;;Hi my phone is 1months old but blic i don't worked;;;;;does it have a hdmi adaptor;;;;;my phone is 2 days old, i downloaded 2 games ,ashpalt 8 and a small one, cm antivirus and clean master phone booster, i also downloaded 22 songs, and then suddently while i open a game the screen totally freezes and i dont know what to do.i checked if that was caused by lack of space but i had only used half of the phones space.please help i dont know whats going on with my phone.;;;;;YEs it does have one,you can start the camera and it does have an option to switch inbetween them;;;;;it does have a back and front camera i would know i have one;;;;;Can the phone WhatsApp and play games ?;;;;;good,this phone offers great features;;;;;Its good, except tying space is too small, its irritating, the camera is poor cant take pics at nite and cannot download flashplayer;;;;;Utter nonsense. Dies in the middle of the night while on charge. Don't have all kinds of fancy apps running either, just messaging and social media. Freezing when keypad is needed I have to wait for keypad, or 'wipe' three to four times for it to appear. Sometimes call comes in and the touch screen is non-responsive...worst of all, phone is only a month old...;;;;;It does have both a front and back camera.;;;;;Why can't l hear sound when watching English football;;;;;My smart 4 won't play any downloaded ringtones after about 1 hour and keeps going back to the default. Any ideas why?;;;;;it don't have a front camera mate it only got a back camera ;;;;;How many Megapixels does the front camera contain;;;;;Hi guys how do i switch of the womans voice and start useing the touchscrren without her saying what ive touched;;;;;Cover protector in Vodafone shop;;;;;Where can you get gel cover/screen protector for Smart 4.Loads for mini,power and turbo but none for smart 4;;;;;Sorry the answer's late- only just read post. Hold the power button and the volume button in at the same time.;;;;;Someone please help with a stock rom for this phone?;;;;;How can I do screen shot ?;;;;;It is not supported live wallpapers. Why ? Can I augmented the speaker and head set volume with advanced settings? Ex. *#......#* like Vodafone smart mini. ;;;;;4 gb is the phone's memory, but internal files (how it's on pc, windows  files) are 2 gb. You understand now?;;;;;$150;;;;;the vodafone smart 4 model specs for internal memory is actually 2gb not 4gb as clearly indicated on the vodafone website;;;;;minimum price in dollars?;;;;;This phone has autofocus on camera? Because mine doesn't work..;;;;;Yes it is very good movil! such screen so colors much better than iphone's mumbo jumbo moviles;;;;;This phone supurt flash player?;;;;;teri m;;;;;I want to know about this smart phone, is a good movil.?;;;;;helo guys ts me or dis phone dsnt blink when received new msg only show led light when ts charging help lol n don't mind my english;;;;;£40 in argos sale. Good little phone, nice simple file manager, not the complex ES. one.;;;;;mine doesnt even have a year but the power button ain working now m depending on the power schedule for it to turn on and off;;;;;Pls help me I CNT download whatsup;;;;;l have got a smart phone 4 and it is a good phone and we   ;;;;;It Works Fine no issues have it about 9weeks but i do recomend u to get a case for the phone;;;;;hi all of yo. yo now my name. i have a problem with my vodafone it has shut down and i don't now how to figs it.;;;;;hi I have got a flap case cover , when the screen is locked and in my pocket , it jumps to google and vibrates.what could cause this ;;;;;Right finally got it sorted using the advice from Hrym on Vodafone forums (thank you Hrym). First I backed up everything I wanted to keep to my PC. I unmounted and removed the SD card (turn phone off to remove SD card) and then restarted the phone. I followed this by doing a factory reset. I went through setting the phone up again (I think there was an option to download the backup saved on google drive, I selected yes, which was a mistake, as I will explain), when this was all done I tried the update again, it downloaded and done the "Software is checking" scenario again which failed with the "Data Error, Please try again" message (which is obvious to me now, as the downloaded backup from google drive had put the phone back to where it was before the factory reset)....Start Again!!!!! As phone has very little on it, I turned off the backup to google drive (which also wipes the backup saved there), done another factory reset and started again, this time there was no option to download the backup from google drive(obviously), I finished, the setup process then tried the "Software Update" again (it still took a good while to download) but when it finished downloading, it went straight to "software is checking" and low and behold the phone rebooted and done the update (YEEEEHAAAA), I went through the phone setup process again, put the SD card back in and downloaded the apps and games that my son had on it before the update. All is good and everything runs fine, (it seems a little faster now but that could be my imagination). There may be a better way (one that doesnt lose all the settings and I'm sure there is someone on here who would know how), but this worked for me. 
I hope it helps

I would highly recommend getting Nokia Asha 210 or some old Samsung Omnia instead of this one.  You can also use this phone as webcam by plugging it into you computer. I don't think that analogy is going to be too far off base.;;;;;Depends on what the user needs in this phone. 3D benchmarks are pretty awful for this chipset, but CPU benchmarks put this chipset somewhere between the Snapdragon 425 and 625 for performance. If gaming is an incidental concern, the battery sipping nature of this CPU along with it's lower price (compared to the Snapdragon series) actually might make this an interesting choice. Roughly $400 US dollars is a bit steep for these specs, but that monstrous battery might well make this a real option for non gaming folks, especially if they use a camera set that's more than just OK. With a mid to high tier camera, this makes for a social media beast with a good screen, good enough CPU power for most people's everyday tasks, and halfway decent performance with the occasional 3D game. I'm keeping my eyes on this... if for no other reason than maybe getting a social media and media consumption device that won't need constant charging. phone_reviews: ;;;;;What a bummer: NO touchscreen, NO playstore and NO ability (setting) to enable/allow installing apps (apk's) outside of the playstore. Entering the WiFi password with the quirky keyboard was a real horror. No Energizer, this is NOT the way to go. I will probably return it later today for a refund.;;;;;How did you managed to install other apps? There is no option to allow for unknown sources. How to enable it?;;;;;For many people this is all they need. A classic look, a rezistent phone, LTE and UMTS bands, an Android phone with buttons. Who needs an IPhone anymore when you have such a cute phone.;;;;;quad core and 1gb ram is overkill for a phone. They should reduce these and save weight/size. 18mm thickness is too big;;;;;Are they even selling this phone?;;;;;Energizer should have released this phone in 2007, not 2018!;;;;;available in bangladesh?;;;;;Where did you buy it? please;;;;;is it available on AMAZON.COM???;;;;;Where did you buy it?;;;;;ive been using it for a week and it is awesome u can instal any app on google play but it kinda hard sometimes coz d apps are made for touch screen fones. this fone has a built in cursor to accomodate the lack of touch screen;;;;;Where it is avilable ?;;;;;it used android thats means can install whatsapp ... i buy;;;;;This could be great for those who want a phone to be just a phone: water resistant, probably indestructible, Whatsapp support, battery probably lasts 4 days... The bad thing, if not a mistake, is that it's super heavy.;;;;;Man Sonim or Cat will make a real rugged phone not this jokephone.;;;;;wow i want it too.. ;;;;;i want it;;;;;120 EUR for what? even no dedicated memory card slot.;;;;;You can always look elsewhere. There are people who actually want a candybar.;;;;;WoW 120 EUR for what? CPA Hammer Iron 2 cost around 110 and its a touchscreen rugged phone with android and much better specs. ;;;;;I wish that they would create a smarphone of this phone. With 2500-3000Mah battery, 3-4GB RAM, 32GB storage, 8MP camera with 1080p HD  video recording. No larger than 3.0" screen. Then this would a perfect phone.  No any full touschreen phones for me.

phone_reviews: ;;;;;This phone is made by Vernee, its a specswise downgraded Vernee V.;;;;;Thanks!  Never heard of them till your post.  Interesting find.;;;;;its nice to see this kind of phones foucusin in hardwork things its important to see its this phone resist a big drop;;;;;I'm curious who Energizer is using as a manufacturer for their devices.  Anyway, its nice to see more companies focusing on mid-range specs with larger batteries.  There are a lot of consumers who don't want all the bells and whistles, and just want a solid 2-3 day run on a phone.  I have a 3,500 mAh battery in my phone and I can easily get a full day out of it.  I wouldn't doubt that by 2020 we'll be seeing newer battery tech for phones and software that will minimize power usage across all applications and maximize batter life.  I'm willing to bet 4,500-5,000 mAh batteries will be the industry standard in the next 3-5 years.  ;;;;;it is a rebrand/version of Vernee Active   But Vernee comes with 6GB memory and 128GB of storage for 250$;;;;;Haven't you heard the name? It's on par with Varta and Duracell, don't tell me, you haven't heard them either.;;;;;WoW 450 eur for a mediatek CPU and GPU. Its a new trend to outrun apple in pricing with every brand on this god damn forgotten and forbidden world? First Shamesung with their A8 series now this phone with name hard to spell.  Whos next?;;;;;Hahahaha is this serious? 450 euros for a MTK6750 phone? ;;;;;Im even more concern about its name. A mix between an energy drink and a hardcase. Lol. What a name;;;;;No dedicated memory card slot. what is this?

I remember when Xiaomi and Huawei were nobodies in smartphone industry.;;;;;Anyone can build a chip, it's not even a problem. The problem is having 8 A53 cores. And a phone being made by Energizer :p ;;;;;Only reason they hate it is 'cause it's cheap and they love their SD powered premium phones so much. I hate biased fanboys. I have the faster exynos version of Note 8 (which is faster than its SD835 counterpart) and it's not even comparable to Mate 10 pro's 970 nor X's A11 bionic. Ironically, i don't like emui, iOS, and even lagwiz (only reason i got the Note 8 is there's no OnePlus 5T sold here, just online and unless there's local service centers for OP, not gonna get it).;;;;;right, a lot of clowns really generalizes MTK as sh!t when SD does as well with their other gens;;;;;Not really. The problem is it's Helio P25, not Helio X30.;;;;;the problem is mediatek;;;;;it's same for me I even stoped reading the specification of this phone when i saw that it doesn't support AC and sure if so I'm not buying it even if I was looking for something like this ;;;;;Lenovo p2 has better battery perfomance;;;;;If this is correct, it does not support AC WiFi protocols. That would end it for me. You can't release a serious phone in 2018 without AC.;;;;;It should have a lifetime battery and made the record ha ha ha ha lol;;;;;interesting....how about the price?;;;;;It's an aborted version of the S8;;;;;What's next, Duracell Quantum 999X?;;;;;Anyone who thinks Energizer "makes" this phone is a fool.  They have no more to do with the design or manufacturing of this phone than CAT (who makes earth moving equipment) does with the phones baring their name.   The name is on there for marketing purposes only.  If a phone with a big battery comes from a battery company it must be good...  kind of like a rugged phone from CAT must be able to take a beating.  Smart move to capitalize on the average sheeple.    And with both Energizer and CAT there is no real investment other than renting their name out.   That itself is even a small risk, given the fact that these phones will never see the market share or marketing of companies like Apple or Samsung.   So no chance of an epic failure is contained...   unless of course these somehow manage to have exploding batteries (bet Energizer has nothing to with that component either).;;;;;Too bad the processor is pure crapp;;;;;Battery maker made phone? never seen on my country;;;;;is this for real ??? Lol xD;;;;;well this is interesting. Energizer made a smartphone. It should be have a good battery I think lol;;;;;LOL what a  jump 32 GB with 3GB ram or 64GB with 6GB ram.  If the cheaper one cost 360 eur wonder how much will cost the expensive model maybe 500.  But GPU is crap CPU as well i mean mediatek is worst of possible options.  I accept aluminium body but plastic back on a 400 eur phone? Are you crazy? And the battery is as efficient as my granny on bike :-);;;;;So much Impress by this beautiful phone. Specifications are good. 4500mAh battery with P25 should be appreciated, at this price.;;;;;Hmm... is this Energizer company the same as the one that produces batteries? No wonder they put a lot of energy there.;;;;;So you've never heard about Energizer batteries?;;;;;Omg, what a HUGE battery!;;;;;1- Sealed battery. Sorry for that. 2- Compatible with Duracell AA batteries only;;;;;Lol. S8 wannabe from a battery company. Dated P25 instead of efficient SD630 and sizeable battery. Ok....;;;;;wish the battery is replaceable, so that I can use my AA energizer battery for this phone. (sarcasm);;;;;What is this company? A new start-up Chinese brand? This is the first time I am seeing this. :);;;;;Looks good, waiting for Duracell, Camelion, Maxell.. phones;;;;;These estimates are full of sh*t. I never look or trust them, because every seller put whatever he wants. There is no common standard on this. I am pretty sure this phone performs as good as other phones with similar spec.;;;;;Reminder that the Helio P23 and P25 can be as energy efficient as the Snapdragon 625.;;;;;"Talk time	Up to 12 h (3G)" LOL what the...so it will work as if it has a 2500mah battery...
